Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Georgia S
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. We had a quad that included breakfast. We traveled with out teenage son and had plenty of room. Very close to Vatican. A little distant from other sites but the bus and metro are very handy to get to things. Staff was excellent and went that extra step to celebrate my son's birthday!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Okay Location”
Reviews.Author: Lauren and Mike N
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. Small room, nice bathroom. Shutters don't open so no view. Nice, knowledgeable staff. Close to the Vatican but far from many other sights. Close to a metro location though. Many things close early in the area. A lot of designer shops. Breakfast is expensive for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Charming with character”
Reviews.Author: dannyboy39
Reviews.Content: Really convenient to The Vatican. Free pick-up from the airport which is very useful & return can be arranged for 40Eur. On map seems a distance from central Rome but can easily be reached on foot in 20-30mins. Metro station 5-10min walk away and only 1Eur for a single journey (especially handy for Colosseum). Reception staff are very helpful & friendly. Breakfast is fine (nothing cooked) but choice of cereal & plenty of bread/pastries with cheese/ham etc. English tea bags & boiling water available. Rooms are spacious, bed comfy & we found it quiet to sleep. Would have preferred stand up shower in cubicle instead of jacuzzi bath but hand-held shower ok. Towels changed every day. No English channels of TV but hadn't time to watch it anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel but good location”
Reviews.Author: T0M_ARMSTR0NG
Reviews.Content: This hotel is basic and more 2/3 star than 4 however it is clean and tidy and the staff are helpful. It is 2 roads away from St Peters Square and within walking distance of all of the sites for a keen walker! The coliseum itself on the other side of Rome is a 1 hour walk away and all the major sites can be visited en route. Breakfast itself was basic continental but all that was needed and I tended to eat out in the evening in view of the major sites as the city itself was very safe and so was the neighbourhood. I would revisit this hotel but if I was looking for more luxury I would look elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: AJAG900
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Rome. The free transport was excellent and a great start to a superb time. The staff were all welcoming and the hotel was clean and traditional. Ideally situated for St Peter's Square and therefore easy access to the open top bus tours. Our bathroom was ok but could do with some basic maintainance - it was clean though (shower head hook was broken and the jacuzzi didn't have all the required controls). If we are lucky enough to return to this amazing city we will have no hesitation in returning to this hotel and also recommend to others. It did cost us 40 euro for return journey but it was worth having the guaranteed transport back to the airport. No doubt it would be easy to make your own way back, but this was a nice end to the trip. The room did not have a safe but we had no problems with security. Thank you Atlante Garden staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Primo viaggio in Italia!”
Reviews.Author: CartierND
Reviews.Content: All staff were courteous, helpful and attentive. Rooms were excellent and an experience into history. Location convenient for my needs and we were able to walk to most sites. We are planning another trip to Italy and stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Return customer”
Reviews.Author: Marie W
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at the Alante Garden on two trips to Rome (2007 and 2010), and we couldn't have been more pleased. The pick up at the airport is of course a real plus, but the hotel and the personnel are very welcoming. The bathrooms were spacious, clean and well stocked. Breakfast was great, and the location is perfectly situated for visiting St. Peter's, but also for hoping on public transportation for the other areas. Highly recommend. Marie W. South Carolina

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: Renata R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very cosy, calm and yet so close to the most visited place in Rome - the Vatican. If I would like to pint out one thing it would be the magnificent breakfast hall that has an unforgettable view on the Vatican city. My breakfasts (especially with the help of fantastic weather) really made my day. You feel like on top of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good value”
Reviews.Author: Marcus32a
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the Vatican and St. Peter's. It is also close to a metro stop and a good home base for exploring Rome. For the value, it really can't be beat. The hotel is clean and the staff is very accomodating. We chose this hotel not only because of its location but also because they pick you up from the airport free of charge (40 Euro value). There is wireless internet that you have to pay for and also a 3 Euro per person/per night fee that they collect at checkout. You have to pay for the return trip to the airport as well. Otherwise, the only caution I would mention is that this is not a "4 star" hotel by US standards. I would rate it more of a 3 star. Overall, I would recommend the hotel to others based on its location and price.

Reviews.Title: “...If Vatican is your destination.”
Reviews.Author: draveller
Reviews.Content: If Vatican is your destination, this is undoubtedly an excellent place to stay. It is just few minutes walk distance from Sisitine chappel and St Peters Basilica. We stayed in a family of four including 2kids. The rooms are not very excellent but the things are neat and staff is specially very very helpful. Wifi is available in the room, very cheap from the reception. (Please donot accept free airport pick up from this hotel, as they wont pick you up as per the time)

Reviews.Title: “Just great!”
Reviews.Author: Emmy C
Reviews.Content: Just great place to stay in Rome! Location, room, staff, price, breafast and FREE PICK UP from Fiumicino Airport....!! I would recommend it to everyone and I will stay there next time! Thank you Atlanta Garden!

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Staff I ever dealt with!!”
Reviews.Author: Stuart S
Reviews.Content: Done! We recently stayed at this Hotel and what it lacks in amenities..free wifi.. free return shuttle to airport ..etc.it more than made up in location and what I think was the best hotel staff ever to deal with. One Front Desk Staffer, Foster did a wonderful job of seeing to it the my family and I were always sent in the right direction. He always had a smile on his face and would answer any question. We were there for New Years and my wife and I were out front of the hotel when the Night Desk Gentleman came and got us because he opened the roof terrace for us to go up there and watch it. The housekeeping staff cleaned our room no matter how late we left! The hotel is right by St. Peters square and we had no problem accessing the metro, restaurants, Hop on Hop of Tours (which was awesome). All in all we would stay there again and again. Stuart S. - Orlando

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Rome”
Reviews.Author: ivam7
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Rome. Wonderful city and wonderful stay at Atlante Garden Hotel. Upon arrival we took a complimentary shuttle transfer from the airport to the hotel - great thing since we were traveling with two little children (5 & 3). This Hotel has an excellent position - close to Vaticano. We visited almost all important Roman's monuments by walking and some of them by underground. Our room was comfortable and clean. The staff was always kind and helpful. We had nice Italian dinner in sister hotel Atlante Sar restaurant. Unfortunately the terrace was closed but we are looking forward to repeat visit in spring and enjoy the Vaticano view. We really enjoyed and we would recommend this Hotel to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some not so good”
Reviews.Author: BobbyB380
Reviews.Content: Internet is €10 for 8 hours but it doesn't work in my corner room, which is much quieter than the room I had the first night. Rooms facing Via Crescenzio are very noisy. It feels like the window in open when it isn't. The staff are friendly and do the best with what they have. The Internet is like stepping back 10 years and works poorly with an iPad due to log in, log off issues (you keep paying when not in use and staff are noble to due anything about it). Don't think I'd stay here again unless I had business at the Vatican, which is only a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mark R
Reviews.Content: My family and I ventured on our first trip to Italy to visit our oldest child who was attedning school in Rome. We were lucky enough to pick the Atlante Gardens as our home away from home. The original reason we selected the hotel was the proximity to my daughters school, but the acoomidations and staff were first class. You will not find a more helpful or friendly staff in all of Rome! If you are looking for a great hotel in the heart of Rome - look no further than the Atlante Garden Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Shajacks
Reviews.Content: Positives: - walking distance to just about every attraction - nicely decorated room, very clean, very quiet (434 backed onto the courtyard) - helpful reception staff - prompt return transfer - breakfast okay Slight Negatives: - Jacuzzi bath did not work :( - No drinks after 11pm - Very expensive mini bar - 30min late transfer on arrival I would recommend this hotel, it was really really good for the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Zinny L
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel for location, service and friendliness of staff. The airport pick up was greatly appreciated and went very smoothly. The breakfast is highly recommended and very substantial. The location to all fountains and historic sites within walking distance was great. And the close proximity to Vatican City made it easy to be in line for the museums bright and early. When we left we took the metro to the train station and that was very easy to negotiate and felt safe. All in all we loved this place and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Roman Adventure!”
Reviews.Author: Jim M
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 6 days in Rome (10/11 - 10/16). The location of the Hotel Atlante (just west of the Tiber River) made it extremely easy to visit just about every possible site in Rome. Most were "walkable" and the walks were very enjoyable! Transfers from and back to the airport were easy with a "free" one to the hotel upon arrival. Reasonable cost to go back upon departure. All the staff (front desk, housekeeping, breakfast and bar staff) were very friendly and helpful and our room was quite comfortable. Our included breakfast was a perfect start each day . . . tasty and plentiful! Want somethig you don't see? Ask for it! Internet access (at a slight cost) and a comfortable in-hotel bar added to our enjoyment. Our room (430) was on the 4th floor on the street side but we never heard any street noise at all. Can't speak to any other rooms as mentioned in other reviews. Very good restaurants in close proximity for nights when we wanted to stay close. Ristorante Calabascio is right around the corner . . . go there! Stop at Vin Cafe Cucina across the street for a casual good time! Have Frederico show you the "two wine cork trick" I showed him! Bottom line? The Hotel Atlante was a great choice for us and, hopefully, will be for you, too!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: edyrp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Atlante Garden for one night before our cruise. It stands in the shadow of the Vatican, so if that is where you will spend time you can walk there from the hotel. The room was fine and surprisingly large for a European hotel. It was difficult to get in and out of the bath tub/shower as the tub was so huge and there was nothing to hold on to. I am middle aged and do not normally have a problem with this issue. There was a lot of street noise in the area all night long, and we needed to keep the windows open for air. The TV was small. It was impossible to open the door to our room without assistance, as there was a trick to turning the old-fashioned key. The key was on a tassel and most guests left it at the front desk when they left the room as it was cumbersome.The staff was friendly and helpful at every interaction.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to everywhere”
Reviews.Author: sephyra
Reviews.Content: we just came back from a trip to Italy this week and have enjoyed our stay tremendously at Atlante Garden. We booked a triple room and it was spacious enough to open all 3 of our very big suitcases on the floor. Though the TV was kind of small, they had cable and BBC! there is also a 5 min trial use of WIFI daily. I would also like to comment that the water pressure is superb compared to some other hotels we have stayed in italy, the water drainage in the bathtub is also very fast and the bathtub has jaccuzi function. There's nothing better than a satisfying hot shower after a long day! I did not realise how great the hotel location was til i was there. there is a shopping stretch right behind the block with local and international brands. there is a local groceries stall with all the salami, wine, ham and cheese and another groceries shop that sells fantastics chocolates (i got the acclaimed Amedei from there!). there are restuarants and cafe everywhere. Vatican is about 10min walk away, and the hotel is very close to the river and castles of angels. Breakfast was great with donuts and warm crossiants, I love the fresh roma tomatos. We booked airport transfer from hotel to the airport and it was punctual! (who said Italians are always late?!) The only thing we didnt like about it was the central heating, it gets hot if you do not open the window and we cannot adjust or switch it off from the bedroom. Overall I would recommend this hotel for your Rom stay, especially if you like victorian style decor hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good accommodation close to Vatican”
Reviews.Author: icehouse45
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay in a single room. It was quiet and close to the Vatican and I could easily walk into the old city area within 20 minutes. The room was a good size for a single and the bathroom was much bigger than most in Rome. The breakfast was very good and the staff were very helpful with directions and recommending local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Bob H
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel centrally located just a very short walk to St Peters, the Vatican, Vatican Museum, other Historic sites, Restaurants (fantastic restaurant just 1/2 block away), Gelato shop & shopping. The employee's were very helpful with information as this was our first visit to Rome and they made our stay delightful. The "free" continental breakfast was very good and all you could ask for with fresh fruit (kiwi, apples, bananas) cheese, cold cut meats & yogurt. By the way, don't forget the free shuttle service from the airport to the hotel. We will definitely return on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Ok rooms...larger than most European hotel rooms!”
Reviews.Author: SunCity08
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a really great experience in Rome and enjoyed our hotel. The front desk was very, very helpful! They gave us information about sightseeing tours and were very friendly. I highly recommend using one of the tourist double decker buses to see Rome. It helps you see a lot, without spending lot of money or killing your feet by walking. You might feel like a cheesy tourist but its worth it....and Rome is filled with tourist anyway. The hotel is a close walk to the Vatican. It is parallel to a street that has many clothing and shoe stores. There is a great little restaurant/bar near by, dont remember the name...if you stand in front of the hotel facing the street...the place is on a street to the left, perpendicular to the street the hotel is on. I highly recommend the place! The bartender was super friendly, which we really appreciated since we had some run ins with a few rude locals in a couple of other cities in Italy (especially Firenze). Not only was the staff at the restaurant super friendly but the food and wine was fantastic and not expensive. We had the traditional pasta of Rome, aged meats (which is their specialty) and cheese, and wonderful red wine, recommended by the bartender. Back to the hotel....the rooms are decent. A little dark inside because of the dark wallpaper and black out curtains. The rooms were clean. There are great balconies in the rooms that open out to the street. You can hear a little bit of the street traffic but its not bad. The beds werent very comfortable, a little soft for my liking. We had two twins put together to make a king...which is what you get in Europe when you ask for a King bed, not bad, but hard to cuddle in. Pretty large bathroom. There is a step leading up to the tub...which isnt good if you are handicaped. Something we learned the hard way in Europe, is the U.S. dollar is worth less over there. 1 euro is equal to 1.50 U.S. Which sucks, so we ended up paying a lot more on the trip than we planned. Overall our stay in Rome was great and we would stay in the hotel again. One more thing...great rooftop sitting area!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: vholmes1
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant 4-night stay at the Atlante Garden Hotel and would consider it again for any future visits to Rome. Staff were all very helpul and friendly; the breakfast was very good in a pleasant room. The location is good - within minutes of St Peter's Square, and there are a number of convenient bus routes accessible. Our room had poor lighting but was clean and comfortable. It was difficult to take a shower without flooding the bathroom. The mini-bar could be used as a fridge without a charge. The airport shuttle service was a bonus, although we did have to wait a while at the airport for the minibus to arrive. We would award 3 stars rather than 4, but having compared it to other 4-star hotels in a similar area of Rome, the Atlante Garden came out top for us. Visit the Atlate Garden's website and check out for special discounts.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: nollymac2003
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Atlante Garden 5 times, and every time the rooms have been great, the staff are all very polite and friendly, and its in a great location. There are bus and metro connections close by that connects to all parts of Rome, I would advise anyone to buy the bus map and get a weekly bus ticket, this way you can hop on and off the buses and save a lot of energy and time and see a whole lot more of Rome. The Hotel is situated on a lovely street which is a joy to walk along at anytime of the day or night, the whole area has lots of shops and restaurants. I have stayed in both double and triple rooms and have found them spacious, very clean and comfortable. The breakfast at the hotel is excellent with a wide choice of bread, pastries, eggs, cereal etc. and the breakfast room is kept well stocked and clean by the friendly and very helpful staff. I would highly recommend The Atlante Garden Hotel for anyone visiting Rome and I look forward to returning there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location,Location”
Reviews.Author: Annette Z
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Atlante Garden several times and have always been very happy with my choice. The location is perfect for walking to many of Romes famous attractions.The service and communication with the staff has been excellent and I have never had a problem with my rooms. We usually use the Atlante Garden at the beginning or end of our trip because the airport shuttle service is very reliable and the complimentary breakfast is always fresh and appealing.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Lromito
Reviews.Content: Good rooms with private balconies where you can have breakfast. Location is good also. Very near the Vatican. The staff were all pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Claiming to be a 4 Star hotel, when it is an average 3 Star in quality”
Reviews.Author: SonicDreamer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Atlante Garden Hotel for two nights on the 23/24 September 2011 and made the booking on the strength of the reasonably high Tripadvisor.co.uk member ratings and myriad positive reviews. Regrettably my high expectations came down to the ground with a thud, as I was sorely disappointed by the standard of the accommodation. In summary, I am of the opinion this is a 4 Star hotel that is really an average 3 Star in quality. Before I comment on the negatives, I will list positives that potential guests of the hotel can consider: 1. Staff are friendly, helpful and efficient. 2. The room (Superior Double) was kept immaculately clean. 3. Very convenient location for visiting the Vatican and St. Peters. 4. Free airport collection from Fiumicino (Leonardo da Vinci) Airport. Now on to the negatives… 1. The room was small for a Superior Double, with little circulation space. 2. The room décor and furnishing for a Superior Double were substandard going on past experience of 4 Star hotels; the quality was in keeping with a poor to average 3 Star hotel: a) Use of fittings and fixtures to give the impression of a 4 Star room, but upon closer inspection, the materials used\ were of mediocre quality. b) Bed base was wire and the surround made with cheap, wood that looked like “bamboo” with “Hessian” texture pattern finish. c) Desk and bedside cabinet were made with the same wood. d) Only one working plug point available to charge mobile phone and it was difficult to push in and remove the plug. e) No digital room safe. f) The room door had key lock, not a “swipe” card. g) The bathroom had no place to hang the large bath towels to dry. When I raised this with the staff, the solution was to hang the towels back of the bathroom door handle! h) The hand towels were similar to tea towels, smooth with no pile. i) Shower head holder was too low on wall; I’d say only someone 153cm could stand under it and I’m 189cm! j) The wall bracket for the shower head was loose and the shower head kept dropping down when in use; unless you took great care to adjust its position. k) The Jacuzzi controls in the bath did not work and one control knob was removed. l) Two redundant plumbing connections protruded from the wall tiles. I asked a few other guests what their rooms were like; they also thought the standard was “average” and had the same problem with the shower head bracket, which suggests complacency on the part of the owners regarding lack of proper maintenance. I did not eat any food in the hotel, so I can’t comment on what was available. I think the hotel owners would benefit from: 1. Lowering the hotel’s rating to 3 Star, down from 4, to lower the advance expectations of guests. or 2. Implementing an extensive refurbishment programme to bring the rooms up to a 4 Star standard. I do wonder what standard of hotels the people writing glowing reviews of the Atlante Garden Hotel had stayed in before; somehow I doubt typical 4 or 5 Star hotels. If further evidence was need why this hotel is not up to a 4 Star standard, I booked my third night at the Kolbe Hotel Rome, which comfortably deserved its 4 Star status – please see my review. The difference in quality was dramatic to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: Nick D
Reviews.Content: Overall not a bad hotel when you consider the price but there were quite a few drawbacks in our opinion. The location is great, withing walking distance to many attractions, most notably the Vatican. The room itself was comfortable however the bathroom was abysmal. The grout in the tiles was covered in mold. The shower head was broken (wouldn't stay in its holder) so we had to have a bath every day (which took forever to fill the tub!) The spa jets didn't work properly either. We were on our honeymoon (informed them of this) and yet they gave us a room with 2 single beds! They did give us a complimentary bottle of prosecco though which we appreciated greatly. We had to wait for an hour and a half at the airport for the free airport shuttle even though we gave them all our flight details and were waiting at the designated area as advised. They were not apologetic at all and blamed us for not being there (we definitely were!) This would be an average hotel if it was 2 or 3 star but is definitely not a 4 star. If you're looking for an average hotel in a fairly good location near the Vatican then this hotel is good. Just don't go with high expectations of a 4 star!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but rooms are just average”
Reviews.Author: RachaelL1
Reviews.Content: Was there in summer with my family. The rooms that my family and I stayed at was quite old. The water pressure in the toilet was poor. Rooms were just of average. Location of the hotel is exceptionally close to Vatican city and the subway. The staffs were helpful and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location when in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Stan N
Reviews.Content: With Free Airport Pick-Up, this is just a start. You are within walking distance of many tourist attractions. (No taxis require) Also great resturants near by. Great staff to help you out, if you should need them.

Reviews.Title: “Our Experience at Atlante Garden was colossal!”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: Our hats are off the the fine staff over the entire hotel. The room was great. the bathroom was great. The breakfast was tremendous. It was in walking distance of everything we needed to see close to the Vatican. We enjoyed the little sidewalk restaurants. We especially enjoyed Gigis Restaurant, a little home style Italian place that was friendly and reasonable. We ate there two times. Florianna was a great waitress. The guys at the desk were personable and helpful with the internet. This was delinitely the place to stay. John and Fay in Fayetteville, NC

Reviews.Title: “Our Honeymoon in Rome”
Reviews.Author: anthomas
Reviews.Content: Service was amazing, everyone was so helpful and friendly, the location is IDEAL and for the price it was hard to pass up! We recommend this to anyone staying in Rome! and we will for sure stay again when returning to Rome :) Even the jacuzzi baths in the bathrooms were so enjoyable we were able to lounge and relax with the bathroom windows open to the fresh air and sounds of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading Website. No Restaurant or rooftop. Tat is sister hotel two blocks over.”
Reviews.Author: Jim D
Reviews.Content: Be careful as their website for the hotel we stayed at, Atlante Garden, shows a lovely view, rooftop bar and Restraunt but that is actually the sister hotel about three blocks away called Hotel Atlante Star and not the Atlante Garden. There is not a view or even a restraunt. Decent hotel near the Vatican city entrance to St. peters Basillica. Great location for walking all over rome and neighborhood was safe. We have two young children and were fine walking around until almost midnight. The room was clean, but the hotel front desk staff was actually quite rude when asking simple questions about getting taxis and transfers to airport. Transfer to airport via free shuttle is not an option. They simply call a service and you pay 50 Euro. The hotel has a decent continental breakfast, but the lobby bar staff didn't show up one night so they just didn't open the bar. Forget about getting a bucket of ice, it doesn't exist. There also isn't a safe in the room, however, we didn't have any problem. Overall, I would say it was a good experience as we just used the room as a home base while discovering the city, just don't set expectations on this property too high.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: louisa k
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay in Rome with our family. We were very happy with the position of the hotel as it was within easy access to all the tourist sites. The room slept the four of us with room to spare and was a good standard and very clean. Our windows opened onto the street and although the street is always busy the noise level was not a problem. The staff were always efficient, friendly and helpful. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “READ This - detailed review for your benefit”
Reviews.Author: Dougie777RomeItaly
Reviews.Content: Well let me first say that almost no hotel in Europe that we have seen compares with even moderate hotels in Canada or the USA imho. The rooms are smaller and they charge for what should be complimentary. So let me give the the North American low down. 1) Don't expect a large room, or modern decor. The rooms are velvet wallpaper so its dated but it kind of works because all the buildings are so so old here. 2) Front Desk was very nice and helpful. 3) Keys are not plastic but real keys with a huge fob on the end you can't possible fit in your pocket. You are supposed to drop your key off at the front desk every time you go out. Weird and outdated but it was fine for us. Sometimes my wife just took the keys in her purse. 4) Internet is pay at some crazy rate and you have to go the front desk and by cards!!! uhhhh (first 5 min free). If you know how to modify your mac address you can get unlimited 5 min (I used my own dd-wrt flashed router to repeat to my families laptops and modify mac addres). 5) Breakfast is 8 Euro ($15 dollars) per person extra. Careful because expedia lists both with and without breakfast and its easy to confuse the two. 6) This hotel is 2 min walk to square and vatican etc. Very very convenient. Bus 81 leaves from square every 10 min to coliseum and costs only 1 euro per person. 7) Overall this was a great option price wise for our family to see rome. I give it a thumbs up but know about the points I have listed above. 8) Oh there are literally hundreds of little restaurants that serve pizza pasta and many other dishes and you eat on tables right out on the side walks... very nice at night or anytime. Pasta costs about 6-8 euros and 8-10 euros for nicer dishes. Watch out for the odd restaurant charging more. More expensive is not better in our experience. Oh one more gotcha... at this hotel its a free pickup shuttle from the airport but they charge 40 euros when you want to go back to the airport... and you need to book at least 24 hours in advance... and I think actually on expedia they said 3 days... so email them your itinerary asap.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Richard W
Reviews.Content: For the eight days I stay at the Atlante Gardens I found the staff very helpful and friendly particularly the three men who manned the reception desk. The hotels location to the main tourist site is excellent, most are within walking distance. If you want catch a bus you only have to walk for a couple of minutes up the road. Yes, the lift is slow and small but there is always the stairs if you are in a hurry. Good breakfast. When next in Rome I will definitely return to this hotel and recommend it to anyone else who is visiting Rome. Plus the free pickup from the airport is also an advantage. Richard

Reviews.Title: “It was lovely and hope to be back!”
Reviews.Author: Bobbie1967
Reviews.Content: We were lucky we had the whole 5th floor, 2 rooms and a lovely terrace. The hotel was clean, the breakfast was very good when you have 2 teenagers who love to eat and when you walk 18k a day you need to fuel up! I would highely recommend this hotel especially for families very centrally located to all the sites and reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommendable!”
Reviews.Author: Tinelund
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff, beautiful interior. Only bad thing was the roof restaurant - not suitable for vegans!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: Bill9962
Reviews.Content: Outstanding location. Clean. Friendly staff. Daytime staff is very helpful. The night staff is OK. Our room was very small. There's no newspaper or anything like that. Our phone didn't work well and it took the staff a couple days to replace it. Breakfast costs 12 euros per person and isn't very good. Dinner is insanely expensive. The view from the terrace is nothing like the one that is advertised. In fact, there's not much of a view at all. Free transport from airport to hotel, but the transport back to the airport costs 40 euros for 2 people.

Reviews.Title: “1st night hotel disaster”
Reviews.Author: jswedek
Reviews.Content: We arrived at our hotel after traveling over 12 hours and told that no rooms were available, even though we had a reservation. So they sent us to an "apartment" that we shared with 2 other groups. The room had no amenities...no phone, no information, TV didn't work, etc. It was a disastrous first night. Interesting that the other family that arrived with us was given a room in the hotel, even though the front desk person said they too were placed offsite. Not true. The hotel itself was lovely once we were transferred over, but couldn't make up for the first night.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for a Rome short break”
Reviews.Author: Audles
Reviews.Content: Visited in May 2011 and chose the hotel after lots of review searching on many sites. Location is good overall but ideal if you want to focus on the Vatican area. It is only 10 minutes wander from St Peters where you can hop on a variety of open top buses, but only 5 minutes from the Vatican Museums (which helps after you have just spent 5 hours touring them). Also only a couple of street over from a nice dining area with reasonable prices. However, it is quite a way from Piazza Navona, the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and Colloseum (all accessable on said open top bus). Hotel room very comfortable and clean. Staff were very helpful and polite. Basically, a good place to base yourself to enjoy the city and it's sights. Oh, and the airport pick up was excellent! Nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Really sweet place to stay in Roma!”
Reviews.Author: Phille10
Reviews.Content: Very happy with our pick of hotel in Rome. Service was lovely. Room was clean and comfortable. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lori172
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults and 2 teens) were in Rome for 4 days and had a wonderful time at this hotel. The room was palatial compared to what we heard we could get at a European hotel...even the bathroom..which had a jacuzzi. The staff could not have been more accommodating. Breakfast was great. THere is even a lounge/bar area where one can rest and recover after a long day of sightseeing. THe location of the hotel is well placed, near the Vatican and close to metro stops and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: NorwegianTraveler1
Reviews.Content: Situated between downtown Rome and the Vatican, this hotel is perfectly located for us. 5 min walk to the Vatican and about 10 min to the main shopping street downtown. We have stayed here before, and chose to come back because of the excellent service. This time we got an upgraded room which was pretty nice. The standard of the hotels in Rome is not so good as other big cities like Paris, London, and Barcelona. Expect hard beds. But this hotel is clean, nice and welcoming. I would not recomend the breakfast buffet, it is too small for my taste. Very limited selection. It is much better to use those money on going out to eat at a nice trattoria. The service at Atlante Garden is extremly good. Every single one of the staff we spoke with was friendly, helpful, and they posess great knowledge of Rome. They recomend good restaurants and give you "hidden" tips on how to make the most out of your trip to Rome. I would recomend this hotel to everyone, and this has become my place to stay in Rome from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great lunch, my second stay!”
Reviews.Author: mars2182
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with my in-laws, stayed at his property for 3 nights in June 2011. The hotel elevator is very small (typical for Italy), but big enough for 3 adults (no luggage) to use after a long day of sightseeing. This property isn't cheap, but well worth the money for it's location to the Vatican and the metro. The bathrooms could use some updating and the double/ queen beds are two singles put together, but it was fine. Also, other reviews mention the noise level...you're in a major city so yes, there will be some street noise, but my family never had a problem. The complimentary airport pickup at FCO is very nice, but they will charge you for your return to the airport (if needed). Front desk speaks English, very helpful with restaurant options and making reservations. The bar is quiet at night, perfect for a glass of vino before bed. Hotel has one computer with a printer. They do charge for internet and printing, but it was perfect to hop on, check emails, print a boarding pass, etc. Best part of this property..the breakfast and the location! I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “The atlante garden hotel makes a very good base for your holiday”
Reviews.Author: Frandabbiedozie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about a 5 minute walk from St peters basilica and this is also where the 24 hour bus trips start. The hotel is clean and the staff are helpful. I wouldn't say the rooms are luxurious but they are basic and maintained well. The bath is small but useable and the room I had didn't have a seating area, however I didn't want to spend much time in the room so that was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Cubagirl1998
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel June 20 to June 26 and I was pleasantly surprised. My check in was fast and the staff was extremely friendly. I had a problem the first morning. There was no power in my entire room! I called the front desk and I think the manager ran up to my room. It was fixed in 5 minutes. My hotel room was small but very clean. My room did face the street so it was a little loud but I'm used to hearing that kind of noise since I live in a very usy street. The hotel is a 5 minute walk to Vatican City and it is a 20 minute walk to the Pantheon. There are so many places to eat and shop near the hotel. The front desk were nice enough to recommend places to eat. The 12 euros a day for breakfast can be a little pricey when you can have a nice breakfast around the corner for 4 euros. I would definitely recommend this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, walking distance to the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: masterofninja
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Atlante Garden was a pleasant hotel to stay in Rome. It is walking distance from the Vatican, and just a few blocks away from the metro station that can take you into town. Furthermore as it is near the Vatican it is well served by other public transport. Food shops are nearby (supermarkets, take-aways, restaurants) and it has a lot of souvenir and clothes shops. It is walking distance easily into town, although in the hot days might be a bit of a struggle for the unfit. The hotel itself is clean. The staff are pleasant and speak English very well (as well as German and Spanish as far as I could tell). The rooms are clean and well furnished in a fairly classical style. The mod cons might not be as good as other hotels, but you get the basics (e.g. TV, mini-bar, hair dryer etc.). The bath itself has a jacuzzi function. The only downside is that there is no iron - so if you want to iron something it can be done through the hotel laundry for a 6 euro charge. There is also internet as either wi-fi or via a computer (with printer) in the hotel lobby. Overall this is a good hotel to stay in. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Staff are excellent”
Reviews.Author: Saffron321
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from staying at the Atlante Garden Hotel in Rome and yes the staff are absolutely lovely, very helpful and professional. We only ate breakfast there but that was excellent. It is in an excellent position for the Vatican and with good access to the open top buses to tour the City. Unfortunately we didn't have a balcony and our very dark room faced a narrow 'yard' and was just a few feet away from another building. And like other reviews I was unhappy about the bed : This was an old fashioned bed settee with two single mattesses on top. Bathroom: although having what looked a new toilet, the bath area should have been retiled and grouted. The jacuzzi looked old and there were switches missing - I didn't attempt to use it as I wasn't happy about the hygiene of using someone elses bathwater (which is left in the pipes) but as there were buttons missing I can only assume it wasn't useable anyway. Sitting areas: A few 'nice' relaxing areas to just sit and 'chill' in were the bar area and a small reading room. Unfortunately though the furniture in the reading area consisted of another old settee with an old fastioned cover on it and the bar area furniture wasn't much better. It looked like it had come from a second hand shop. It is a pity about the bad points above because with just renewing the beds, retiling the bath areas and renewing the furniture in the reading room and bar area this could be an absolutely perfect hotel. Would I go there again ? Possibly .... it isn't a 'no no'

Reviews.Title: “Class”
Reviews.Author: andrewc05
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here. Excellent location five minutes from St Peter's Square, friendly staff. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and rooms..”
Reviews.Author: Wilko31
Reviews.Content: Exceptional location and very friendly staff for whom nothing was too much trouble. We were only in Rome for 2 nights but will definitiely be going back and when we do the Atlante Garden will be our venue of choice re hotel. Solid breakfast, great roof terrace - everything you need... Thanks for helping make our weekend so memorable !!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location for a family experience”
Reviews.Author: paulglock
Reviews.Content: Atlante Garden is an ideal location from which you can enjoy a family holiday in Rome and yet have a base from which you can feel fully relaxed in as you plan further excursions to the many wonderful sites within travelling distance from this base, either by walking or by bus. Should you want help, there is always available some really interesting suggestions from the staff. A great place to enjoy a great City.

Reviews.Title: “Located in the best spot for main attractions!”
Reviews.Author: sjohn2011
Reviews.Content: I booked this short trip with the Atlante Garden for my mum and I as my mum's birthday present. Upon arrival at the airport we had to wait a while for the pick up service as I was worried they might not be coming even though we had received the confirmation email. However, one quick phone call on the number we were given and we were assured the driver wasn't far and true to their word. The driver was very apologetic. We reached the hotel and were very welcomed by all members of staff and they spoke English very well. They showed us to our rooms and had someone take our luggage up. The rooms were very clean and were cleaned every day during our stay. We had chosen the breakfast as part of our stay which had a range of savoury food, fruits, cereals etc which made a great start to the day. They would constant top things up when ever it was low. The location of the hotel is perfect for the Vatican City literally less than 10min to walk and so easy to find ; very handy for when having to reach the papal mass on Wednesday so early to get a good seat. If want to see all other sites the hotel recommends a sight seeing bus where after 1.15pm its only 15euros per adult to jump on and off at any site like the colloseum or the spanish steps. The hotel is very well situated in an area where if you walk away in the opposite direction you find loads of restaurants and the street behind it you can find high street stores and to the left of the hotel if you walk straight down you find market stall etc. We didn't use public transport once whilst out there a challenge we try and complete next time. Loved this hotel and would not think twice about booking it next time. Plus the hotel even give you 20% off your next stay!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: alyson_bc
Reviews.Content: Atlante was welcoming; staff were helpful. Very convenient walking distance to the Vatican. Surprisingly plentiful breakfast. Too bad the lift was broken one day. We booked through an Alitalia package and got great value. Most helpful to have airport pickup included.

Reviews.Title: “Great place. We will return”
Reviews.Author: bluntysaurus
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Good position and very friendly staff. We had a great stay and would recommend the hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Our 1st time in Rome and we intend to visit again”
Reviews.Author: Andy62_11
Reviews.Content: Rome! A beautiful city, with wonderful sites & friendly people (just a pity about the graffitti). The Atlante Garden Hotel, has a fantastic location, less than 5 mins walk from the vatican museums (book before you travel) & St Peters. The open top bus tours also leave from St Peters or you can use one of the local bus services that leave from the nearby piazza to get into the city. The staff at the hotel where very friendly & helpful. They only serve breakfast here but you are spoilt for choice. If you are looking for a local cheap meal, try the tratatori about 10 mins walk towards Rome by another piazza, we went on our 1st night and felt welcomed & at home. Would I stay at the Atlante Garden Hotel again? YES, YES, YES. Do I have a complaint? Only a tiny one, I am english & enjoy my cup of tea! Can we have a kettle in our room next time please?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Will definately stay again”
Reviews.Author: mimidlr
Reviews.Content: Excellent walkind distance to St Peters and all the outdoor dining restaraunts. Clean, friendly, spacious - couldn't ask for more. The prepay price online was a terrific deal and the breakfast included was terrific. Especially appreciated the free pick up at the airport !!

Reviews.Title: “We had a very pleasent stay and will return”
Reviews.Author: audia3Valletta
Reviews.Content: We liked the room. It was very clean.we loved the jaccuzzi bath,it was great.over all it was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Provided all we required for our stay in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: rhalton
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five night in this hotel.It is well situated, near the Vatican with easy access to the Metro and buses. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the rooms were clean and acceptable, although there was some traffic noise. The decor may be a bit dark and heavy for some but the beds were comfortable and everything worked in the bedroom and bathroom. The breakfast was good value and the sister hotel, Atlante Star provided a superb dinner on one night of our stay. We would certainly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mallikac
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Nice location near the Convenient location a short walk from the Metro, Vatican and shopping, but not near enough to be obnoxious. Rooms are nice and staff are very pleasant and helpful. The one issue we had were the thin walls. If you have even semi-noisy neighbors this might prove a downside.

Reviews.Title: “very close to Vatican/St Peter's square”
Reviews.Author: tofuman_11
Reviews.Content: Very close to Vatican and St. Peter's square. Small room but adequate if you are a sight seeing person who will not be spending too much time in the room. The breakefast set up was very nice and helped save a lot of money. Free shuttle from the airport was greatly appreciated There is no English language TV except for CNN. Cost of the beverages in the little room refrigerator is excessive. Six Euros for a bottle of water or a very smalle Coke. Eight Euros for a bottle of beer

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location for Vatican but not 4 star!”
Reviews.Author: damim
Reviews.Content: We had a quad room on the second floor and expected a smaller room but it was okay. It was shared by sisters and, so, we were comfortable. The decor is heavy with curtains and some bathroom tiles were broken. The hotel is about 10 minutes walk to the Vatican and is near shopping and restaurants. We asked the reception for a recommendation for a restaurant but the ristorante where they sent us to was overpriced and pastas were too al dente. However, we managed to walk around the area (closer to the Vatican) and there we were able to sit at outdoor trattorias, eating a good meal at a reasonable price. The breakfast was good and plentiful. There is concern for security because the hotel reception desk is not the entrance and can be accessed by anyone who can get inside the hotel without hotel notice.

Reviews.Title: “Very acceptable hotel within walking distance of the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: albertmills
Reviews.Content: Nice, small family run hotel. Friendly and helpful staff. Good continental breakfast but a bit short staffed at busy times. Some traffic/pedestrian noise from adjacent road. Free pick up from airport - 25 euros per person for return to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Just so so...”
Reviews.Author: Trix51
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 days; the staff was great and accommodating. Great location but as for the rooms??? I understand this is an old hotel, but for what your paying for the room I think they need to do some updating, king bed was 2 twins pushed together, one higher than the other and very uncomfortable, the bathroom fixtures were a mess, every time you turned the water in the sink on you got a soaking, the hand held shower was a joke, it wouldn't stay on the holder because it was broke. Also think it would be nice to lighten up the wallpaper and curtains, it was like being in a bat cave...so dark...if you want quiet, don't get a room on the street, very noisy. No resturants, but breakfast was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable central hotel”
Reviews.Author: DixonCh66
Reviews.Content: We booked at the Atlante Garden with my family on the last stop of our trip in Europe. I managed to find a good deal online for a quad and we were very happy with it. Clean decent sized good quality room with a nice bathroom. Great position, just round the corner from the Vatican museum and next to a central square with buses and trams plus a subway stop nearby so transport was not a problem. When we arrived at airport the free shuttle bus helped us save the taxi cost into town. Big choice of pizzerias, gelatos and shops in the area, also a very safe area for the family. If you’re travelling with kids this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend staying at Atlante Garden Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jawan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for twenty days and I highly recommend it. The staff was very nice and helpful. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was very good. The location was perfect for me because it was a block away from the Vatican and a few blocks away from the metro/buses. I will be returning to Rome in December and I will definitely be staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: smachin_7
Reviews.Content: Very close to the Vatican city but all of Rome is accesible on foot and don't worry about the queues - we had none to speak of (15 Mins for Vatican was the most). There are beautiful parks as well as the traditional sites so a visit can be varied. The pick up by the hotel from the airport was a boon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Site Seeing in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: PHeck
Reviews.Content: The Atlante Garden Hotel is centrally located between the Vatican and Castle St. Angelo. It is in a great location for walking to most of the historical sites in Rome and there are many good restaurants nearby. The meal we had at the Les Etoiles Resturant in the sister hotel (Atlante Star, about two block away) was one of the best we have had at any restaurant, altough the price was very high. The hotel has an excelent breakfast included with the room and the staff are very professional. There is also good shopping nearby on the Via Cola di Rienzo.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading pictures, no restaurant! Main restaurant in nearby sister hotel Atlante Star”
Reviews.Author: Firstfooting
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel, helpful staff. Central to the Vatican and access to local transport,

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: ForeverYoung50
Reviews.Content: Our trip itinerary had us in Rome twice, at the beginning and at the end. Having stayed a block away from the Colosseum the first time, we chose to be closer to the Vatican the next time, so picked the Atlante Garden Hotel. The hotel was a pleasant surprise. Our room was large and had a walk-in wardrobe. The bathroom was also huge and had a jacuzzi. Our 4th floor room was tastefully decorated and our windows opened onto a central courtyard, so no street noise meant a good night's sleep. A good idea was the night light at floor level because of the differing floor levels from bedroom to bathroom. The only problem with the room was in the bathroom. The water pressure was extremely low and filling the jacuzzi took forever, especially when the plug didn't seal properly either. Mind you, taking a shower wasn't much better as it was only a trickle if you wanted hot water .. cold water, no problem! The breakfast was the usual and was OK as by the end of our trip we were over cold breakfasts of cereals, meat, cheese and cakes/pastries and very strong coffee! The hotel's service and the staff were great (thanks for the complimentary bottle of chilled wine on arrival). The hotel is in a good location to see the Vatican and is one street away from great shopping and one street in the opposite direction from good restaurants. The hotel has it's own restaurant but judging by the menu we saw, was quite expensive so we chose to eat elsewhere. One thing to note with the Atlante Garden as with other older hotels, is the lift is extremely small (max 4 persons) but struggles to accommodate 2 people with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Really a great place”
Reviews.Author: jzipster
Reviews.Content: I came here due to its cheaper price, and close location to the Vatican. An excellent, excellent choice. I think its location, though some times criticized, is wonderful. Getting up early to visit the Vatican was brutal, but the short five minute walk made it a lot easier. It was extremely clean, and the staff very helpful. About a seven minute walk from the subway.

Reviews.Title: “excelent location”
Reviews.Author: praga_czech
Reviews.Content: Excellent communication by booking, friendly staff, tasty breakfast, reliably pickup from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but ask for a quiet room!”
Reviews.Author: PeterSGhent
Reviews.Content: Atlante Garden hotel is ideally located. 10 mins easy walk from St Peter's Square and a 30 mins brisk walk from the Colloseum. So, if you are not afraid to stretch your legs a bit, there is no need for taxi or metro rides. Rooms are spacious, clean. Bathrooms with bubble-bath are generous. An absolute plus is the free shuttle picking you up from the airport. We received a free welcome drink. The staff at reception and in the hotel is very friendly and will assist you in any way that is possible. For instance, the return shuttle (return is to be paid, 40€) was not available but the receptionist called us a taxi at the same price (so, also 40€ iso the average 50€). The breakfast is correct and offers sufficient choice. All in all a great value for money. One negative is the noise from the street. Located along one of the main roads to the Vatican at a crossing with speedbumps, the all-night noise of the traffic and vibration of busses and cars driving over the speedbump is annoying. So, either you bring ear plugs with you or you ask for a quiet room that does not overlook the main street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent City Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: whitesummer
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for a long weekend with my mother and sister to celebrate my mothers 60th birthday. Prior to arrival I was a bit worried about the mixed reviews on the hotel, but once we set foot in the hotel all concerns vanished: we got excellent service and comfortable accommodation that really made our trip! Our flight arrived to Fiumicino around 10 pm and on the hotel website it said that the free hotel shuttle service ends at 10 pm. Nonetheless I booked the shuttle in advance, and received really thorough instructions on how to find the driver at the airport. We found our way to the meeting point very easily. At first the driver wasn't anywhere in sight (we were warned about this in advance) so I dialed the toll free number I'd received and surely enough the hotel receptionist confirmed that our driver was already on his way! We got straight to the hotel in about 20 min, easily thanks to this excellent service! Arriving to the hotel the staff had left a complimentary bottle of Prosecco in our room to celebrate my moms birthday, a really nice gesture and set our weekend off on a happy note. We had a triple room (one double bed, one single) on the 4th floor with two windows, the other to the side of the building and the other to the back facing a little garden with orange trees. The room was spacious, the beds comfortable and bathroom recently renovated with good taste. The decor was classy and everything was clean, even the carpet, which always scares us Scandinavians a bit;) True, the whole building did seem the shake when bigger vehicles passed by and the jacuzzi didn't work, but we managed to sleep well and there was plenty of hot water and the shower water pressure was good which I appreciated. Also couldn't hear any noise from the corridor of other rooms which was nice. The room did get a little chilly at night, but nothing a few extra blankets from the cupboard couldn't fix! All throughout our stay the service we got was very good, far better than in many hotels in this price range The friendly staff spoke good english, we got our bags carried to the room, the two receptionists were really helpful and helped us book a table for dinner, etc. Also there was a small lobby bar (that doubled as a breakfast room) with a really friendly waitress providing us with extra glasses for our rooms etc. The Prati neighborhood was really nice and seemed like a safe and quiet neighborhood but yet there were lots of good quality, value-for-money restaurants around so we didn't have to venture far in the evening. We didn't have breakfast included so we did what the locals do, grabbed a freshly squeezed juice, cappuccino and croissant at one of the many cafes nearby. Towards the Vatican wall and the little square next to the hotel prices were higher than a few blocks away. Also beware that if you sit down at a cafe you get charged more that standing at the counter. Location- wise the Vatican was a heartbeat away for the hotel and the rest the the major sights were just across the river so we could walk everywhere in Rome! It was also handy to be so close the the Vatican so you could hit the sights before the massive queues! Unfortunately the rooftop gardens were closed in both our hotel and the sister hotel Atlante Star but we did sneak a peek at the Les Etoiles dining room view of St. Peters and the view was stunning! Tip: Go on the street behind the hotel and towards the Ottaviano metro station, lots of good shopping on that route! Also note, that since the beginning of January Rome has started charging a tourist tax put towards developing their visitor services The tax is 3 e per night, per person and had to be paid when checking out. Overall, I've stayed in many hotels in European capitals in the same price range , but Atlante Garden really was excellent value for money. Really comfortable, great location and good service. A stay to remember!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: spfoo
Reviews.Content: We expected a lot having looked at the hotels web site. The web site has absolutely nothing to do with the hotel. Problems started at the airport. We were supposed to be met at the terminal by the shuttle driver. After a while of waiting we called the hotel. It turned out the driver was at the wrong terminal. The confirmation e-mail from the hotel mentioned our terminal correctly, but somehow he was waiting for us at another one. Ok, we all make mistakes and after all he did arrive rapidly in a few minuted to pick us up. Unfortunately on foot so we had to walk with our luggage to the other terminal. At the hotel we were informed that we had to pay city tax also for our youngest child contrary to information given by Alitalia and the hotel itself. Not a lot of money, but strange change in any case. Now to the room. Twin bed and 2 extra beds instead of the 2 double beds that were booked. Windows and shades dirty. Later we tried the jacuzzi. Didn't work so we had a basic bath tub. The back of the bathroom door had instructions for the jacuzzi or how it had once been working. The 3 buttons described in the instructions didn't even exist adn had been covered with metal plates. I called the reception and they sent someone quite soon over. He did some tricks under the tub (which was in a absolutely horrible state behind a front panel). He got the pump working and instructed me to press the start/stop button really hard to operate it. Really hard meant REALLY HARD. I was the only one in the family who was able to start or stop the jacuzzi. At night we closed the inside and the very dirty outside wood panels on the windows. Still the noise was like we had been sleeping on the street. We could easily hear people talking while passing the hotel. Trucks passing made the bed tremble. We didn't try the food or room service since we didn't want to leave a penny extra to this hotel. We even went out for breakfast and some nights I fetched take-away pizza to the room.

Reviews.Title: “very good rate price/quality”
Reviews.Author: petr5869
Reviews.Content: very soft beds, noise from street, no free internet

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rach2350
Reviews.Content: Thank you, we really enjoyed our stay. Good location to the Vatican and within walking distance of excellent restaurants and visit attractions. The hotel itself was very pleasing, the rooms were luxurious :) and the area of the hotel was suitable for our holiday plans. The bathroom was very nice also, we were very pleased with the service we received from the staff they all seemed helpful and pleasant. I would highly recommend this hotel. Thank you, we hope to visit the hotel again sometime soon :D

Reviews.Title: “A well run hotel offering good value for money”
Reviews.Author: peter_newton3
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located near the Vatican and with nearby bus, tram and metro links across the city. The room was comfortable, quiet and well serviced. Breakfast was efficient and sufficient. The hotel staff were helpful, courteous, spoke good English and when they said they would help, they did. The hotel provided us with a good base from which to explore Rome. We enjoyed our stay and would readily return.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding! The hotel was wonderful, the staff even better!”
Reviews.Author: Dutch_GA
Reviews.Content: Four days with a family of five, we shared two spacious rooms only blocks from The Vatican. The location allowed us to walk everywhere. While not very extensive, the breakfast buffet was quite nice and a good value. Convenient location with clean spacious rooms made the stay very comfortable. The professional, courteous and helpful staff made the experience warm and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Near vatican wall and lovely decoration”
Reviews.Author: VanessaPi3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient if you are planning to spend a significant part of your time at St-Peter's, Vatican museum and Michael Angelo Castello, which are all within walking distance. The rooms are warmly decorated and the bathroom is great with a big tub. The heat in the room was great and you can open the windows for fresh air. The street can be loud but it was fine for us. The Internet is not free which was the main irritant for us and the staff is not really friendly or helpful. We found our way around Rome without them. I had been before and the map are well detailed and easy to follow. There is numerous inexpensive great italian restaurants around if you go opposite of Vatican direction.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, good location!”
Reviews.Author: cmhattersley
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip on Priceline and were looking for a moderately priced hotel with a location where we could walk or take the metro. We stayed for 8 days. We were blown away with how comfortable and clean this hotel was! My only complaint was that it was a little loud because of the cars on the street, but the bed was comfortable, we always had clean towels and there were many great pizzerias and restaurants in the area. The staff was very helpful and gave us good advice. We found ourselves walking all the way across town to churches and the Roman ruins and then taking the metro back. The hotel helped us set up a guided tour of Pompeii too. They made it very convenient. I would definitely visit this hotel again in the future and recommend it to anyone who is looking for a clean, comfortable, well-priced hotel. Definitely get your dollar's worth!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable city hotel”
Reviews.Author: foodmaven234
Reviews.Content: The Atlante Garden Hotel is in a very good location, near Vatican City. It is close to public transportation but the subway and buses and has ample shopping and restaurants in the neighborhood. There is free transportation from the airport to the hotel but not for the return trip. Internet access was not free. The roof deck (which is a block and a half away) was closed for renovations. Breakfast was included in our rate. It was OK. The urn labeled coffee was undrinkable. I would not call it coffee. We were on the 2nd floor with 1 room on the street and 1 room in back. Both had significant street noise which continued all night long. The hotel was clean and the service was satisfactory. The lighting in the rooms was poor. The beds were comfortable. The bathrooms were modern.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, the rooms don't seem to be the standard of a 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: Renata11
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great. Literally 5 minutes from Vatican and definitely a walking distance to other attractions. The breakfast is great, you can enjoy it in the roof restaurant with the view of Vatican. Make sure the breakfast is included otherwise you will pay a fortune. The Superior Double Room is not a superior at all. I spent my Honeymoon there with 2 single beds thighed together and the guy at the reception said it was standard! The bath tub was leaking and the silicon should have been replaced ages ago. Again, I was told this was a deluxe room and that's it. The reception staff should definitely work on their attitude. The bed was not very comfortable but I might be a bit fussy about it as I love my bed! Towels are changed every day and the cleaners do a great job. Oh, watch out for the fridge, the drinks are ridiculously expensive. I believe the above is normal in Italy and as such I would recommend this hotel. Although, if this was not my Honeymoon break, I would have most likely fought with them but it was not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: reserved19
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very close to most attractions. Staff are first class, everyone we dealt with was friendly and helpful. Some rooms are looking a bit tired and could do with redecorating. Towels were changed daily and bedding changed often. Our room overlooked the road and was very noisy all night long despite the shutters and double glazing. Breakfast was included in our price and was very good, plenty of choice and replenished regularly. Overall very good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MetsNYC
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Atlante Garden and were very pleased with our stay. The location is perfect for walking to major sites, especially the Vatican. The rooms were very clean and the staff exceptionally helpful. All in all, this is a great value and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay - 3rd Time”
Reviews.Author: liverbritts
Reviews.Content: Atlante Garden Hotel in Rome, Italy has brought us back to Rome 3 times since 2004. This hotel is second to none. They are right in the heart of everything there is to see in Rome, and within walking distance of everything except the colloseum. The rooms are nice, clean, and comfortable. The staff is very welcoming and accomodating. The breakfast in the morning is too good to pass up with delicious cappucino! Get to Rome and stay with the Atlante group soon!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good service, friendly helpful staff and good location.”
Reviews.Author: TheFlynns60
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and had a family room on the corner of the first floor which meant that there was quite a lot of noise from the street - particularly as the refuse collections seem to happen about 4-5am! However the hotel itself was very comfortable and clean. Sheets were changed after the second night and clean towels every day. Breakfast was not included in the package we booked but was available at 12EU each. We didn't bother getting breakfast in the hotel and the first morning found a cafe down the street where we had a great breakfast for 8EU each. Nice quiet/reading room with computer - internet 3EU for half hour, 5EU for one hour, and comfortable bar area with TV. The free pick-up from the airport is great. We also got the hotel's taxi back to the airport which cost 55EU for 4 people. The staff were all superb, very professional and helpful, fluent English, German etc. Special thanks to lovely Elena in the bar. The location is good, very near to the Vatican and Castel St. Angelo where there is a very good tourist information kiosk which gave us good info on buses etc. Felt it was good value for money and we had a great trip. Would probably stay at Atlante Garden again. The hotel's website is slightly misleading regarding the restaurant etc, as this is at the Atlante Star just around the corner. However this didn't bother us as we ate out at different places every night.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel with professional Staff”
Reviews.Author: Lawin4cr
Reviews.Content: Family vacation in Rome this past October and we stayed at the Atlante Garden Hotel. Rented 3 rooms, all on the same floor and right next to each other, though would have been nice to have some space between family!! What was odd, was that each room was so different and each room had very different comforts. We were on the 3rd floor facing the side street, which is much quieter than the main street. Rooms all clean, however you have to enter the bathroom, and step up a step to use the toliet and or tub. The tub is a jacuzzi tub, but when I used mine (room #344), the water ran out from under the tub onto the marble title floor, making it very slippery. It only leaked when the jets were on. The tub is also the shower, and stepping out of it, on to the first step is a bit scary. The breakfast served each morning was excellent, probably the best I have had in my many trips to Italy. The female staff, from the servers, bar maid, room cleaners, etc...were all very friendly and polite. The male staff was professional, but never overtly friendly. Location can't be beat, 5 blocks or so from the Vatican. Metro station is also about 5 blocks away. Would stay here again. P.S. take advantage of the 5th floor patio area. We would share a bottle of wine each night under the stars and the staff was always helpful with getting us glasses or ice when need free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY hotel I want to stay at”
Reviews.Author: nollymac
Reviews.Content: I have just completed my fourth visit to Rome and each time I have stayed at the Atlante Garden. On this occasion I spent 14 nights here and enjoyed each and every one of them. The twin room was very clean and comfortable, as is the rest of the hotel. House keeping is exceptionally good here. The continental style breakfast is more than adequate and the young ladies who take care of the breakfast room are friendly and helpful. All the staff that I came into contact with were very friendly and very helpful, and knowledgable. I wouldnt want to stay anywhere else, in fact I am already planning my next visit to Rome and looking forward to returning to the Atlante Garden.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time and a great stay, would very much recommend”
Reviews.Author: k_dopson
Reviews.Content: I visited Rome with my girlfriend back in August this year for her birthday and was very happy with the hotel. The free-transfer from the airport direct to the hotel was very useful and the location of the hotel itself made getting around the city very easy, with buses and the subway running nearby. The room was clean and comfortable and the staff were very helpful with any questions we had to ask. Great time and great memories!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location for sights”
Reviews.Author: brummiesi1979
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very friendly staff. Room was a little bit shabby in places, great value for money thou. No restaurant for dinner, this is at the sister hotel accross the road. Bed was uncomfortabe as matresses were old, bathroom was clean and very elegant.

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest hotel I've stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: steveo123456
Reviews.Content: From the free transfer they were friendly and helpful, and very informative. The room was bigger than we expected, and a jacuzzi was a nice surprise. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a nice, quiet hotel and good value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Blarnee
Reviews.Content: This is not The Ritz, but then it doesn’t pretend to be and, for traveling on a budget, this was a good deal for the price paid in downtown Rome literally a five minute walk to the Vatican. The property and room were clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. The advertised rooftop restaurant no longer exists and anyone asking for it is referred to a sister hotel a few blocks away which apparently has one. We didn’t try the breakfast service but it looked attractive and appetizing. The electrical was scary. The TV cable connection had to be “jiggled” every so often to recover the signal which kept cutting out. The TV power plug also had to be regularly “jiggled” after unexpected cut outs. Upon removing a bedside plug from the wall the entire faceplate of the plug came away too. When coupled with the fact that the only fire exits seem to be the stairs alongside the single, central (tiny) elevator, I was not left feeling at all comfortable about my means of emergency exit in the event of a fire. The wall shower Faucet was loosely connected to the wall and the showerhead was ill-fitting making showering a bit difficult. Otherwise the bathroom was very clean and daily, freshly laundered, towels were exceptionally good. Air Conditioning controls did not seem to function properly so the room tended to vary between too hot or too cold. The hotel was quiet, the beds comfortable and overall we enjoyed our stay and would probably return.

Reviews.Title: “Good value with friendly,helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Jumick
Reviews.Content: The rooms are furnished in traditional Italian style & are clean and comfortable. The hotel is in a convenient location, only a few blocks from the Vatican. As mentioned in other reviews, the free transfer from the airport is great just remember to email the hotel 2 days before. Plus the return transfer is good value at 40 euros as the local taxi firms advertise 50 euros. The continental breakfast was good. There is no restaurant on site & the main street ones are pricey but if you venture to the side streets you will find there are quality, inexpensive eateries to choose from. The reception staff were very helpful & friendly, patiently explaining directions & public transport eg the number 81 bus takes you to the Colosseum. We did find that there is some street noise at night, mainly traffic but we were too exhausted from sight seeing for it to trouble us for long!

Reviews.Title: “Good position, comfortable, friendly, a little tired but a good price”
Reviews.Author: rholland
Reviews.Content: Tips for the Hotel English Sky TV should be available not just one crappy BBC News channel Tea making in room should be available Don't advertise the roof top garden if it is infact in another hotel even if it is only around the corner Offer airport transfers both ways for 40 euro rather than free one way 40 return you might get more takers For the traveller Make sure you find out what the extra charges such as "service charge" are before you enter any restaurant and ask about anything put on your table that you may conceivably be charged for such as bread, pretzels or smallie eats. ALWAYS check you bill. I say this even more so than any other country in Europe Great food good price no extras tiny restaurant in small lane second left towards the Vatican only problem was we only found it on our last night

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lenny10Oslo
Reviews.Content: Atlante Garden Hotel is a nice hotel - good value for the money. Polite and nice staff, good service - and we liked the location; 10 minutes walk to the main street to the Vatican where all the 'hop on-hop-off' buses were assembled; and we used such a bus to get around all of Rome. And a cozy bar where we could round off an evening or two. So why not this hotel next time (2nd time..) we visit this fantastic city??

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Norjost
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four days and had a superiour double room. Nice and quiet room (away from traffic), attractive bathroom with jacuzzi, even better, a teracce on the roof of the hotel. We purchased some parma and fruit from the local market - the old style, just a block away. They changed carpets on a few rooms we observed. Obviously, the management knows that clean, nice and tidy makes a huge difference.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful people, pretty little room”
Reviews.Author: philzaga
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel in mid-August. They had a driver pick us up from the airport (shuttle bus, minivan kind of thing) and took us directly to the hotel. Once we got there, they were kind enough to let us leave our luggage with them until check-in time so that we could walk around (we went to Castel San Angelo 3 blocks away and then to the Pantheon, about a 20 minute walk away). When we got back, our room was ready and they kindly showed us our way. The room was small, by US standards, but it was cozy and clean. It was prettier than I expected and had all the things that I needed. The only minor thing that I didn't like about this hotel was that it was not near central Rome. It is by the Vatican, on the left bank of the Tiber River.
