In order to get to ancient Rome, you'd either have to take a cab (about 7 euros) or walk (about 30 minutes) or take public transportation (we didn't do this so I can't tell you how it is). Also, it is much quieter on the left bank of the Tiber than it is on the right bank (perhaps more so than usual since we went in August). Almost all of the shopping, good dining, and the tourist attractions (except for the Vatican of course) is on the right bank of the Tiber, and pretty far from the hotel. Luckily for us, we booked all our tours with hotel pick-up so none of this was an issue. Don't let me scare you though, the location is not terrible. It's not in the middle of nowhere. It's 4 blocks from the river, so you can get to the right bank by foot with no problems, if that's what you want to do. Also, a 7 euro cab ride to the center of the city is not bad at all, and we did it quite a number of times. Both of us enjoyed this hotel very much and would stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: jackie186470
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Atlante Garden with my teenage daughter for 14 nights in July, it was an excellent base for exploring Rome with Metro about 5mins walk. The staff were very helpful and couteous. Our room was very clean and comfortable and having at least one meal at the restaurant is highly recommended, fantastic food, service and spectacular view. We will definitely be back Jackie Belfast

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at Atlante Garden”
Reviews.Author: scottbug2
Reviews.Content: Atlante Garden hotel experience was fantastic. I travel globally for a living, and must say, the value was excellent. First, we arrived at the airport, bags took 1.5 hours, but the dirver was still waiting for us, the free transportation to the hotel is a fantastic benefit. The staff were extremely kind and helpful. We had a room for a family of 4. The room was very large. TV lacked some good English stations, but we were not in Rome for TV. Beds comfortable, AC worked fantastic, which is hard to find in Rome. Bathroom was large, with jacuzzi tub. Decor was loud, but fit our needs. We loved this hotel and will be back. The neighborhood was full of great restaurants, Ottavania metro was a very short walk. Staff booked and recommended a tour, overall very good, not a luxury hotel, but for seeing Rome, great!

Reviews.Title: “Location great, service great, rooms gloomy and too warm.”
Reviews.Author: mamanana25
Reviews.Content: The location to the Vatican and St. Peter's square couldn't be better. Just a short walk away. Breakfast was good. Front desk service great. Rooms too humid and warm for me. Way too noisy at night. Could hear outside traffic all night long. Room service was greatly missed. Like having coffee in my room first thing in the morning, before having to get ready for the day. Seems to be the norm in Europe, unless you stay in an American chain hotel. If you want a nice place to stay for a visit to the Vatican, this one would be good. Just ask for a room away from night traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely beautiful hotel.Staff amazing.Will definately stay again”
Reviews.Author: Lyndsay-Tim
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for the Vatican,literally 2 minute walk.Walking distance to every where else-Spanish steps,Trevi fountain,Colloseum etc etc etc.Hotel is amazing.staff very helpful and accomodating.Rooms are beautiful,jacuzzi bath is a must!Location is perfect,lots of restaurants nearby.We can't rate this hotel highly enough,can't wait to go back again

Reviews.Title: “Not in city center, but close to the Vatican and free airport pick-up is well worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Nightingale0527
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights without breakfast. It is not right in the city center, but it is very close to the Vatican (can see the Vatican's cupola from our bedroom), Castel San Angelo and a whole street of shopping on Cola Di Rienzo (2 blocks away). Nearest metro stop is Ottaviano or you can catch a variety of buses on Piazza Risorgimento (3-4 short blocksaway from hotel). Their free airport pick-up was a huge attraction - it's nice not to have to worry about figuring out the transportation system the minute you land, plus it allows you to sort of get oriented and gives you an opportunity to observe the surroundings as you are being driven to your hotel. Our hotel room was spacious by European standard and we had a patio garden off our bedroom -- very nice, but we were not able to make use of it as husband and i were besieged with terrible allergies and outdoor furnitures were intermittently wet from the rain - don't forget to bring an umbrella by the way, so sightseeing need not be interrupted with rain (common, but it is only short, usually in the afternoon). There is a rooftop garden that was more often than not, empty. My only complaint is that there was no shower curtain or door so water spilled all over and made showering freely difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers della Roma”
Reviews.Author: UneasyQueasyRider
Reviews.Content: Overpriced! dark rooms, dingy carpets, partially functioning plumbing, gnats. Nothing intolerable, except the place advertises itself--and prices itself--as a 4-star hotel. What they offer simply isn't four-star service. Location is great for touring sites around the Vatican, but next time we'll be looking for a more reasonably priced B&B. A disappointment overall.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Michelle1816
Reviews.Content: This hotel was all it promised to be and more. The rooms were clean, very comfortable and air conditioned. The staff were always friendly and very helpful. Not being able to speak any Italian, the staff were always able to help us with advice on where to visit and how to get there and really made us feel at ease. By far the hotels biggest asset is the location. Only a few minutes away from the Vatican and surrounded by lovely little restaurants and pizzerias. Also, there is a metro stop just a few blocks away that made travelling round the city so easy and cheap! It was a fantastic holiday and I would highly recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-No free breakfast if you're a Priceliner.”
Reviews.Author: liketotravel167
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location. You can walk to the Vatican (5 minutes) and you're very close to the metro and bus stops (bus 81 takes you to the Coliseum for 1 Euro). We were told upon check-in that our rate didn't include breakfast (that's unusual for Priceline).

Reviews.Title: “most convenient location .”
Reviews.Author: mike_lars
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Atlante Garden from 30th may to 9 june 2010.we were pick up by the free shuttle at the airport to the hotel. The hotel is situated in the best location in which everything is just a stone throw away. we had a four year old with us so location is important as we can return to the hotel whenever we want for a break and then go back for sight seeing later.The staff are very very friendly and helpful always smiling and never hesitant to help us in any way they can. The room is clean and comfortable but a new bath tub would be good.Otherwise all is as expected by us when we booked it. We would definitely stay in this hotel if we visited Rome again.We highly recommend this hotel to everyone who wants to see Rome and the Vatican area in their own sweet time.

Reviews.Title: “good choice of location”
Reviews.Author: ArmaghApple
Reviews.Content: welcome sets the standard and the welcome was good. my first room had a single bed but i asked and was given a room with a double. the room was spacious and cool which was important for the june heat. breakfast was selfservice but the staff ladies were pleasant. nice quiet atmosphere through out the hotel - good for relaxing. location beside St Peter's could not have been better. and once i got the hang of the buses from the street and from St Peter's Rome was easily visited. the roof top was cool and refreshing. and if you have the chance eat at the sister hotel restaurant - not for every day but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience !”
Reviews.Author: chasca2
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Atlante Garden in Rome. The room was clean, quite and comfortable. The location was ideal - we could walk to the Vatican and the tour buses we wanted. Breakfast was very good. The staff was helpful. We would return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: ParkersDerby
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Atlante Garden Hotel for my husband's 40th birthday treat. Excellent hotel accommodation based near to Castel St Angelo and St Peter's being only a short walk away. The hotel was very clean and the standard of the rooms were excellent. All staff were very friendly and the complimentary breakfast was great. We are thinking of taking another trip to Rome next year and we would definitely stay at the Atlante Garden Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “you get your money's worth”
Reviews.Author: pugprincess
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. It is a 4-star hotel, however, when you compare its price with the other lower starred-hotels, they are not that much different. It is so near to shopping area (5-10 min walk), to the Vatican city (10 min walk). There are also lots of restaurants around. It is also very accessible to bus, and metro. The staff speak good english, the room and bathroom are clean. But one thing which I liked a lot is the safety around the neighborhood. The downside, you have to pay for the internet and not much choices served at the buffet breakfast. But overall, will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with one exception”
Reviews.Author: donatravel
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Italy and England. I spent 4 nights at Atlante Garden with my husband and college daughter. Triple room was really large and perfect for us. Make sure you ask for high floor. Traffic noice was not a problem if you shut the wooden shutters. Breakfast is plenty to start the day. Location is wonderful was able to walk to most of the sights which made it really easy. Now I am sad to say on the last day my daughters phone was stolen from our room she had left it on the bed while we went downstairs to eat before we took the train to Siena. She insisted she left it in the room but we checked the breakfast room just in case but was not there. So all I can say is keep your things in the safe or with you.. We called right away to cancel the phone but it was just a bummer for her to not have her phone for the next 2 weeks of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodating Staff, Good Location, and Value”
Reviews.Author: ForeignRelations
Reviews.Content: Rome was our first city on an Italian tour and Atlante Garden was the first hotel. It is good if you'd prefer to stay in a quiet area of town which was nice. There were still some late night food spots in case you're starved in the middle of the night. All in all it was a good experience! We got a pretty good deal on this hotel for a deluxe room. When we landed apparently they put us in a smaller room but gave us free breakfast for all the days to make up for it. The staff was accomodating and all in all there was nothing terrible about it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: BertR
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located near the Vatican. Outstanding breakfast buffet. Helpful front desk staff. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem! Great Value for Money and within steps of Vatican City!”
Reviews.Author: 20somethingnomad
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at the Adlante Garden hotel. We had such a great time! The rooms are spacious and clean, and there was even a spa bath! The staff were very hospitable and recommended some local places to eat as we were on a budget! We were a stones throw of Vatican city and Castle D'Angelo, absolutely magical walking through there at night we had arrived. Rome is a wonderful city and with a base like the Adlante Garden hotel you really cant go far wrong, you are within walking distance of the major sites and metro station. Just remember to bring ear plugs as this is a city that never sleeps, even when you need too! We booked our break in Rome through a website so we got a substantial discount on the nightly rate advertised. So we were more then satisfied with the standard of the room, that said I wouldnt have been if I had paid the going rate. I would rate to hotel as more of a 3 star then 4, rooms are a little tierd looking (but that all adds to the character! in my opinion)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.Extremely comfortable and staff welcoming, and ideally situated”
Reviews.Author: JFinchGuildford
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice hotel,;extremely comfortable with welcoming and helpful staff.It is also ideally situated for exploring the Vatican and other sites

Reviews.Title: “Would Have been a nice hotel if they had bothered to book us there”
Reviews.Author: NickelSkit
Reviews.Content: I am traveling with two friends, we had booked through Expedia for the 24 of april, we were forced to move our plans a week later due to unforseen circumstanstes. We had called expedia and changed everything with no problem, they told due to a computer glich they could not change the dates online but that they had spoken to the hotel and that they had chaged the reservation in the hotels computer. A week before we were due to leave I emailed to the hotels to just double check our reservatiomns, I got an email back saying that there was no record of us in the system and did we have the right hotel? After 5 very fusterating calls to expedia we were informed that, the hotel had recived the call but that they never botherd to put us into the system. Expedia is'ent helping us at all and the Hotel is being very rude about it. We were looking forward to staying at the hotel due to the really good reviews on here but after being jerked around by the hotel we will never stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, loved Rome”
Reviews.Author: paulco1
Reviews.Content: This excellent hotel is ideally placed in what is truly a spectacular city. Very close to the Vatican and many other essential sites. This is an extremely comfortable and elegant hotel. The staff are courteous and very helpful. I very much enjoyed my stay at the Atlante Gardens and would have no hesitation in returning there on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip.”
Reviews.Author: bbatsch
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, just a couple blocks from the Vatican and a metro stop. Our room was always clean and comfortable. There was a TV with only an English channel but we did not spend much time in the room anyway. Too much to see and do. Hotel staff was great and very patient with requests. They have a free shuttle that picks you up at the airport. I sent an email a couple days ahead with my flight info and they were waiting there to pick me up. Restaurants on the main roads were a little pricey but the smaller ones on the side roads were great and a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Toonsey
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, walking distance to not only St. Peter's Basillica but also Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, etc. Great little restaurant just around the corner. Staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “value and location”
Reviews.Author: Neilcatele
Reviews.Content: good room for the money and close to metro trams etc. good breakfast. go to Treveste for best food, dont do bus tour waste of money. book colossuem and vatacan before you go to avoid ques.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: xyon87
Reviews.Content: Got a cheap deal through expedia. We couldn't believe how little we paid for such a nice, smart hotel a stone's throw away from the Vatican! It's so easy to walk around Rome, so it was perfect for us. The room was really nice, althought the fabric on the wall is a bit weird (but interesting!) Really clean and great service. Free one-way airport transfer included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: buglet68
Reviews.Content: Two blocks from the vatican, close to St. Angelo's. I felt safe walking around at all times of the night. The hotel has seen better days but it's clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Nialith
Reviews.Content: I can highly recommend this hotel as we had a very pleasant stay. The staff is very friendly and attentive. This is an upscale hotel so the prices were not unexpected and also are in line with other hotels of this stature. They have a beautiful view of the Acropolis and the Parthenon. I highly recommend the 'upgrade' to your room which allows access to the lounge. This includes a breakfast in the morning and Happy Hour from 5-9pm. The snacks they served were excellent. There is also a large balcony in the lounge that overlooks the city and the Acropolis. While we used taxis for the most part while we were there, the hotel is within walking distance to the Acropolis and the shopping/dining areas surrounding it. The hotel also offers a free shuttle service to these areas as well. I highly recommend staying at this hotel. If I ever make it back to Athens, it will definitely be where I stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good price, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: shanelyon
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel. It is a little dated but what isn't in Rome. There are two Atlante Hotels near eachother. The Atlante Garden, which is the cheaper of the two, and the Atlante Star. The Atlante Garden does not have a restraunt and the website claims to have free breakfast but you have to book online with the hotel to get the free breakfast. Rooms are not tiny but also not huge. Beds are a bit hard and air conditioning doesn't work all that well so be weary in the hot summer months. In all I enjoyed the hotel it was extremely close to the Vatican and other areas of interest. You don't have to be that picky about your hotel, really how much time do you plan on spending in the room your in Rome get out and enjoy the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Would DEFINITELY go back to this one!”
Reviews.Author: malinda430
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were wonderful. They were very friendly and helpful when we needed assistance, whether it be with confirmations, directions, or anything else we needed. The room was smaller than what we were accustomed to, but it was very nice and especially clean. The bed was VERY comfortable and the lighting was more than sufficient. The only problem we had with the room was its location. We were in a lower level, corner room. Even with the windows and shutters closed, the noise from the street was quite loud, especially very late at night, from passers by and traffic. We could also hear the people in the room next to us through the wall on occassion. The breakfast was ample but I miss a good scrambled egg and bacon. Insofar as the hotel's proximity to sites, there is none better. It is all of a five minute walk or less to the Vatican and St Peters or to Castel Sant Angelo. We even walked to Piazza Navonna in less than 15 minutes! There is an abundance of shopping and eating within a two block radius of the hotel, too, but if you want more, the rail and bus stops are just a two minute walk. Overall, this hotel's positives far outweighed the negatives and we would definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Value in well located, quiet area of Rome”
Reviews.Author: HoldenBikes
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were all very friendly and kept this small hotel clean and running well. The hotel is only about 4-5 blocks from Vatican City and an easy walk to most areas of the city. The subway is a 10 minute walk. The included breakfast was good with enough variety to satisfy - order a cappucino or latte. The rooms were small but clean and quiet for a good night sleep after hours of walking! The free shuttle from the airport is a bonus as the airport is at least 30-40 minutes away. Recommended for high value, location, cleanliness, friendly staff, and very peaceful sleeps.

Reviews.Title: “The eternal city was a memerable trip all round.”
Reviews.Author: Bericwickens
Reviews.Content: Hi and Thank you for a very pleasant stay at the Atlante Garden Hotel in the centre of Rome. Only 2 blocks from the Vaticgan. The Hotel staff were very freindly and the service was great. It was clean and the rooms very comfortable. The breakfast was a little limited but ok to get you started in the morning. Overall very good value as we got one free night and paid for two. There was 6 of us and I got no complaints from anyone. We had a great trip to Rome and the hotel is a vital contribution to a memerable trip. Only regret that due to being in March was unable to eat in the roof top Garden. Beric Wickens

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: RickeyandD
Reviews.Content: Rome an truely amazing experience. The Atlante Garden Hotel is a reasonable priced hotel in a location that cannot be beat. The fact they provide free airport pickup and subsidized airport drop off is enough to make this an option worth considering. The hotel is starting to show its age and is a little worn around the edges. The road noise is considerable, our stay was on the fourth floor and we could feel the room tremble everytime a large vehicle drove by, I imagine this would be worse at lower levels but it didn't bother us as were only slept in the room. The breakfast buffet is a reasonable deal at 9 euros, not free but it was an excellent way to start your day, go early if you want a seat. The room was very large by European standards and well appointed. The only real issue was there was a pretty strong smell of mildew in the room that was bothersome but manageable if you kept the room aired out. The location is the selling point, only a few minutes from the Vatican and easy walking distance to all major attractions if you are at all active. The hotel has an excellent system to order taxis's so we could rv with excursions in the morning. In short if you are familiar with travel in this part of the world this is a good hotel to sleep and prepare for your day of discovery. If you are someone who needs antiseptic North American style accomodations this may not be for you. The staff was helpful, friendly and we felt safe in and about the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, excellent service and wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: sfhsu
Reviews.Content: Pick us up for free at FCO airport was an unbeatable value of Atlante Garden Hotel. Front desk personnel all spoke an excellent English. One of them gave me information on how to obtain tickets to see Pope on Wed. March 10, 2010. This was an unforgetable experience and most memorable moment we had in Rome. Breakfast was more than adequate and coffee was good. There is a room for improving quality and quantity of fresh fruit. Don't forget to buy Roman Card to be used for two free tourist attraction and three days' public transportation. Bus stops and Metro station are very close to Atlante Garden Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Completely disappointing”
Reviews.Author: sunnin_13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel about 9 years ago and it was perfectly fine. It was fairly inexpensive, so for the price, it was completely acceptable. Just stayed for another 10 days in early March 2010. This hotel has gone WAY downhill. A few examples of what we encountered: Every fixture in the bathroom was falling apart. The shower head would not stay up, instead drooping down, “showering” the wall. Had to hold up the shower head to take a proper shower. Pieces of the sink faucet fell off. Hot water was only available if you used it before 8 am. The service was absolutely horrific. Only 1 of the 4 front desk attendants we encountered were helpful. Basics like shampoo and toilet paper were not replenished either. The cleaning lady was on her cell phone every time we saw her, so I guess she was too busy to do her job. Also, the skimpy continental breakfast that one of the front desk attendants told us was included was charged to us while checking out. Since we were already running late to catch our flight (because the front desk didn’t follow through on the wake up call we requested), we had to pay it. 9 Euro per person for coffee and a croissant. Would have gladly gone elsewhere for breakfast if I was told it wasn’t included. Didn’t really appreciate having that surprise upon checkout. Location is just OK. If you are mainly going to the Vatican or Castel Sant’ Angelo, location is perfect. We mainly spend time across the Tiber, near the Pantheon or Piazza Navona, where there are better restaurants and things to do, so in that respect, the location is a bit out of the way and a far walk or subway ride.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Deedee60
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at the Atlante Garden three times before. This last time was awful. The bathroom was in desperate need of renovations. Pieces of the fixtures were falling off. The room was never replenished with tissues or toilet paper. It was not cleaned thoroughly. The staff was not very friendly and did not call when you asked for a wake up call, especially the day that you are going to the airport. I often would recommended this hotel but NEVER again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Rome”
Reviews.Author: kaatok
Reviews.Content: This is a real Rome ....in the middle of everything...I highly recommend this place.My wife and 20 year old daughter loved the charm and the beautiful suite we had.There staff at the desk is top notch.Plop yourself here in Rome and you will not be dissapointed.If you book.... ask them to give you a room where the restaurant is located...they have two hotels in close prox....to one another...We had a lovely room and the staff will help you much.Ask them which busses go to the different sites...they are only a $1.50 to go anywhere to see the sites.Maybe the negatives....that are written, are in the other building. I do not Know.But what I do know is this......We loved this place.

Reviews.Title: “The worst "4-star" hotel I've stayed yet”
Reviews.Author: cincikidd
Reviews.Content: I have no clue why this hotel claims to be a 4-star place. It's not a 4-star by any standards I am aware of. As other reviewers say, Hotel 6 might be better. The personnel was not exactly friendly, put it mildly. I called them few days before our check in to ask for separate beds in a room since we were traveling with a child. When we arrived, they put us in a room with a queen bed and upon my request to change the room they started showing me Priceline regulations and advised to call the company. After numerous debates the issue was escalated to a manager who finally knew English well enough to realize we were not looking for a double-room but rather for an extra bed. OK, we got one, but it was the first hotel in my life where we got two twin-size beds and no extra pillow/blanket/towel, etc. for a third person. My wife complained on the neck problems after sleeping there for just three nights. Also, b/c the hotel faces a busy street, you can hear noise 24/7 especially if you have a jetleg and get overly sensitive to the sounds. For whatever reason, the clerk at the front desk put the numbers of our passports into the system and warned us that this is for the police that may come and check the room. Are you kidding me? Police coming to check a room in a 4-star hotel or be it even a hostel. This is not a railway station or whatever, and I don't give a damn s...t to Italian police. Why would you want to come to my room? Anyways, this was the most bizarre explanation I have ever heard at the hotel but I believe everything is possible in Italy. The room was tiny and didn't look even close to what you'd expect to find in a 4-star hotel. There were paint stains, various wires, falling power outlets - you name the rest. Jacuzzi was not entirely clean but was acceptable except for the broken plug that wouldn't retract when you turn the handle. Of course, we discovered after we took a bath so I had to remove it manually which was not exactly easy given the bath was full. Sure thing, no one bothered to fix it. The room had the tiniest TV you can possibly find on the market. I was not even aware you can still buy it, but apparently this was a special order. The netbook size screen (perhaps 11") was a joke. However, you won't need it anyways since it only had ONE English channel, namely CNN. The TV stood on the ugly receiver and both had a whole bunch of wires connected to the extension cord on the floor. For whatever reason, there was a two-inch metal bolt protruding from the door. I''ve yet to figured out the purpose of the thing, but it was quite annoying. The breakfasts were OK, but the coffee was terrible, which is quite unusual for Italy. One more thing that stroke me is that I was going to order a taxy to get to the airport and got a qoute of Euro 50 while I knew that there is a fixed price of Euro 30. I am not sure if it was a purposeful mislead since they said they prepay reservations and asked to pay directly at the front desk or the guy didn't know the price (which I doubt though), but in any case for a hotel pretending to be a 4-star such attitude is inappropriate. We ended up getting a taxi just outside which took us to the airport for 30 Euro as clockwork. Once again, I don't know why this hotel claims to be a 4-star establishment. It's a solid 2 1/2 stars, maybe 3 stars, but I'd be reluctant to give it more than 3 stars even if someone put a gun to my head. I believe that they followed all technicalities (jacuzzi, TV, room service, restaurant, etc.) but that was just it. Overall, I didn't feel like I was a desired guest there and I would definitely suggest you to stay away from this place, unless you make a blind bid. The location is great however, two blocks from the Vatican City (Saint Peter's and Musem), two blocks to Octavian subway and within walking distance from the center (Spanish steps, shopping districts). There's a bus/trolley car stop right outside. I suggest you to stay in a brand name hotel to get what you'd expect from a 4-star hotel. We used to Stay in Carlton in Amsterdam and Marriott in Paris and both hotels were top-notch, beyond what you'd expect to get. Atlante Garden pales in comparison to most hotels I was staying when I was a budget student traveler.

Reviews.Title: “A nearly hotel”
Reviews.Author: ngordonc
Reviews.Content: While marketed as a separate entity, this hotel is the B&B "annex" to the Atlante Star - they knowingly advertise the Roof Garden even on the board outside but this is at the Star, Guests can use the roof garden (restaurant/ bar etc) but the latter was closed for our visit - not much good on a rugby weekend. The breakfast was basic and the coffee/ tea was very poor for Italy - other guests went out to the local cafe. No room service of course so quite how this hotel claims a 4 star rating escapes us. Their own bar was functional but closed at 11pm - not much good on a rugby weekend when you do not even get out of a restaurant until 11pm - hunting for a night cap was a bore! Concierge staff were very good indeed and helpful; hotel location was excellent for our purpose - Vatican a 10 minute stroll away; taxis everywhere. Local restaurants were on Borgo Pio (5 minutes walk) but were quite touristy - the centre was a 10 minute taxi ride away and a 20 minute stroll back. Rooms (bed/ cleanliness) were good - ropey TV system, very limited mini bar (beer/ coca cola and water), no coffee/ tea - wonderfull whiff of drains/ sewers on occasions but it was Rome after all. Pricey for what was actually delivered rather than marketed - the websites whist accurate need to be read closely as they are economical with the descriptions.

Reviews.Title: “Step Inside Romes Best”
Reviews.Author: RoopLondon
Reviews.Content: Fantastic staff helped me organise the night I would propose to my partner!!! They all spoke good english and even settled a cab fair when I was a little too drunk on me behalf. Their best kept secret is not only that you can walk to all Romes major attractions within 20minutes but their sister Hotel the Atlante Star....Has one of the best restaurants on its rooftop with fantastic views of St Peters Basillica!!!! Well Worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, eccentric and charming”
Reviews.Author: JohnChiongLuke
Reviews.Content: Winning at a first bid of US80 per night on Priceline for a 4 star hotel, I was estatic to see the posh website.. however after reading the reviews on trip advisor, my expectations were somewhat tempered and in a way I was glad they were.. this is a 3 star hotel without any of the modern gadgetry you would be expecting from the usual 4 stars.. however, if being immersed in the local culture is what you are looking for, then this quaint little hotel is for you.. unmistakably italian style sofas and furniture abound, generous warm splashes of gold and maroon on the wallpaper, big windows with the ubiquitious shutters you see everywhere in rome, the smallest lift in the world, surprise jacuzzi in the bathroom, minutes away from the basilica, you will hit local winding streets, pizzerias, marketplace.. it's almost like living in a local's place.. ok, on to the highlights: the hotel offers free pick-up (but not drop-offs) at FCO airport which will save you E40 for 2 pax! Not bad, rite? The location is fantastic in Vatican City, and if you need to go to central Rome, you can catch a bus at the front or the metro abt 10mins away.. the bad points: uncomfortable beds, small tv, traffic noise, limited facilities (cool rooftop though) and only one staff at the reception area which is beneath street level.. overall, an interesting stay..

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tech&NAU
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel only a few blocks from the Vatican. Has all the services you need - you can select breakfast for 9 euros. We chose to grab a coffee and pastry across the street at at the Ottavian (I think that's the name) - a simple family owned bar and sandwich shop - seemed to be a favorite local stop, great food and inexpensive beer (we went there a couple of times). The neighborhood is very safe and easy to get around (there is a bank machine right across the street too). It is about 5 blocks from the Metro and you pay for use of the internet. Our room was very nice - I was worried that our room was on the street...just close the shutters and all the sound goes away. Also the location is a quite neighborhood that does quiet down about 10:00pm and doesn't really get started for the day until about 8:00am. Stellar service - When we checked in we mentioned to the gentleman at the front desk that we had an early flight and were worried about transportation to the airport. He said he would find us a car for that morning - he took down our information and said to check with him the morning we were to leave. The morning we were to leave - at 6:00 the front desk called and our car was waiting for us (I didn't have to check with anyone). We were at the airport in 20 muniutes (no traffic and a fast driver). This is a well staffed hotel and very professional.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Steff42
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Rome was guided by trip advisor. The Atlante Garden Hotel is 10mins walk to the Vatican. Our room was very spacious and clean. The Jacuzzi bath was a welcome too, after sightseeing all day. Breakfast was very good too. The hotel has a free pick up service from the airport, and for 45Euros, they take you back. I would recommend this hotel when staying in Rome. I would recommend using the tourists buses, get the 24hr ticket, it allows you more time to visit the sights We found a fantastic local family run restaurant away from the tourist areas " Grotta Azzura" in via Cicerone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great value for money and an excellent service plus FREE airport pickup.”
Reviews.Author: family_from_bg
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, friendly staff, always clean and cosy we had four quiet nights, watched television and in the morning treated ourselves with nice breakfast, which was free for kids and 9 euro for adult walking distance to all city attractions.

Reviews.Title: “High Recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: PepperJulie
Reviews.Content: We had such a lovely stay at this hotel. It was very central, the staff were lovely, are room was a great size and nicely decorated. The jacuzzi was fab too. They don't have room service however, which was a bit of a shame, but restaurants very close by. The markets for shopping, clothes, shoes etc on the street a short walk from this hotel were really great too. ..and they suprised us with a bottle of sparkling wine, very lovely of them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: JFER1980
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel for a variety of reasons. Great location, Clean Room (not too small either), actual street parking available in a nice well lit neighborhood and the price is not bad. We were able to get to the historic downtown area in a matter of 15 minutes by foot. I am giving the hotel 4 stars instead of 5 because the front desk staff didn't seem overly friendly and once again a King size bed consisted of two mattresses stuck together which is no good whether your traveling with a date you want to be close to or someone you want to be separate from. Either way it is annoying and I don't know why they have to do it. I've seen in some cases where you can actually separate the beds but in this case they are stuck. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, especially someone who wants to be close to the Vatican. There are also restaurants and nightlife right around the corner. One other thing is that surprisingly even on the 5th floor it was a little noisy with the street below. I figured being that high up it wouldn't be an issue but you can really hear each car go by. It doesn't bother me much but some may consider it a mild issue.

Reviews.Title: “Thief Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveler816
Reviews.Content: This is what happened at our first day in this hotel: On the first evening after we arrived the hotel, we asked the hotel front desk for directions on how to get to a place. He gave us the directions then we left. When we returned to the hotel a couple hours later, I discovered that our suitcases’ locks had been broken and our laptop, camera, all the cash, even my daughter’s iPod and her bag had all been stolen. We immediately went down to the front desk and asked him to call the police so they could file a report, as would we. At first, he refused to call the police and said that we would have to visit the police station tomorrow instead. My wife and I then insisted that the police come today to check for any evidence. The front desk used the excuses ‘they can’t speak English’ and ‘they won’t come even if you call them’. We then said firmly that if he did not call the police himself, we would. Therefore, he called the police and the police came 15 minutes later. They inspected the damages and the door in which the lock was not broken or appeared to have used force to open. This led to the obvious conclusion that whoever had stolen from us had a key to the room and knew exactly when we were out. The next morning we visited the police office to file our report and review theirs. After all, we lost all our valuable belongings and all the cash, practically ruined our entire vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint little jewel off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: Gianna-I
Reviews.Content: We, my two sisters, my niece, and our mother, stayed here on a business/leisure trip, too short for our liking. The Atlante Garden is a wonderful place with very helpful and happy people. From the communication through e-mail to the small but comfortable bedrooms, we had the time of our lives. Location is excellent. Not too turisty, walking distance to the Vatican and the metro. More of a residential area. Nearby cafes and shopping; though we did not have time for that. Soffita, at Piazza del Resorgimento is a wonderful restaurant not too expensive. I think we were the only non italians.

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for cheap, spartan and close to the Vatican --- here it is.”
Reviews.Author: FilsProdigue
Reviews.Content: Bought it on Prlceline where it was listed as a 4 Star hotel; that characterization would make Pinnochio blush! While it is walking to the Vatican and a busy shopping area --- it is far from 4 star! It is in an off street, no driveway and you must go downstairs to enter. The rooms are old. The bedrooms, while old and a little tired --- they are very clean; the staff is quite adequate, breakfast is fair --- and it can be had cheap, It is a good buy.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was everything I expected and more..”
Reviews.Author: pitusita
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, close to all the major attractions Rome has to offer, staff were very friendly and helpful, a little bit noisy outside but that comes because is located right in the middle of a turist attractions, it didn't bother me....

Reviews.Title: “Terrific time in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Lan5
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very convenient to the Vatican and to public transportation. Local restaurants were very good and we appreciated the hotel's recommendations. Transportation from the airport to the hotel was free and our driver was waiting for us after we collected our luggage. The hotel helped us arrange transportation back to the airport at the end of our stay. The hotel has a breakfast in the morning but we were not aware of this until we noticed it one morning. Apparently it is free for some guests--it must depend on your reservation. We had a nice time and would stay at the Atlante Garden again.

Reviews.Title: “1st Trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: CarolynA3
Reviews.Content: The hotel is average but excellent to me; this was my first trip to Rome and I travelled by myself. The hotel was reasonable, located near the Vatican (within walking), the metro train, the Tour Buses pick up at this hotel, resturants within walking distance, airport pick up and return. The service was excellent. The desk clerk, bellman, bar tender, gals in the morning breakfast room, everyone was very friendly and very accomadating. The rate was very reasonable ($95 USD) per night single rate. It is definitely not the ritz, but very pleasant, everyone knew my name, I felt very safe by myself and anything I asked for was delivered to me.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel within walking distance of St. Peter's Basilica”
Reviews.Author: TonyMxlokk
Reviews.Content: We booked the Atlante Garden through airmalta.com. and stayed there for three nights. The hotel is very well placed in the centre of Rome close to the Vatican and Via Cola di Rienzo (for shopping, the equivalent of Oxford Street in London!). It offers free transfer from Fiumicino airport. Our room was clean and comfortable, and the staff was polite and very helpful. I recommend the Atlante to friends.

Reviews.Title: “It was a fantastic hotel with lovely staff in a delighful area of Rome!!!”
Reviews.Author: sweetcheeks_344
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely all the staff where polite and friendly. I would definitley recommend adding the breakfast to your accomodation when you book it was very nice. But also if you didn't feel like this there is a sweet little coffee shop exactly opposite the hotel that serves coffee and pastrys very reasonably priced. Rome can be an expensive place to eat but if you buy from the stand alone cart and sit somewhere picturesque as there are plenty of places to do this you could save a small fortune. The metro is very useful for getting to all the main sites and they run very often and is no more than a 10 min walk from the hotel. Overall this was a delightful trip to Rome and i would definitley return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: caao1999
Reviews.Content: We originally booked Atlante Star hotel, but when we arrived they sent us to Atlante Garden instead. We were a bit miffed, but Atlante Garden turned out to be a good hotel. Its just as convienient as Atlante Star and we were no distance from Vatican. Breakfast buffet is good and rooms are very nice. If I were to go to Rome again, I would defintely try and stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Counselor62
Reviews.Content: I especially appreciated the van pick-up at the airport, the friendly staff members at the hotel, and the large room with a jacuzzi tub. It was great being within walking distance of the Vatican and not far from restaurants. I travel a lot in Europe and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, friendly staff in a great location”
Reviews.Author: geauxtigers1981
Reviews.Content: The Atlante Garden is, by American standards, old and quaint. The staff is friendly and helpful and the premises are immaulate. The location is about as good as you can get without actually getting an apartment at the Vatican and you can walk easily to the majority of the best tourist spots in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times!”
Reviews.Author: passport_Z
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Atlante Garden Hotel. The shuttle driver was on time for pick up at the airport, I had to wait a bit for my room at check in because I got there before check in. The staff was helpful the location was great...walking distance to St. Peter's Square, The Vatican Museum, Metro and lots of shopping and dining options. I would highly recommend including the breakfast with your booking. It was well worth it. Overall I had zero issues with this hotel it was great and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: CULAW
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and two daughters. The staff speak English well and appreciated my attempt to speak Italian. The staff were awesome -- going out of their way to get information for me, making reservations, dining suggestions, etc. The maids really cleaned the rooms even dusting every corner. My only dissatisfaction was the noise level. If you stay here, ask for a room on the fifth floor away from the noise. We were on the first! My family and I were very comfortable here. The location is two blocks from the Vatican Museum and there are buses to take you throughout the rest of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Truly within walking distance and convenient to the Vatican and Vatican Museum, a quaint hotel with nice staff”
Reviews.Author: LoveItaly44
Reviews.Content: A great location, about a 10-15 minute walk to the Vatican. It is a pretty small hotel, but cozy, comfortable, and clean, with a large bathroom and nice accommodations. The staff was very helpful and friendly. A nice breakfast was included. There is also a nice, small bar for a night cap. The only negative was some traffic noise at night, which is probably to be expected for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star - No Way!”
Reviews.Author: AdventureHoundsLV
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't hold such a low opinion of this hotel if we hadn't booked into it as a 4 star accomodation. The tiny rooms (7' x 11') are decently appointed but that's where it ends. Mold, mildew, caked on scum (in tub and all over towel rack) and peeling paint best describe our bathroom. To check in you carry your own luggage down a flight of stairs to the basement where the front desk is located - no bellman or concierge. At least breakfast was decent but have had better in 2 or 3 star Italian hotels. If you're hoping for a 4-star experience, stay away. No way is a 4-star, even by Italian standards.

Reviews.Title: “Room I had here was better than it's sister hotel, the Atlante Star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: aztecmyk
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for one night and left Italy the next day. The room was huge. The bed was huge. The bathroom was huge. It was just my fiance and I, but we were put in a quadruple room. There were beds everywhere. I wish we had had this room earlier in the week when we first arrived in Rome, like our priceline reservation had set up for us. We were moved to the Atlante Star when we arrived in Rome the first time, and got the Atlante Garden on our return visit. You can buy internet for the room. They offer airport pick up, but you have to pay for the shuttle back. The hotel is very close to the Vatican and about 10 min walk to Ottaviano metro station. I don't know if I'd choose this place on my own, but it's not bad for using the "name your own price" option of priceline.

Reviews.Title: “not as presented”
Reviews.Author: mary3la
Reviews.Content: Although location was good, hotel was presented as handicapped user friendly and that is the opposite of the truth. There are steps down to the lobby. There are only high tub/shower combinations. There are no adjustments offered to make it usable for a leg disabled person using a cane.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and an excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: EdmontonRob
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff that are always smiling!! They arranged our transportation from the airport and to the port. The breakfast was continental with generous portions of fruits, cheeses, breads and eggs. Good coffee and juices The rooms were older but had that Italian feeling, which we liked! The bus and metro stations are 5 minutes from the hotel. There is a food market 5 minutes away which we used to buy bread, cheeses, meats and wine. We would then go back to the hotel and go up to the roof top (they have tables and chairs)and enjoy are meal.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best you can find, despite the good location.”
Reviews.Author: ddingermany
Reviews.Content: Yes this hotel was close to the Vatican, but on kind of a creepy street. We did not feel comfortable walking around there at night. Besides great towels this hotel was cramped and nothing to write home about, with an expensive breakfast. I would try a B&B for my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Their standard switcheroo”
Reviews.Author: frezz
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through pricelilne but when we got there we were switched to Atlante Star. I was happy I had read the previous reviews bc otherwise I would not have known this.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast + airport shuttle + location = excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Summer2009STL
Reviews.Content: We booked on Priceline.com, which included a free, wonderful breakfast each morning. Also, complimentary shuttle from the airport was a great mental and fiscal savings. The location wonderfully balances accessibility to all the sights, without feeling stuck in a tourist trap.

Reviews.Title: “Mistake”
Reviews.Author: lisamarie5
Reviews.Content: Location-great, but don’t ask front desk managers a thing beyond a few steps outside the hotel because they have no idea/suggestions/knowledge about anything! The first day I asked for the closest grocery store and after trying to talk me into just buying from the hotel, he showed me on a map in such a careless way that I ventured for miles all the way around the Vatican, only to be told by 7 people I asked all the way back the store was around the corner from the hotel. I came back to the hotel dripping with sweat and dead from fatigue, he just shook his head and didn’t care after I showed him his mistake. No restaurant suggestions either. The next morning when I asked for just a café because my purchase did not include breakfast (9euro each), the woman seemed so kind by making a tray of café and then piling on some little extras from the buffet table. This happened every morning. Tipped them well for their ‘generosity’. Little did I know that at the end of the stay I’d get a random charge without any explanation for “room service” plus who knows. He had no idea either how my sum was calculated, nor did he care. Internet is 5E/hour of wifi, 8E/6hrs. I could have stayed for only a little more in one of the best hotels that included breakfast and Internet. Go that route! By the time your extras & necessities are added in, you’ve surpassed what you would have paid at a good hotel. Good points location; some rooms are quiet; TV has 3channels -1 in English; Maids are good.

Reviews.Title: “Atlanta garden hotel rome”
Reviews.Author: happybeeno1
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from Rome to the Northeast of England having stayed in the Atlanta Garden Hotel. What can I say but fabulous!!!!! Room very clean and maid service every day, fresh linen and towels, my idea of heaven after a busy hot day sightseeing. The hotel is just streets away from Vatican and bus station is at end of road to all attractions in rome for just 1 euro wherever you go. Everyone of the hotel staff very helpful, polite and friendly, they recommended restaurants, pubs, ordered taxis and directed us in the right direction many times, nothing was a problem. Even got us a taxi to airport when Rome was playing juventus a little miracle. What lovely people. I have never written a review before and do consider myself quite a choosy person and not easily pleased but myself and my two friends were very impressed and hope to return someday soon. So a big thanks to the hotel staff for making our first stay in Rome wonderful. Highly recommended. Brenda, Valerie and Christinexx

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: DollyNyc
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through priceline and got a great deal. For the price, we were very happy with our room and service. The room had a very classical feel and the bed was comfortable. The TV in our rooms was not working, but the hotel compensated us well. They offered us a free ride to the train station in Rome. Overall me and my husband were very happy with this hotel and breakfast was great.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is clean with great air conditioning but the staff was ok”
Reviews.Author: lik2talk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last week for 3 days and I will say it was in a very good location. Very close to the Vatican and many other sights. I was also close to the bus station which we used to go out in the evening. The bus costs 1euro and you can ride for 1 hour and 15 minutes. The shopping was surprisingly cheap. especially for souvenoirs. We were able to get keychains, magnets and other small trinkets for 2-3 euros. The only setback was the weather. It was so hot that most days we were out only early morning or in the evening. August is not the time to visit. September is definately a better choice. Getting back to the hotel, it was clean and comfortable and the air conditioning was great. Especially during the day (91 degrees). The hotel staff was just ok they were helpful when needed but not very inviting. It seemed as though we were bothering them in some cases. But overall it was a good stay and I would recommend this hotel. Lastly the breakfast in the hotel cost 9 euro and it was mostly cereal and breads. I think one could do better outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: stevebaker
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations. The staff were immensely helpful the location is 5 minutes from the Vatican and the castle and walking distance of most of the main sights. I have already recommended this hotel to my friends and I would use the hotel again if I ever visit Rome again. more 5* than 4*

Reviews.Title: “A very comfotable and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorldlyBoston_MA_USA
Reviews.Content: The Atlante Garden Hotel is a charming hotel located 5 minutes walk from the Vatican and St Basilicas Church in a quiet location. The hotel is charming and decorated with warm colored drapes. The room was a good double bed sized room with ensuite bath/jacuzzi. The hotel staff were the friendliest and helpful I have ever come across whilst travelling. They were always able to assist with any request. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Ranchan
Reviews.Content: The location cannot be beat. Two blocks or less from the Vatican walls, and a 5-10 min walk to Castel San Angelo. 10-15 min walk to the metro station (which was fabulous btw - never more than a 2 min wait for a train). Do not expect a great hotel. The staff was generally courteous, but did not go out of their way to help you in any way. Do not expect even normal American customer service. The rooms were older, with broken shower fixtures that seemed like they would fall on your head. The shuttle to the hotel was great, but we had to pay for a shuttle back to the airport. The TV was awful - tiny, with horrible service. And I can confirm: The hotel shifts groups from hotel to hotel with dubious reasons - a group picked up by the same airport shuttle was moved from one hotel to another, supposedly due to a trashed room. The "King size bed" is actually two beds pushed together. It was loud at night, but double glazed windows pretty much kept the street noise out. That being said, we knew what we were getting into. The location is what sells the place. Seeing how we were able to beat the rush to the Sistine Chapel and the Basilica, I have no complaints, as long as everyone realizes that all four of its stars are for location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic trip”
Reviews.Author: pipoAntwerp
Reviews.Content: My daughter Evy and me had a wonderful trip to Rome for her 18th birthday. We had to walk about 10 minutes to the centre of Rome. The neighbourhood was safe to walk also in the evening

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Nancy07142009
Reviews.Content: Hotel Atlante sits in a good area. Everything is definitely in walking distance. The hotel is very cozy. The staff was great, and was very helpful. Internet access was pretty cheap! Will be staying there again next year! Very cool bartenders!!

Reviews.Title: “old rooms but generally polite staff”
Reviews.Author: psyence
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel from hotels.com because it seems like great value for money in a 4 star hotel and the complimentary 1 way airport-hotel transfer helped too. However when we reached the front desk, we were transferred to Hotel Columbus because there was an issue with our room. Supposedly a guest staying above didn't turn off the bath tap and our room was filled with water. We were told that they would have another room ready for us on the 2nd night, and they will give us a complimentary transfer to the train station + free breakfast. We were also pleased when they said that we only needed to leave our luggage in the other hotel the next morning, and that they will take care of everything. On the 2nd evening, we went directly to Atlante Gardens and they gave us a room on the top level because they still didn't have available rooms. We were happy with the upgrade. In the room we felt that it looked nice, and had a balcony. However the room looked a little worn down, but we didn't mind since we already got upgraded. But I think this was more of a 3star hotel because we stayed at other 4 star hotel in Milan and found a huge difference in room standards. Basically, if you can find good deal for this hotel, it's OK, but if you are paying high prices like those advertised on the website and in here, just be prepared. Also, the hotel recommended us to this restaurant nearby -La Barca, and I wrote a separate review on it and you can just search for La Barca, Rome. Please be very careful of this restaurant as they exploit tourists. On our last night, after the not so good experience from La Barca, we decided to clarify with the front desk about our free transfer to the train station. And to our disappointment, the staff ( a different one on shift) told us flatly that he doesn't have any information of this sort, and pointed to the blank comments on our information from a file. So we explained ourselves again, and he said to us "you know what, everyone says different things. just do what you like, I don't care". That upset us but we asked what he meant so he just said "yes, just come down tomorrow morning. we'll pay for it" That marked the not so pleasant end of our 5 night stay in Rome. But at least, we got a good deal, best room (though worn out, but a little better than what the other reviewer mentioned since they stayed in a regular room), free breakfast and complimentary transfers. So, just be prepared.

Reviews.Title: “Eh”
Reviews.Author: fuedli
Reviews.Content: The website is extremely misleading. This place is old and a little rundown. It is very convenient to the Vatican and surrounding areas, but other than that there really isn't much to recommend it. The king beds are actually two twins pushed together, that then slide apart. The airconditioning was great. Breakfast was fine. But, it is old and quite musty. Our bathroom had mold on the walls and our window opened onto someone else's balcony so we couldn't keep that open. The rooftop terrace was nice enough - no view of the vatican though. Overall, it was fine-ish. I'm sure there are much better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: zoolooklogie
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Rome in December 2006, and booked the Atlante Garden based on some web reviews. We were travelling with 2 elderly people, one with restricted mobility. We weren't looking for 5-star, just a nice place to use as a base. I found the hotel clean, pleasant rooms (ours were great sizes), fine condition, nothing fancy, and everything in good repair. The bathroom was spotless, well appointed, no problems with water temperature or pressure. We had breakfast every morning, and enjoyed a wide variety of continental dining. Again, nothing wow, but very tasty. Where the hotel really shone was the staff; they simply could not have been more helpful, more friendly, and more accommodating. As the main entrance is down some steps from the street level, one who was wheelchair abound a challenge. However the hotel staff simply made sure we could always use the emergency doors at the street level, even after dark. They were always on-hand to assist us with queries on the hotel, and getting around Rome. Though late in the year we enjoyed some lovely weather, and really got to know and admire this incredible city. The Atlante Garden, with it's brilliant staff really made our stay memorable. Though it may be priced a little higher than similar class hotels, I would certainly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a decent place to stay in the Eternal City.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE! Dirty, dusty, yucky, sketchy looking hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: oneluckyperson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is basically like a low end Motel 6. In fact, I would have rather stayed at a Motel 6 than this hotel. We were so excited to go to Rome and stay at a 4 star hotel, but our face dropped when we got off their shuttle. First of all, you gotta lug your luggage down steps covered with very dirty and old carpet. So if you have large luggage (thank goodness we didn't), it would be a pain. The lobby is so unimpressive and dirty looking. It doesn't look very sanitary nor appealing. Our room was shockingly unattractive. We couldn't even think of romance nor relaxation because it just felt so dirty and dusty!!! To top it off, it was really dark/dim making it feel so much more sketchy!!! The bed had one of those gross and old beige blanket that look like they are never washed (or washed once a year). The sheets were so rough and I even found a tiny spider crawling on our bed. The carpet were so nasty I didn't even dare to walk with barefeet! We had to force ourselves to sleep here because we had no idea what to do or where to go that night. The next day, we switched to Hotel Savoy. Not only was it cheaper than this hotel, it was 10 times better. Atlante Garden desperately needs a good scrubbing!!! I agree with the other reviewer here--people should be punished for false advertising! The hotel website made the rooms look luxurious, this is a BIG misrepresentation. They should have shown those ugly topper they have on their beds and the rusty handle in the tub! On a little brighter note--the one night staff was really nice and felt sorry for us. By the way, this hotel is close to the Vatican--but everything else is about a 7-10 Euro cab ride unless you want to walk 45 minutes or longer to the other side. Would I recommend this hotel to a friend? Only if I don't want them to ever speak to me again. You should NOT stay in this hotel unless you absolutely have to or if they only charge less than a hundred bucks a night. P.S. DO NOT BOTHER USING THE INTERNET--its SOOOOO FRUSTRATINGLY SLOW!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: sannie09
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights last week, we had a wonderful trip. The hotel is just around the corner from the Vatican, and was a 20-30 minute walk to most other attractions[Trevi Fountain, Spainish Steps, Piazza Navona]. The staff were very plesant and helpful. Breakfast, I thought it was only average. No toaster, not a great selection of cereals, coffee awful!! They don't provide an iron for rental at the reception desk like most hotels, this was a little inconvenient for us. Air conditioning in the bedroom was wonderful after a long hot day strolling around the city. The bar was always quiet, and on one of the nights it was closed. Some of the pictures of the hotel on this site are not of this hotel, but of their sister hotel, Atlante Star. The breakfast room in Atlante Garden did not overlook the Vatican City!!! Overall we enjoyed our stay, but for what we paid, I would have expected a little better.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied, friendly, clean, convienent”
Reviews.Author: gkroeger
Reviews.Content: My wife of 50 years and I traveled to Rome with our 15 year old grandson on June 1st, 2009. We stayed 4 nights at the Atlante Garden Hotel prior to our 10 cruise. We then returned to stay one more night at the Atlante Garden prior to flying back home to Florida. I sent many emails back and forth with Roberta and she was extremely helpful and definitely the reason we selected this hotel. We were extremely pleased with the hotel and staff. Our room was large enough for the three of us. The staff was very friendly and helpful. My grandson and I especially enjoyed the roof terrace where we could sit in the evenings and talk. We also appreciated the close proximity to the Vatican; we found it to be a short walk to St. Peter's square. There was also a subway terminal within walking distance of the hotel allowing easy access to downtown Rome and all the attractions there. We also liked the free pick up service at the airport. Most shuttles are extremely expensive in Rome so this perk is definitely worth considering when looking for a hotel. The complimentary breakfast every morning was also very good. All in all we considered ourselves very lucky to have found this Hotel and would highly recommend it to anyone considering a trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite service!”
Reviews.Author: Noemie_Mingneau
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Atlante Garden Hotel. It's perfectly situated just outside the city centre, only a block away from the Vatican itself. The building itself was beautiful. I very much liked the roof terras with the little garden. From there you had a view over the whole city and more specifically the 'Borgo de Sant'Angelo'. I am very satisfied about the service, rendered by Atlante Garden. They were always very friendly and their English was remarkable. The breakfast was very good too.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: toothcat
Reviews.Content: Since this was our first trip to Rome I have no frame of reference concerning the quality of the star ratings in Rome. But this is by no stretch of the imagination a 4 star hotel. The staff is pleasant enough but our room (235) was very dark with a slight aroma of mildew. The towels are ancient and the hotel provides the basic amenities, shampoo, a small bar of soap and some bath gel. Internet access is dial up. The breakfast is passable. There were at least 4 other couples staying there that are equally upset about their rooms and over all quality of this hotel. We all expected more since the description touted roof top views(maybe at the sister hotel the Atlante Star) but not here. Don't bother looking at the court yard since its a jumble of construction. Do yourself a favor and don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected but not bad...”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugg72
Reviews.Content: Although I read many reviews highlighting that a 4star in Europe is not what you find in North America I was disappointed upon my arrival due to the small room and lack of water preasure / hot water - HOWEVER - the hotel upgraded us to a deluxe room that was much larger with a far better bathroom upon my request without hesitation. The location is wonderful with almost all attractions in walking distance or a short subway / taxi ride and it was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Do not even check in”
Reviews.Author: Queeniehill
Reviews.Content: After being picked up an hour late and the driver (pretending to be a wanna be nascar driver) finally getting us to the hotel (or skid row building), our first indication that it might have been one of those "hook em and cook em" moments that you get - when you are lied to when looking at the web site - was a couple walking up the stairs to the street telling us "if you have not checked in yet - DON"T". Well after looking at the rooms before even checking in - That is my advice also - DON"T!! I wish there was some recourse for misleading web sites that lure people to hotel and then you are stuck. We loaded up 6 people into 2 cabs and found another hotel.Granted the location is not the same - but we are getting an honest nights stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: rmittenCt
Reviews.Content: Great location near Vatican, clean rooms and staff helpful. Provide free pickup from airport which good perk and breakfast very good to start day.

Reviews.Title: “A stones throw from the vatiacan.”
Reviews.Author: BellabedsUk
Reviews.Content: We had a quad room for 4 adults. plenty of room and large bathroom. Decor a bit dated and probably 2/3 * not 4*. spotlessly clean . staff exeptionally helpful. The complimentary break fast was good with a good selection for all tastes.We got a great deal through expedia can highly recommend. A stones throw from the vatican and walking distance to most sights if you are fit!!The number 81 bus takes you to most of the sights for 1 euro!!! amazing value .Don't miss the Trevi fountain. the coloseum or the pantheon. highly recommend the hotel but get a room at the back as a rather noisy road at the front.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Duboc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The shuttle from airport was nice and the staff is nice. That's about it. The room is small and extremely noisy. Breakfast was very very limited and served in the basement (where the reception is too). It is very close to the Vatican but I would definitely stay around Via Veneto or Navona where there are more restaurants and caffes. We struggled to find good restaurants and caffes around the Atlante.

Reviews.Title: “The service was great and the hotel was within walking distance to all sights.”
Reviews.Author: diversionoaktown
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. The staff was very knowledgable and spoke very good english. The complimentary breakfast was good, especially the coffee, as we did not have to eat until evening. Buy a bottle of wine and sit on the rooftop. If your shower leaks on the floor, just put the small bottle of shampoo to close the gap and you won't have any spills. I recommend you book your tours, transportation through the hotel rather than your agency. Bed was firm and floor was uneven, but after a day of touring, it felt good.

Reviews.Title: “good location, clean, helpful staff, dont get room at front as traffic is noisy, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: bskIrl
Reviews.Content: decent enough rooms, good location 5 min walk to vatican, twenty mins walk into centre of city. breakafst very basic, fruit wasnt fresh. dont get room at front, as its on a busy road, traffic noisy. we asked to be moved and got much quieter room. helpful staff. small bar but best to drink vino elsewhere. no restaurnt in this hotel. basic, comfortable & well located

Reviews.Title: “could not ask for better”
Reviews.Author: titus724
Reviews.Content: The staff was great, the room was very clean and cozy. the breakfast was great everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, helpful staff, spacious rooms, great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: m0m2g0
Reviews.Content: Location is not central, but is very close to the Vatican, and a 5 min. walk from the metro. You can easily get anywhere on the metro for 1 euro. The staff at this hotel was so friendly and helpful. The room was large and clean, and the breakfast was wonderful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable location but not a 4 star stay”
Reviews.Author: Mayoabu
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well placed, particularly for Vatican but most other sites are reachable for a determined walker - public transport is close by too. Hotel itself seeks to please with pleasant and helpful staff but has become a little dowdy. Traffic noise could be an issue for light sleepers and the lamentable "coffee" at an otherwise reasonable breakfast certainly is! A bed to return to rather than a hotel to savour.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely getaway”
Reviews.Author: KF74
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at Atlante Garden Hotel. The service was fantastic, staff were friendly and the hotel is located near the Vatican and public transport. The room was suitably decorated and met our requirements. We used the airport shuttle service which was fantastic as we were met in the arrival hall of the airport.. It put our minds at rest to know we had someone meeting us at the airport and we did not have to work out how the public transport worked until later in the day, while site seeing. The continental breakfast was well presented and provided a good selection. Overall it was a lovely hotel and the friendliness of the staff made us feel welcome. It was also nice to have staff who could speak English, because we could not speak Italian. I would recommend this hotel and if I ever return to Rome, I would be happy to stay at Atlante Garden Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful weekend”
Reviews.Author: HelenaK
Reviews.Content: We are just home from a beautiful weekend spent in Rome. The hotel location of the Atlante Garden Hotel was spot on for seeing the Vatican. It is definitely worth the 7 euros to enter and climb the 382 steps to the top of the dome of St Peter's Basilica. Take the lift for the first bit. Room in the hotel was clean, friendly staff, yes it was dark as others have said but that is the character of the building and as we were at the back not much noise mentioned by other reviewers. Our jacuzzi worked and definitely great after sightseeing all day. We did not experience queues anywhere! A big bonus was being picked up by the hotel bus at the airport. Breakfast at hotel - no fry ! - but plenty of choice of breads, fruit, cheese, cereal and all the coffee you could drink. We got the open top bus recommended by hotel - an all day ticket for 19 euros each meant we could get on and off at different stops all day. We managed to pack a lot into one day - the Colliseum, Circus Maxima, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Via Venita, Piazza Barberini, even shopping in the Via Condetti. Walked to the restaurant around the corner from the hotel on Saturday evening - no need to book. Friendly staff, lovely food and a short walk back to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: clinton13
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to the Vatican and within walking distance for all sites in Rome. Also close the Piazza Risorgimento a bus and tram terminus. The restaurant and bar were not open during our stay, but lots of restaurants close to the hotel although avoid the Taverna Varrone on Via Varronne. It is over priced and food is poor.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: LoriLondon
Reviews.Content: Atlante Garden Hotel was a great location. However being a four star hotel was quite surprised that their BAR was not open. The rooms were of good standard but the mini bar selection was poor. i.e. No wine or spirits, just beer and soft drinks. When we asked for an Iron we were informed that they didn't have one. Again not very good for a 4* hotel. Their sister hotel the Atlante Star had a fabulous roof top restaurant which was 5* but when we enquired whether their bar was open we were told no as well. The food and service at this restaurant was superb, good place to go for a special occasion, There were quite a few guests staying at the Hotel and I'm sure their takings would have increased at a nice profit had the bar facility been available during our week-end visit. If the facilities are in place they should be available to use all year round or at least advertise on their website that the BAR is NOT open in the evenings. All that said this did not stop us enjoying our trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantatsic Location”
Reviews.Author: Butterfly102
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked this trip as a christmas surpise. Hotel was in a perfect location for sightseeing with the Vatican and St Peters Basilica only 5/10 mins away. Number 81 bus to reach the collesiuim, however i wouldnt bother witha tour guide for tis sightseeing event. Thouroughly recommend a tour guide with the vatican, we got one in the street and found this excellent because of the historical information we were given.John the american tour guide was excellent. Cost us about 30.00euros each. Recommend having dinner at the sister hotel (Atlante star) where St Peters Basilica can be viewed lit up whilst eating very romantic but it is pretty pricey. Worked out about £60.00 for a small meal and a bottle of wine but well worth it. Staff at the hotel are extremely helpful credit to the hotel.......Pick up service from the airport was a plus point. Breakfast and bar service excleent and reasonably priced.Try and shop around for cheaper meals the ones on the high street are very pricey. All in all a excellent hotel in a fantastic location, would recommend and definately go again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed!!!!”
Reviews.Author: giftshopgirl80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for two nights- below is the overview of pluses and minuses. Good: location, breakfast, convenient transportation nearby, free airport transfer Bad: 1. Most sites rate this hotel as a 4 star. I don't know who is in charge of the rating system but even for European standards I would not give it more than 2 Stars. The rooms are tiny and I mean TINY. The decor is very outdated. What you see on the website is blown out so you think the room is a decent size. Yes, you do not expect the size of the room you would get in the US but good God- my husband could barely squeeze in there! 2. The jets in the tub did not work which was a minor problem on the overall scheme of things. 3. there was an open bottle of mineral water on our fridge when we got there 4. The hallways of the hotel look like public restrooms because of the decor- again- it is NOT by any standards a 4 star hotel. 5.
