The Front desk staff is not helpful- you have to be very persistent in your requests. 6. And the MAIN problem. We booked the hotel 6 (!) months in advance- 3 rooms to be exact. When we arrived at the Atlante Garden, they informed us that the previous group decided to extend their stay and they did not have any rooms available for us there but they would accomodate us at their sister hotel Atlante Star which is about a block away. Now, I try to be flexible and yet I do not comprehend how it is our problem that their guests did not leave on time- they should have been moved at the sister hotel since they official stay ended. So...back in the transfer van and on to the Star. The driver of the van was so pissed that he almost ran over my husband who was still in the process of getting in the van. To summarize this storyline, I would reccomend to find some place else to stay. Next time I will stay at a 5 star- it is not worth the hassle and the disappointment on your vacation. And there is another lesson learned- there is a reason you see bad ratings, people don't post them for fun; they tend to be very accurate 99% of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great situation, great staff”
Reviews.Author: vinnyjonnes
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel in december with my husband and my 9- months-old baby. The first good thing is the fact that a van is waiting for you at the airport, with a baby and all the baby stuff, it's very helpfull. Then, the situation of the hotel is great, just 2min from the vatican and a big bus station. You can reach almost every big interesting point in Rome from there. Rooms are not so big but confortable, and it's very quiet. And to finish the staff is very kind, and very helpful when you need some help. I want to particulary thanks Mami, for his kindness, when I forgot my cellphone in our room on our departure day , he/she sent it back to me in France, for free by regular post mail. I will certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: ricegnome
Reviews.Content: Our weeklong stay at the Atlante Gardens Hotel was great. The hotel is 10 minutes walking distance to Vatican City, and the staff all provided excellent service the entire time we were there, from the airport shuttle that will pick you up if you contact them in advance, to the checkout process. The concierges speak English well and were willing to call restaurants, museums, etc. and make reservations for us while we were there. The room itself was reasonably sized for two people, and well-decorated. One of the greatest amenities which you don't find in many of the hotels in Rome is the continental breakfast, which is included in the price of your stay. Lots of choices--I had a different pastry each day, and they were all good! But they also had cereal, yogurt, fruit, along with cheeses and sliced meats. Overall, I recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased indeed!”
Reviews.Author: cefiroman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Atlante Star for two nights. We were collected by the hotel transport fom DaVinci airport and brought directly to the hotel. This was a great benefit and started off the holiday really well. The staff were very warm and friendly and there was an easy atmosphere about. The breakfast buffet was very generous with a wide variety of fresh food available. We were very pleased with the hotel in all respects. It's also a very good location for touring the city, with the Vatican and Castel St. Angelo literally minutes away. The open-top tour buses stop for about 30 minutes at St. Peter's, so they are always available with a five minute walk from the hotel. Out of the hotel to the right is a large plaza with restaurants and shopping facilities and a large bus and train terminus. Altogether a great hotel in a great location. We would certainly have no problem in recommending this hotel. Liam.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed staying at the Atlante”
Reviews.Author: NewcastleSusan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location. Short walk to Vatican City. Good shopping nearby. Cafe across the street and nice cafe and restaurants around the corner. Very helpful staff. Good breakfast provided. The room was very clean and comfortable. The hotel has character. I would stay at this hotel again. After a tour north we returned to another hotel and it was more expensive but nowhere near as good as this hotel. As in many European cities i found the lift to be very small but not a problem. Overall a very enjoyable stay in a nice part of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Atlante Garden -- best value”
Reviews.Author: NNNM
Reviews.Content: For a four-star hotel, The Atlante Garden exceeded our expectations. It was a real convenience to have the complimentary transfer from the airport - the shuttle driver was both curteous and efficient. Checking in took less than a minute! Luggage was brought up to the room very promptly. Our room was surprisingly more spacious than what we saw on the website (high ceiling and spacious bathroom with bidet). It was hassle-free when we asked for an extra pillow. All the receptionists has been very helpful and informative - if it wasn't for the information given, we could've missed the audience with the Pope at 10:30am on Wednesday morning - that was a real surprise - my friends & families who have been here didn't experience the same luck to see the Pope! There was a good selection at the breakfast buffet - I loved the cold meat and cheese selection. We were presented with cute little bottles of olive oil gift produced by the hotel's own estate :-) We were in Rome for only 2days and 2 nights - there's definitely more to see and explore. The next time we plan for our holiday in Rome, we will consider staying at their sister hotel, Atlante Star, and try out their Les Etoiles (roof top garden) restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great position for the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: CanterburyUK-R-H
Reviews.Content: We were glad we took the free shuttle bus from Fiumicino Airport direct to the rather unobtrusive front door, as it is easy to walk right past the hotel! The first room we were shown was a bit small, but the Bellhop immediately offered a larger, much nicer one (also no-smoking) at no extra charge. Room and bathroom both very clean, with good shower and sufficient towels. Bed was large and comfortable, breakfast was OK (buffet but no hot foods). Hotel's best feature is that it is only 10 minutes walk from the Vatican Museums and Sistine Chapel (get their EARLY!) and St Peter's Basilica. Bus connections also nearby. Noisy main road outside, but closing the newly double-glazed windows reduced this to a whisper. There is a small lift to upper floors. Easy to find supper restaurants nearby within 300 yards. We made our own midday picnics from food we bought in a nearby mini-market and kept in the mini-bar refrigerator. Receptionists were always helpful. Shuttle bus back to airport is expensive at 48 Euros for 2 persons, but worth it compared with a 3-part trek by public transport or a pricey taxi fare. A good stay, helped by sunny November weather.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Atlante Garden Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mandersonx
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Atlante Gardens for 6 nights in September. The hotel is nicely located a couple of blocks from the Vatican in a fairly residential neighborhood which is perfect. There is excellent bus service, close to the metro, tour companies come to the hotel to pick you up and everything you would expect in a residential neighborhood is there - shops, restaurants, etc. If you walk out of the hotel, walk left and take a right at the first cross street, you will come to a delightful restaurant mid block. Blue awnings. Sponge painted inside blue walls. They make their own pasta and it melts in your mouth. Forget the place across from it - service there is terrible. If you walk to the right when you come out of the hotel, you will come to a piazza within a couple of blocks. You will see the Vatican walls. Shops, buses, and restaurants. The staff at the hotel are wonderful, friendly, and eager to please. I found that everyone on the desk spoke English. Lock your valuables in the safe deposit type boxes at the desk, there are no in room safes. The hotel is very clean, linens nice, warm blankets, good pillows, nice light for reading in bed, big window in my room opened. The small room with a big double bed had wonderfully high ceilings so it never seemed so small. Huge closet. Pretty striped wallpaper with matching draperies. Luggage rack. Desk. 2 straight chairs. TV on the desk - no CNN but other English channels. Bathroom very clean. Tile everywhere. Jacuzzi tub with hand held shower. Bidet. Lots of towels. The attractive carpet was sort of bumpy and there were some stains although it appeared clean. No fault to find with this room! Go to the fifth floor and walk out to the roof garden - wonderful! City views. Garden furniture. Flowers. There is a small elevator. On the ground floor there is a bar that is open for cocktails, a breakfast room, living room with a computer (charge) free Italian newspapers. The included breakfast is very complete and bountiful. Great coffee. Cold buffet foods, boiled eggs. Staff work very hard and keep everything supplied well. I was very happy in my home away from home in Rome. The hotel includes free airport pick up with your reservation - it is a shared van ride so you might have to wait a few minutes after you arrive. Don't panic. Excellent driver. Very welcome after a long flight. You can hire the service to return you to the airport if you like. If you like fine dining, by all means try the top floor restaurant at the sister hotel, the Atlante Star. The food is spectacular and you have views of the illuminated St Peter's Basilica while you dine. Walk out of the hotel, turn left, take the first cross street to the right for 2 blocks. The hotel is on the corner. Wonderful service. Great for a special occasion!

Reviews.Title: “clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: wizard55
Reviews.Content: Atlante Garden was extremely welcoming. The rooms were of a good size and very clean. The jacuzzi bath was a treat after a long day sight seeing. Noise from the road was quite loud! Next time I would ask for a room at the back! Lovely roof garden and excellent location for sight seeing. I would love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Second stay at a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DMBrowne
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at this hotel in February 2008. We were impressed by the friendliness of the staff, the cleanliness of the rooms, and the great location. When we a chance to return to Rome there was no doubt about where we wanted to stay. Traveling with small children was made easy! DM Browne NY

Reviews.Title: “2006 & 2008 excellent”
Reviews.Author: runSewickley
Reviews.Content: I chose your hotel for my second visit to Rome for the following reasons: Location, staff and how clean and comfortable your hotel is. We found the location to be the best for our iternary. The staff could not be more helpful. We have several relatives living in Rome. At times, we were in need of some help with translation. The hotel offers a very good breakfast served in a clean, attractive dining area. Last but very important to me, the hotel is kept very clean from the lobby to the guest rooms. I hope to stay at the hotel again in 2009 and would highly recommend it visitors staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “perfect ... spot in Rome”
Reviews.Author: summersbreeze
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at this very special Hotel. It is elegant, cozy. A short walk to Vatican City, with the beautiful roof top garden. We would highly reccomend to everyne. We were picked up free from the airport and loved the free breakfast every morning.... The staff could not be any nicer.....

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovations and a cleaning...”
Reviews.Author: tinamagill
Reviews.Content: Location is not great. There is nothing around but the Vatican. Cab fare is 7-12 euros away from everything. The room was badly in need of renovations. Very old and falling apart. Musty. There is no restaurant in this hotel as I was told. It is in the sister hotel, not convenient. The bar on the roof (which was supposed to be the selling point of this hotel) was closed! Bar indoors was not a fun place. I called the day before for an early check in. The reception said no problem, but when I arrived, my room was not ready. Staff was very helpful and nice. Safe place. Sandwich shp and bar down the street are open late night and are fun. I probably would not stay again due to location and conditions of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Musty, dusty smell in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: travel_beacon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location for the local tourist attractions like St. Peter's Basilica and the Vatican, however it was pretty hard to find. Just ask the local vendors and they can direct you how to get there. The room had a musty and dusty smell. For a 4 star hotel, I would expect a better quality room and cleaner room. The bed was hard and stiff - like sleeping on a board. The smell was so strong, and the bed so uncomfortable, I wouldn't stay there again. It was ok for one night. The breakfast buffet however, was great. Lots of choices with fruit, cheese, cereal, cakes, etc. Lots of good food to start your day.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it for the price”
Reviews.Author: corp4ever
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night at the end of a 2 week vacation in Italy. We got the room after bidding on Priceline. The front desk staff and porter were very friendly and helpful. The lobby is clean and has a nice little bar there. The location is great, near the Vatican and the castel. The #40 bus stops right around the corner, which is nice. The breakfast was very good and had great view. The room left a lot to be desired. The ceiling had a lot of mold on it. The bath towles were dirty, had stains on them. The room was musty and the walls seemed very thin, you could hear almost everything from the room next store. We paid under $200 for the night here, this places charges on average over $300 per night, for that price it is a ripoff.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: ringside
Reviews.Content: Good location to see most attractions in the area, we walked everywhere. noisey and busy location but that should be expected. Rooms were clean but ours was small and dark. Staff were polite but not overly friendly. Plenty of good restaurants in the area. A long weekend was enough for us.

Reviews.Title: “cant wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Tetburytorome
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Staff, Location,Food! Many thanks cant wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Near most attractions”
Reviews.Author: SusanCardiff
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel it was two blocks away from the Vatican. It had a lovely roof garden to sit in the evenings. The problems I mentioned were to do with the fittings in the bathroom but they were soon put right. The staff were friendly and industrious. Lovely breakfast, in all a good short break in nice surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TriggerMLR
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is ideally situated, near the Castle and Vatican, the room we had was excellent (Family of 4) had the most character of any room decor in any Hotel I've stayed in, and that is saying something. The ceiling must have been 18ft high. The reception and porter staff were excellent. The bar staff (one) was so friendly. Pity the breakfast lady let the show down a bit when we arrived a bit late on first morning, a bit over the top, and we all felt a bit like naughty children. Not the Ritz but very good value, and after blowing the budget on a cruise, was a really nice soft landing, and have no hesitation in reccomending same. Will go back for sure. Also V. Good restaurants within 3 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: GooseM
Reviews.Content: The Atlante Garden is a great hotel about 5 minutes walk from St Peter's Square. The hotel itself is pretty unassuming from the road, you won't be amazed by the reception and bar areas either but none of that really matters. What this hotel provides you with are clean, modern, comfortable rooms, great service, great value and a great base to explore Rome. The staff (housekeeping in particular) were incredibly helpful and clearly took pride in their work. After a long day exploring the delights of Rome, this is a wonderful hotel to come back to and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nollymac
Reviews.Content: The Atlante Garden is a great hotel to stay at, as long as you are not expecting lavish luxury. The rooms are clean and functional, ok there are one or two bits that could be better but for the money I spent I was more than happy. The staff were friendly and helpful, the one problem I had( air con not working on my first night) was rectified the next day, otherwise the room was fine. The hotel is an old building which has obviously had some recent refubishment but not a great deal of it, it looks a little dated and tired but is comfortable and clean. I was in room 139 on the first floor and although traffic noise could be heard all night you soon get used to it, after all this is Rome its to be expected. The hotels location is fantastic, its very close to the Vatican museums and Saint Peters, about a 10 minute walk. Its a great place for the metro station and bus service too which makes it so easy to get to the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and the Colosseum. But if walking to the sights is your thing than the aid of a good street map and some comfortable shoes are a must. The Atlante Garden serves a continental style breakfast which quite adequate with a choice of pastries and breads, fruit, cereal, eggs, fruit juice and tea/coffee. As for lunch there are plenty of cafes all over Rome so you wont go hungry, but be warned if the prices are not displayed you may get a shock when the bill comes, so ask about the cost of everything before you order, I learned this the hard way after being in the Vatican Museum, across the road is the Vatican Cafe( its not connected in any way to the Vatican), this place has got to be the most expensive cafe in all of Europe let alone Rome, and the food is not great. If you find yourself around the area of the Hotel and looking for a place to eat then take a stroll down Via Cola di Rienzo, a bustling street full of shops, here you will find designer boutiques and supermarkets, as well as the odd market stall. Via Cola di Rienzo is a wonderful place to watch Romans living their lives, take your time to look down the side streets too and you will find plenty of pizzerias and restaurants, and choosing wisely will ensure you get good food at reasonable prices. Always look for the places that the local people eat in, if it’s good enough for Romans it’s definitely good enough for everyone else. But if you want a tip on a fantastic place to eat than turn onto Via Orazio and then onto Via Plinio where you will find Raf (www.rafristopizza.com). This is a great place to eat, the menu is very good with a fine selection of food, the price are displayed on the menu and if you are unsure what something is you can ask the extremely friendly staff, who made us feel very welcome. After dinner take a walk along Via Crescenzio to the Piazza Risorgimento and stroll down the side streets to Saint Peters to see it all lit up, be warned the police close the square at 11pm so get there in plenty of time to take some photographs. I enjoyed my visit to Rome and my stay at The Atlante Garden, and would recommend the hotel to everyone, just be careful about what you believe on the website, read it carefully as the photos and services mentioned on the sites(yes theres more than one) can be very misleading, most refer to the sister hotel, the Atlante Star, which is a more expensive place. Would I stay there again ? Yes, in fact I am already planning to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: lapdcop
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon from August 5th until August 8th. We very much enjoyed our stay here. The front dest was very helpful with whatever questions we had. The room was a bit dark and the bed wasn't the most comfortable but in general we had a great stay. The hotel is in a nice location. There is a metro stop only a couple minutes away. The Vatican is only a couple minutes walk from the hotel as well. The breakfast was very good however the elevator was quite small. All in all we really had a great time in Rome and it was nice to have a great place to stay while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to the helpful reception man!”
Reviews.Author: sdfFin
Reviews.Content: It was excellent to have a transfer service from the airport to the hotel, thanks for it! The hotel staff was polite and air condition worked well. The only fact that did not satisfied was the condition of the hotel. We tought it was definitely not a four star hotel in a scandinavian way of thinking. The one thing I missed most was scandinavian style of modern and soft duvets with letter sheets! We haven´t used to sleep with hard wooly duvets here in Finland.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awful!”
Reviews.Author: JohnNortheast
Reviews.Content: felt scammed-website showed photo's of sister hotel with rooftop gardens and restaurant-if you see this on the site for Atlante Gardens rest assured you will not find it here. The rooftop restaurant that they claim to have, and which they make every effort to showcase as part of their hotel is not even on that building. advertised jacuzzi's are in a bath with fixtures missing so you can't work them. The room didn't smell too fresh. staff at the front desk was not very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday”
Reviews.Author: fcarmich
Reviews.Content: We had 4 nights at the Atlante Garden and were very pleased with it. On arriving on the Friday we were disappointed because the air conditioning was not working in our room, we had been left two fans though. We informed reception who told us it would be fixed next day and true to their word it was. We loved the Hotel and spent time on the Terrace and in the bar. We ended each night in the bar and even though there was only two of us in there the barman (Jacomo) made us very welcome and couldnt do enough for us. The breakfast was also nice although being a Brit not too keen on the continental style breakfasts. I think more facilities during the day would help eg snacks, drinks etc It is a lovely Hotel clean and decorated nicely. Some improvements could be made eg power sockets but all in all we had a great stay and if we go to Rome again we would definately stay there again. It was so close to the Vatican and in easy walking distance to many places, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel for sight-seeing in Rome”
Reviews.Author: cgsScotland
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and had a friendly staff. The room was a little small, although balcony was a nice addition. Air-conditioning was sub-standard which was less than ideal during the hot month of July. The breakfasts were good and the evening bar staff were very helpful and friendly. Overall our stay in the hotel was good.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jadestarxxxx
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel and friendly staff. made us feel welcome. room was nice a little small but clean, door was really hrd to get in to the knob didnt work properly and jacuzzi in the bath didnt seem to appealing had lots of scratches inside, other than that room was always kept clean and breakfast was very nice quite a large selection. nice peaceful hotel we were on the third floor wasnt a great view but could have been worse! nearby to everything really we mostly walked to all the sights and a few nice places to eat nearby too. x

Reviews.Title: “Made our stay in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: KittyEastSussex
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Rome and we wanted a hotel that was close to the tourist sites but not too noisy. The Atlante Star was in a perfect position for us, just a nice walking distance to the old part of Rome, close to Vatican City and Castel Sant Angelo, plenty of lovely eating places around that served beautiful food and not too expensive. All the staff in the hotel were very pleasant, helpful and polite, the room and bathroom were clean and nicely decorated. A few days before flying out I emailed the hotel to ask about transport from the airport and they arranged for us to be picked up at no charge, this was real customcare. During our stay some re-furbishing was going on on our floor but we were given an apology and asked if we wished to move to another floor, the hotel staff could not have done more. Whilst we were impressed with the room and service, it was the roof top restaurant that made this hotel stand out for us. The breakfast buffet catered for everyones taste and was very enjoyable but sitting eating your food looking out over St Peter's Basilica and the roof tops of Rome was amazing. Our memories of Rome are special and part of this is due to this hotel, I would recommend it without reserve and will go back to it if /when we visit Rome again

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Friendly & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Sherpa836
Reviews.Content: The free hotel coach from the aiport was great (Taxis were 50 Euros) We stayed in Room 240. Roomy, very comfortable, smart bathroom with a jacuzzi, Sadly no safe or tea/coffee making facilities in the room. The hotel was full, but remained quiet. It is situated one street back from the main shopping thoroughfare and within 5 minutes walk of St Peters Square. Only a breakfast room, but there are a great number of reasonably priced restaurants and cafes within 200/300 metres. A great open air cafe/sandwich bar on the other side of the street from the hotel entrance. There are two small, but comfortable guest lounges, one with internet access and onre with a bar (expensive) Note: Hotel guests have to pay for their return journey to the airport in the hotel coach at 23 Euros per person. We will certainly use the hotel again. A great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: mclapp86
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely awful! After booking through a travel agent in the US, we were very excited especially after seeing the website and what appeared to be a very nice four star hotel. We were very upset at the entire stay that we had at this hotel. Sadly, upon arriving, we walked into a full-on renovation taking place in the entrance lobby. There was dust and paint everywhere and the staff made no effort to help us through the debris and mess. We finally got into our room which was less than expected to say the least. The bathroom was very poorly constructed and the amenities were not satisfactory for a three star hotel much less the four star that it claimed to be. The pullout that they put in our room to make a three person accommodation for us looked shabby and at least 20 years old. The staff at the front desk was not friendly by any stretch of the imagination and make no effort to accommodate any special requests we made. Their supposed "free transport from the airport" is exactly that - FROM the airport only. If you would like a ride back to the airport, its going to cost you a whopping 48 Euros for each person!!!! This seems completely impractical considering they must drive there to pick people up anyways. The internet that they provide (at a very expensive price) was absolutely awful. Pages would load only once in a while and only after minutes of waiting. (This was not a problem with my computer.) The room was very poorly lit, which seems minor, but made the stay even less comfortable. The rooftop restaurant that they claim to have, and which they make every effort to showcase as part of their hotel is not even on that building. Its a couple of blocks away at another building of theirs, BEWARE if you are interested in eating there. This hotel barely met the standards of a two star that I had visited and certainly was not as nice as a three star we also stayed at in Rome. Overall, the stay was awful and we hope you heed these words before considering staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Italy_traveler2008
Reviews.Content: My mother and I were very excited about our trip to visit Italy. This was the first trip overseas that either of us had taken. After viewing the website for the Atlante Garden Hotel we were very excited and couldn't wait to check in. They did provide shuttle service from the airport which was very helpful but when we got to the hotel there had been a mix up and we didn't get the room that we had booked. They ended up putting us in two separate rooms, one on the 4th floor and the other on the 2nd and tried to tell us what a great deal that was for us because we got two rooms for the price of one. So our first night in Rome we ended up staying in separate rooms and the room I had was tiny. I actually fell out of the bed that night. There is no picture on their website of a room as small as the one I had. They did manage to switch rooms for us the next day but that room did NOT look anything like the ones you see on the website either. The location of the hotel was good, they did have free breakfast and it was pretty good but the staff at the front desk was not very helpful. For the money I think you could find a much better hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Well placed hotel”
Reviews.Author: Saintsfc2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four days at the end of April. We organized transport from the Airport through the Hotel which worked well. On arrival we were pleasantly greated and directed to our room which was adequate in size and very clean. The standards of staff & cleanliness were maintained throughout our stay. The breakfasts were self service and more than adequate. There was about a ten minute walk to St Peters & the Vatican Museums

Reviews.Title: “Had to move hotels”
Reviews.Author: Mojojo99
Reviews.Content: As soon as we got here we felt scammed-website showed photo's of sister hotel with rooftop gardens and restaurant-if you see this on the site for Atlante Gardens rest assured you will not find it here. Rooms are very small, advertised jacuzzi's are in a bath with fixtures missing so you can't work them. One one site there were FAQ's, one of which asked if there was much street noise. The site advised "no" as the rooms were treble glazed and soundproofed. Neither of this can be true, the window had 2 layers of wooden shutters which definately did not keep out the continous loud noise. We could also hear people coming up the stairs even though we were at the bottom of the hall. The decor was very cluastrophobic!!!!! The room didn't smell too fresh. In the end we moved to the sister hotel that we had thought we booked in the 1st place-we were charged €80 for this!!!

Reviews.Title: “Atlanti Gardens - amazing”
Reviews.Author: michalae
Reviews.Content: Dont believe the negative reviews the hotel is wonderful we went with my Mum and step dad and we all had an amazing time. the staff are so friendly and the hotel is a wonderful place to stay. The decor reflects the artistic and romatic history of Italy. The rooms are very generous - My mums room even had a balcony. The bathrooms are nice and clean. Our group coverd most ages and we had no complaints at all and all had a wonderful time in Rome. If you are looking for a lovely holiday and want to be in luxary and breath in Italian history this is the hotel for you. Michalae London

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: Spicey12
Reviews.Content: Having found this hotel on line we checked Tripadvisor for reviews. In fairness they were accurate. This hotel is very clean and the staff very polite and helpful. Our room came with a jacuzi bath, which is great if your under 5' tall. The room was a little on the small side but functional despite being dark due to walls coverings. If you looked hard you could take issue with tile grouting and the occational thread bare carpet. The hotel does not have a restaurant, thats at the sister hotel around the corner. The breakfast was simple but plentiful. What gives this hotel appeal is its location, even though being on a main road the traffic noise was not that bad. The Vatican is literally on your doorstep and the other main sites are a comfortable walk away (wear walking shoes - a must!). At best this is a 3 Star hotel offering reasonable quality at affordable prices. Rome is an amazing place the only down side is the cost of eating out, rubbish in roads and sadly the endless grafihetti on most buildings.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Fam4travels
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on the trip advisor website and liked that it was a 4 star hotel, which it probably is not. I think the hotel is also sold on the laurels of its sister hotel, the Atlante Star. Location wise, it was great - very close to the Vatican and a train station. The room was dark and loud, but definitely tolerable. We are a family of four, with two 9 year olds that were going to sleep on twin beds. The king size bed, however, had absolutely no support (too soft) which left one adult on the twin during the three night stay. The shower head is a hand held sprayer and was quite cumbersome. The best thing about the hotel was the transfer from the airport. We were met promptly and this saved quite a lot of worry.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad - not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Calimanesti
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to Rome and the Atlante Garden. It does not deserve a 4 star rating in my opinion. That does not mean it is not nice - just that it is not 4 stars. We had two different rooms during our stay due to a flight cancellation that required us to stay two extra nights. The hotel accommodated us but of course it was not the Priceline price. At 100 Euros a night for the two extra nights it was still probably less than the regular price but I would not want to pay that for a longer stay and didn't pay nearly that much with Priceline for our first 6 nights. The first room (#240) was roomy and nicely decorated but a ridiculously small TV, irregular hot water, and low toilet pressure. The second room was larger with an extra bed and a sleeper couch with severely out-of-shape cushions but it had a nicer TV. The second room (#336) looked older and worn out with cracked sink and tile in the bathroom, in need of a general renovation. And the walls are thin so bring your earplugs. We noticed in more in the second room and could hear conversations next door and had to bang on the wall one night because there was so much noise. Some of the couches and chairs in the hallways and in our first room are covered with sheets probably because they're worn out. The windows have inside shutters that help some with outside noise but don't expect quiet. Our earplugs helped. The buffet breakfast is good and once you learn the bus system you can get to old Rome easily. You are about 3 blocks from St Peter's Basilica and the Vatican Museum. Old Rome (Forum, Coliseum) are on the other side of the river. You are a 10 minute walk from the Ottaviano metro stop. All-in-all it's not a bad hotel if you get a decent price. But it's not near any 4 star hotels I've been to.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good service”
Reviews.Author: Debs2008
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just come back from three nights at Atlante Garden hotel in Rome. It's a nice hotel, very near the Vatican. The room we had was spotlessly clean and nicely furnished with a lovely roof terrace. The bathroom was mostly marble and the jacuzzi bath worked. The staff were friendly and helpful and the continental breakfast (which was included in the price) was perfectly adequate. The only thing that stopped this hotel being great was that the communial areas - the reception, lift and corridors - are a bit small and shabby. From the street, you have to go down a flight of stairs to get to reception and taxi drivers sometimes confuse it with its sister hotel Atlante Star, round the corner. Not sure, but got the impression the Atlante Star was slightly more up market. Overall, I would recommend this hotel, although personally, if I was going again, I'd probably try to stay the other side of the river, nearer the Spanish steps. If you do stay at Altante Gardens my top tips would be: 1) Arrange by email for the courtesy bus to collect you from the airport - it's a great service and they only charge for the return journey. 2) Take some trainers (sneakers) - the best way to see Rome is on foot and even flat shoes are no match for those cobbles! 3) If you're looking for restuarants near the hotel head south for the back streets between via crescenzio and via delia conciliazione - don't do as we did and head straight to via crescenzio, which is a great shopping street but has no restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Very fine hotel showing its age”
Reviews.Author: Kartvelebi
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on this hotel through Priceline and was pleasantly surprised with the overall quality of this old grande dame hotel. This hotel was comfortable to stay at, well located and reasonably clean. You know how some great old hotels show their age very badly and are nowhere close to supporting their claims to five stars? Well this isn't one of them...not in January 2008. But it will be soon. Yes the room and bathroom were generally clean. But not anywhere close to clean enough to use the 30 year old jacuzzi bathtub. The furnishings were plush. The bed was one of the most comfortable and the Satellite TV had the best English offerings of any hotel we visited in Italy. The breakfast was among the very worst of any we experienced in Italy. This is one of the things about this hotel that makes it more of a three star hotel vs. their inconsistently claimed five stars. (Do you ever notice how the ash trays and towels say five stars and the literature say three or four stars?) Breakfast was so very bad that we skipped it after the first two mornings. Service was spotty. This is one of those older, larger hotels where the staff has so much to do that they're on autopilot...never really connecting to you as anything more than a commodity. The TV remote didn't work and the guy they sent was puzzled and it went unresolved throughout our stay. The hotel wasn't very helpful in finding us restaurants, except for suggesting their own very expensive restaurant. Based on our overall experience as well as their breakfast, I wasn't about to risk 200+ euros on their restaurant. I'd suggest you don't either. Don't be afraid of this hotel's Vatican location. You might think it's not convenient for the ancient sites on the other side of the river, but it is only a five minute walk to the Metro and you can see all of Rome easily from this hotel. I'd stay here again. We were comfortable here. But I'd rather try something different. This hotel was a great value but, I'd rather pay a little more and get a little more, too (which is not too difficult to do in January in Rome). This hotel is a cash cow and the management stopped trying a long time ago. They're all on autopilot and as a guest, you feel it.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Vatican City”
Reviews.Author: Londinium
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to Vatican City (5 minutes walk) so it is really convenient. The closest metro station is Ottaviano on line A. (this metro line is clean but line B is really dirty!) The hotel offers free pickup at the airport but be sure that they know in which terminal you are landing. We waited 45 minutes for the driver at Terminal B, we had given our flight details on beforehand, we called the hotel twice to ask where the driver was and in the end he arrived from Terminal C where he had been waiting for us. Driving time to the hotel is 25 minutes. If you want the hotel to drive you back to the airport, it costs 45 euro for 2 persons while the Leonardo Express train from Termini station to the airport is 11 euro per person and it takes exactly 30 minutes. The hotel room (346) was quite big but a bit dark. The bathroom was also big but the jacuzzi announced on the hotel website is in fact a bath transformed into a jacuzzi but it did not work at all, 1 button was missing and 2 where broken. It was the same in other rooms. The only problem of the hotel is that it is located on a very busy street so it is really noisy at night. Also, they have only single-glass windows so it is also cold at night. The breakfast room is small (12 tables) with a small breakfast buffet: salami, cheese, mortadella, bread, cornflakes, cakes, and that's it. Coffee is cold, so either drink it fast or have a coffee somewhere else than in the other. Also, there is no tea/coffee facility in the room but there is a fridge (not electronic so you can put your own stuff in it) with 2 glasses. There is a supermarket close to the hotel: when leaving the hotel, turn in the first street at your left and at the end, you'll come in a street full of shops: cross the road and turn right until you see "COIN". This shop has a supermarket located in its basement. Take a bag with you otherwise you will have to pay for their bag. The hotel as 1 PC connected to the Internet. We paid 5 euros for 55 minutes. Connexion is good, the only thing missing is a printer. We wanted to check-in for our flight and asked the reception if they could print our boarding passes but it was not possible. They also have wireless but, as mentioned in other reviews, it is not well functioning and we heard clients complaining that they had paid and were not able to surf. The hotel is safe, the staff is polite but it is more a 3-star hotel, not a 4-star.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in rome”
Reviews.Author: mbblb
Reviews.Content: We atayed at this hotel twice in october and november, 2007. this is a very nice hotel, very close to the vatican and within walking distance of the major roman attractions. the concierges where extremely helpful and could resolve all of our many questions. it was very nice to have the airport delivery and pick up service. the rooms we had were both very nice and clean. the bathrooms were very nice and clean and had nice amenities. the maid on our floor and all of the help staff were extremely friendly and helpful. it was a pleasure to return to our rooms after a busy day to relax. i would strongly reccommend this hotel for visitors to roma.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: bellanne
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews for this hotel on this site I was feeling a bit anxious about the quality of this hotel. First impressions from the exterior made me feel like previous reviews may have been correct but upon entering the hotel I was pleasantly surprised. The staff at the front desk were informative and helpful and the hotel itself was very beautiful. The room too was great, enough space, massive bed (so big we felt miles apart at night), Jacuzzi tub that did infact work and it was fantastic (the trick is to press the button gently twice - this fathomed me where as my boyfriend figured it immediately), it was very clean, loved the decor because it was different. Have to admit that we did get a bit of traffic noise but its impossible not to in Rome because the crazy Italian drivers never stop using their horns!! But there is so much to do during the day that by the time you've had a meal and some wine you'll be asleep at the table. Breakfast was continental. I found it fairly decent. Fruit, cereal, breads, meats and cheese. Coffee, tea, cake, croissants. My only advice is ask for a coffee from one of the servers rather than helping yourself as it was often cold. The hotel is in a great location, the only place we got transport to was the Colleseum and that was only because we were feeling particularly lazy that day, otherwise we walked everywhere else which is one of my big tips because we found many little bars and eateries down the backstreets where the food was better quality than the more commercial areas. Providing you have a map you'll always get to where you want to go. Just be aware that when you think you're walking in a straight line you're often not and can end up back where you started. The hotel sorted our transport to the airport and we arrived in plenty of time. Although we found it fairly easy to make our own way to the hotel on arrival using train and metro we just felt tired after our boozy night out so opted for the Mercedes and driver. My stay was Amazing and i would have no hesitations about going back.

Reviews.Title: “OK But Watch Out - May Charge You Twice”
Reviews.Author: dbeaty
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 Nights at The Atlante Garden. This Hotel is near the Vatican and about a 10 minute walk to St Petes. Located in a nice district and within walking distance of lots of things to do. The Hotel is not 4 stars. I'd say a low 3 star. Travelocity lists 4 stars. Of course that's all subjective. It's a good value with the Dollar vs Euro. Small rooms with twin beds jammed together single thin mattress on springs. No windows, just wooden shutters. So no views. It is clean. Can hear through the walls if you have noisy neighbors. But lot's of little broken things like the front panel on the TV was missing. At the door there was an electrical breaker panel with no plastic cover. In the dark I stuck my fingers in there once looking for the main light switch. The towel warmer in the bathroom did not work. No clock. No message waiting light on the phone. Ect. Lots of little things like that. I is clean otherwise. The breakfast is average. The coffee is instant!!!!! In Italy can you imagine that. From Urns. I learned to ask the staff to go get me an expresso from the back of the kitchen. Most of the the front desk staff speak a little english but don't understand complex english questions...or in my case it's just acting like they don't understand. At check out the problems started. 6:30AM with taxis waiting to take us to the Airport! We booked a group of rooms on travelocity. Paid in full. 6 total. On check out, I am told the amount due...the full cost!!!!! 600 Euros for one room 4 nights! explain that my employer has paid for all the rooms in advance, he is coming down in a few minutes. The clerk looks perplexed. I explain I am paying only for incidentals - Phone Calls. Finally, he tells my the phone calls are 12 euros - I tell him yes, this is correct 12 Euros. So I hand him my CC. He proceeds to Charge 600 Euros on my check card!!!!. I look at the reciept and say "No this is not correct." "Canel This Charge or Credit back this charge". He says "This is impossible. I can not do this. Once it goes, it is done, you must contact bank". So I dispute this and argue with him for 10 minutes until my employer comes down. My boss proceeds to open his laptop and show them the reciept from travelocity. They look at it and say "This means nothing". It's a Stale Mate. The bell boy gets involved. Finally he says to me, "OK I cancel" and hands me another reciept. It looks to me like a copy of the original. I get another copy of the itemized bill that shows 12 E for the phone calls and we leave. I have to catch the plane. This is ridiculous. I am now waiting to see this 600 charge on my Checking Account that I will have to dispute. At least I didn't sign anything. Lesson learned. Double check that the room is showing prepaid when you check in. Or you may have a big problem when you leave. According to the desk, they cannot correct a mistake made by them with your credit card! Dave

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel experience at Atlante Garden”
Reviews.Author: ariadne52
Reviews.Content: Atlante Garden Hotel, Rome, Italy Oct.27th to Oct.31st 2007 This was the perfect hotel for our stay in Rome. It is within walking distance of St.Peter's Square, the Vatican and great restaurants. Our room was spacious and very clean. The staff was very helpful with all our questions and the restaurant suggestions were great. This was a once in a lifetime trip for our 80yr. old parents and their experience in the hotel and surrounding area was special thanks to the comfortable stay in the hotel. Travelers from New Jersey

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as other reviews make out.”
Reviews.Author: KAM_Poole
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights, having booked it as a "top secret hotel" on lastminute.com. We were slightly concerned about the reviews, especially some negative ones regarding our booking method, so I emailed the hotel in advance to confirm our booking. I got a prompt and polite reply. We availed ourselves of the free airport pickup from Furmicino Airport - this consisted of a mini bus. The driver was waiting as we walked through arrivals and we got to the hotel in 40minutes, far easier than public transport. We checked in on arrival (11.30ish) and our room was already available which was nice as it allowed us to leave our baggage and freshen up before going sight-seeing. The room was their "junior suite" made up with four beds (not necessary as there were only two of us, but the room was large and would have seemed even more so if they had been removed). The room was oak-panelled and so very dark - some additional lighting would have been nice. There were two heaters which were necessary as the room got little sun light. The room was not street facing, but the traffic (as seems to be the case everywhere in Rome and to no fault of the hotel) was still fairly loud. We had the jacuzzi bath, which worked, and was lovely after a day pounding the streets of Rome. The breakfast was fine, the hot drinks could have been hotter but the selection of food was fine. We booked the airport transfer back to Fumicino which cost 45euros for the two of us. We were picked up at the arranged time and got to the airport in plenty of time. Although it may have been cheaper to book a taxi, since we got a free pick up we thought it was reasonable. Our only warning would be location. The hotel was within minutes walk of the Vatican however it was at least fifteen minutes walk (at a good pace) to the Piazza Navona. Its position is self-evident from the map so we knew there would be some walking involved, however I think that on any return trip to Rome we would consider staying the other side of the river. We would also agree that it was probably not a 4* hotel, maybe a 3* however this may be a difference in standards over the continent.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: newageuk
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the Atlante Garden hotel which is just round the corner from the Vatican. We had a great stay Rome was lovely, the hotel staff were very helpful, the hotel it self wasn't bad rooms cleaned every day could do with a bit updating but we loved it we would recommend it and do plan to go back take some comfy shoes as we did lots and lots of walking but the sites are worth it better than on and off buses all i would say is go you will love it. Deb & Dave from Hemel Hempstead in the uk

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful friendly Atlante Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jems1999
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Atlante Star Hotel in Rome, Italy while visiting our daughter who was doing a Fall semester study abroad in Rome. I chose this hotel because of reading reviews that it was quiet and the staff helpful. It is on a busy, noisey street but with the window shutters the noise can be kept down fairly well. It has thicker walls than most Rome buildings and you do not hear other guests. The desk staff speak English and gave us help with directions and tours and called us a taxi to return to the airport. They have a delicious well stocked continental breakfast included each morning. They offer a free pick up at the airport on arrival. Our driver was waiting after we got our luggage. This was a big help after a long plane flight. They respond with instructions if you fax your flight information to them in advance. The rooms include a jaccuzi bath tub which felt wonderful after walking all day in Rome. The location is great for seeing Vatican City and shopping and eating. It is not to far from the Metro station where you can reach all Rome site seeing locations. This hotel made our stay hassle free. There was only one outlet we could see and you do need a converter to use the electricity.

Reviews.Title: “This is the last place you should stay!”
Reviews.Author: kcpf1121
Reviews.Content: Part of my booking of this hotel provided for transportation to and from the airport. When we arrived at FCO I contacted the hotel in order to locate the shuttle. The person at the desk stated to take a taxi and the hotel would provide the return shuttle for free. SO I took the taxi in order to iron out the issue in person. After a lengthy conversation the hotel covered the cost of the taxi. When going to the room we found the door to be hardly functioning since someone had tried to break into the room. Once finally inside the room we found it to be dirty, have holes in the wall and part of the headboard was being held up by the nightstand. Forget about taking a shower since the stall was molded and there was absolutely no water pressure to the shower head. I attempted to obtain another room and was treated very rudely. In fact I had to go to the Atlante Star in order to cancel my booking so that I could stay at a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything Expected and More”
Reviews.Author: paupao
Reviews.Content: I only had less than 2 weeks prior to our vacation to book our flight and hotel to Rome. Due to this, most of the cheaper flights and hotels were already fully booked. For our accommodations, it was definite that we wanted to stay within the Vatican area, as close as possible to the St. Peter's Basilica and the Vatican Museum. When I did my search, only a few choices were left. Desperate, I chose the least expensive among the available hotels nearest to our desired location. This was Atlanate Garden Hotel and I immediately booked it without looking into the reviews of this hotel. After I had already booked the hotel, I started reading some reviews of the hotel and started getting worried. Apparently, there are some very good reviews and not so good ones too. When we got to Rome, I started getting anxious and was anticipating the unwanted glitches from the hotel. But the glitches never came. The driver of our free aiport pick-up service was already waiting for us when we reached the designated meeting point at the airport. We arrived at about 10:30 am at the hotel. Although the booking stated that check-in time was 2 pm, I asked anyway if we could check-in early. The reception staff immediately tried to find available rooms for us without hesitation. Fortunately, they found rooms for us and we can immediately check-in. There rooms were good with spacious bathrooms. On our first night we wanted to have dinner at the roof restaurant of their sister hotel, unfortunately it was already fully booked. But they were very helpful in recommending other nearby places to eat. The next night we had a chance to eat with a great nightime view of the basilica at their roof restaurant. Booking a transport service back to the airport with them was also hassle-free. Our service arrived on the dot so we had sufficient time at the airport. At the airport, we realized that I had left the charger of our video camera in our hotel room. When we got back home, I immediately sent them an e-mail regarding the charger situation and within minutes they responsed that they had indeed found a charger in our room and that they will be glad to send it back to me by post. Now that's great after sales service! I will definitely consider staying there again when we go back to Rome. Thanks Atlante Garden for a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly but not covenient for anything other than Vatican”
Reviews.Author: veneziavol
Reviews.Content: I guess we had high expectations. Hotel is very very close to the Vatican and Castle sant'angelo but that is only part of your trip to Rome. The rest is a far walk. The Metro is about 2 blocks but it stops at 9pm. We ended up walking to the metro and taking it into town and always walking back except once at the spanish steps we took a taxi.. 10 euros.. yikes! The lock mechanism on the door is totally baffling so I wasn't always sure whether the door was locked or not. Also no safe provided in room. In the middle of showering our shower head hose popped off and started flinging around in the tub (that was hilarious). On the other hand the shuttle from the airport was a HUGE plus. Make sure you get your baggage and leave the baggage area as the "meeting point" is just after your cross customs. The room was always cleaned and well kept and the concierge was very very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Does not honor the 4 Stars category”
Reviews.Author: Gofioamasado
Reviews.Content: The mean reason that made my choice of this hotel was that rooms had Internet access, yes, but paying fot it, not adviced on the web page. Also, the web page showed 4 stars, and in my opinion to hold this category need more that a very friendly reception and breakfast staff (the best of this hotel). Our welcome gift was to find that the shuttle bus staff showed a not very clean look, and driver were talking at the mobile phone while driving (october 5th, 14:30h). Some opened rubbish big bags in the corridor just in front of my door room (441, from October 5th to 8th) invited me to get into the room at once. Room was correct, but just a few issues: Toillette fan was too noisy, TV volume too loud, impossible to get it lower altough I asked it to be fixed three times and no change was done. At breakfast, nothing was as I expected, awful orange juice, poor food assortment, bad bread quality, coffee just imposible to drink. I have had better breakfasts in 2 stars hotels. In my opinion, the service does not honor the price and hotel category by far.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly and Polite Staff”
Reviews.Author: coperWashington
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Atlante Garden Hotel Rome. Overall it was a great experience. The room they gave us was spacious and family friendly.The wall decor is good,I just feel the floor carpet needs upgrading.I had problems working the telephone as there was no instructions and I dialed 0(zero) several times to reach the front desk without success,also the remote control for the TV was not working. The staff was very friendly,polite and eager to assist.This is particularly helpful for someone new to Rome.They helped us arrange the city tour;the first day was excellent with us going to the Pantheon,Trevi fountain,the Vatican,the Roman forum,the colliseum etc with lunch included,this was great value.Our tour guide for the morning session(english speaking,the man with the white umbrella---excellent guide,I salute him). The hotel breakfast is GOOD.I appreciated very much the hotel arranging to pick us up from the airport free, a very good welcoming gesture and also offering the guests free post cards.The cost of the room at 267 euros per night is on the high side especially when we convert it to dollars. Overall, it is a good place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay At The Gardens”
Reviews.Author: decordiva
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much from the hotels due to the reviews I had read online-I was very pleased with Atlante Gardens. We were greeted at the airport by a very polite man who drove us to the hotel. The desk staff that greeted us(and throughout our stay) was very nice and helpful. Our room was alittle on the small size but completely manageable and the bath was nice sized-both were very clean and the staff was always there to give us anything extra that we needed(i.e.towels,pillows,etc.) The breakfast served was always fresh and delightfully presented by a wonderful staff.This hotel is WONDERFUL!!! The location of this hotel is GREAT! It is only a short walk to the Vatican and is in comfortable walking distance to other sites, shopping and resturants. You can catch a tour bus (get the two day pass) in front of the Vatican to go to other sites/shopping-the pass allows you to get on/off the bus as much as you want. We had a wonderful stay here and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone-I most diffently will stay there again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Atlante Garden, a great relax”
Reviews.Author: Solo4364
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and professional, they answered every question and offered help if needed. The hotel is well placed for visiting sites of Rome although take walking shoes, a much better option than race through guided tours. We can highly recommend the rooftop restaurant a fantastic meal and service. Rooms are well sized and quiet, only small gripe would be nice to have tea/coffee making facilities in the room and drawers for storage. Thanks Anne and George

Reviews.Title: “Pot Luck”
Reviews.Author: NoTentsHere
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Atlante Garden Hotel for 3 nights via the lastminute.com website. At the time of booking I did not know the hotel name as I booked one of the site's 'top secret' deals. After confirming the booking I was given the hotel name and I checked the reviews on TripAdvisor and started getting concerned. It turns out I was right to be worried. Upon arrival at the hotel we were informed there were no rooms available in the hotel and we were taken off to an apartment block close to the sister hotel around the corner. While the room was quite large it had a tiny bathroom and a funny smell which led me to believe it was not that clean. After returning to the hotel to complain I was told (quite rudely) that we had no other choice and would have to put up with it for one night before we could be moved to the hotel. The concierge very quickly asked what we wanted in return for staying in the sub-standard room for a night, which led me to believe that overbooking is a matter of practice for this hotel. Anyway, we did get a free taxi to the train station. The next night we moved to the hotel and the contrast couldn't have been greater. Our room was on the top floor and was clean and comfortable. The advertised jacuzzi didn't work but the lovely open terrace with table and chairs made up for it. If we had've moved straight into this room on our arrival we would have been extremely happy. The location is very close to the Vatican but the nightlife is lacking. There are a few restaurants in the alleys nearby though. Overall, despite the fact we ended up with a nice room, I would definitely not recommend this hotel to anyone in case they get shunted to some dodgy accommodation outside of the hotel. Even after getting a better room and a free taxi it still left a bitter taste in my mouth. And I will definitely never book a 'top secret' hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Family suite not available as reserved but otherwise a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: h20polomom
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip that included a two day stay in Rome. We booked this hotel because it advertised a family suite with 4 beds in one room as my husband and I were traveling with our two sons, 17 and 19 years and thought this would be a good choice for our brief stay. Our overall stay was very pleasant especially after reading some negative reviews prior to our stay. Our only negatives were that upon arrival we were informed that a suite was not available (even though we have confirmed the reservation 2 months prior to our stay). I was highly annoyed at this and was then offered an apartment a couple of blocks away to look at instead. I had read similar occurences with other travelers as well. We were otherwise offered two double rooms for the same price on the same floor. We settled for this option which turned out fine. The only other negative comment that I have is that the websites for this hotel state that the hotel has room service which it does not, the outside photo is actually of its sister hotel, The Atlante Star (which also has the rooftop garden restaurant) and the jacuzzi tubs don't work. The website is therefore, misleading and doesnt' need to be because it is otherwise a lovely place to stay. The positives of this hotel were the airport shuttle which was at the airport when we arrived (I had e-mailed them ahead of time informing them of our flight information). The breakfast was very good and plentiful -- with an assortment of cold meats, cheeses, cereals, breads, cakes, beverages with a very attentive staff. The bathroom was large and roomy. Our room overlooked the street which brought some traffic noise but not too bad with the window closed and heavy drapes. The room was small but adequate/comfortable and the entire hotel had an old European charm to it. The elevator only holds about two persons but this I expect is also somewhat commen in Europe. We did not use the bar downstairs but it also had an old European charm to it. Aside from our initial annoyance that what we had reserved wasn't available, we had a nice stay and the staff were very polite, helpful and professional. It is not a large place, but the location is within walking distance to the Vatican, shopping and restaurants. We would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Atlante Garden Hotel does not honor guest reservations”
Reviews.Author: european_traveler_7
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Atlante Garden Hotel in Rome Italy for 2 nights July 5th and 6th, 2007. We had prepaid 4 weeks earlier. Upon arriving at the hotel we were told we had to transfer to another hotel. When challenged about our reservation and confirmation (documents provided to hotel management) , the staff at the reception of the hotel became rude. We were told that the clients occupying our room would not leave... We were transfered against our will to another hotel (Hotel Michelangelo) near the Vatican and were robbed on our first day. Our advice, do not book at the Atlante Garden Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I wanna go again!”
Reviews.Author: JUWE87
Reviews.Content: Firstly, some of the candid photos are not of this hotel as reception does not have a steps down into the street nor a rooftop restaurant so someone was misguided. The Atlante Garden Hotel is on a long street only minutes walk from the Vatican where there are a few restaurants but mainly sandwich bars. Across the road is another smaller hotel and a tobacconist, further towards the city centre are a couple of bars but neither looked too welcoming. We arrived late on Tues 11 and while we walked our suitcases down the steps into the muralled entrance hall the bellboy immediately took them from us and after we checked in took them upto our room. It was a very spacious twin room and although we only stayed for 3 nights it was comfortable though more like a 3 star hotel. If you are looking for luxury then you should probably upgrade but brilliant for budget site-seers like us. The restaurant around the corner was a typical Italian, you walked down into it and although friendly the food left a lot to be desired. The best pizzeria is Pizzeria Baffeto, we found the address online and handed it over to the taxi driver and it had to be the thinest but most delicious pizza i have ever had. And bonus it was only 7 euros!! Word of warning about taxis; dont ask for the front desk to order one you can easily flag one down on the street if they are white with lights on but if you have reception order you one then it will cost more. We took taxis into the centre when we had been walking all day and it was very cheap, about 8 euros, 4 split between two of us. To get a bus you buy a ticket from a newstand or tobacconist and there are huge signs at bus stops detailing where they drop off. I recommend buying a guide book so you have a map at all times as well as cultural info etc. The room did get noise from the street and we couldnt open the shutters on the outside of the windows so couldnt see out but they were helping with sound, cnn was the only english speaking channel and we were unsure about the shower/bath situation so only used the shower head for a quick wash but it was so cheap that none of this mattered it was adequate. The free breakfast was brilliant, there were 3 types of cereal, every type of jam you have ever seen, rolls, pastries, orange squash, tea, coffee, water, eggs, breakfast meats...If you are going for longer then i would take a towel as they supply hard sort of tea towel fabrics but theyre fine for wiping hands but also the hair dryers are hard to use so bring one if needed. I desperately want to go to Rome again and for £150 this hotel was brilliant but to do again id pick a place more central as in the evenings there was nothing to do and we had to travel in for food that wasnt a sandwich. You cannot see everything in 3 days we saw the Piazza Navona, Pantheon, Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Roman Forum, St Peters Bascillica, Vatican Museums, Spanish Steps but there was sooo much more lol. Buses are cheap and easy though we got one from Via Nazionale (Shopping Street) at home time for workers about 5/6pm and although everywhere it says the bus should have gone to our street it went everywhere but including the bus shelter. It was packed more than a London tube station and although people were getting trapped in doors trying to hold on they have to stop at every bus stop where it was like the Titanic, people were pushing up against the sides and it was scary, we eventually (after 2 hours) got back off at Via Nazionale and got a taxi for only 7 euros back to the hotel which i would definitely take over a bus at night. Early February was an excellent time to visit as crowds at sites like the Colosseum were still there but we could make it to the front of a queue in 15-20 mins that would take hours in the Summer. Piazza Navona is full of excellent restaurants with menus that wont break the bank. While we were there on the same street as the hotel two movies were being filmed and we were stopped by a TV camera crew. Rome reminds me a lot of New York but around each corner is another wonderful building, monument or in some cases just a beautiful restaurant, the quintessential European place where you can sit, chat, people watch and experience some of the best cuisine in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Freindly and helpfull and very clean”
Reviews.Author: fivestar2007
Reviews.Content: We have just come home from a lovely holiday in Rome. We booked it through lastminute.com. Having read a couple of reviews on this site and others I was a little concerned, but once you have booked there is not a lot you can do. When we arrived we were met by a very charming bellboy who took our cases with no fuss or bother, we descended to the basement reception desk and booked in. The staff were freindly helpful and welcoming from the moment we arrived. The hotel is very dark but very very clean, the furnishings were pretty and in keeping with the 'Rome' experience, and the room was lovely, so, so clean. Ok the jacuzzi bath didn't work very well, but hey, we were in Rome for God's sake who wants to spend hours in the bath when there is so much to see and do! We were at the front of the hotel and the traffic noise was loud, but the hotel is on the equivelant to Oxford Street in London, so again who cares. The room was cleaned every day and breakfast was fresh and unrushed (they even sorted a 'packed ' breakfast for one day when we left early for a trip) and also had no objection to us taking some apples for the daytime. There are also free street maps in the reception area which clearly mark out the attractions. If your fit its nearly all within walking distance, If you want to take the bus, the hotel reception staff allways seem to know which number bus and how much it would cost. The Vatican and St Peters square is a 2 minute walk away, and there is nothing more lovely than sitting in the square as the sun goes down after all the busses have left. It's quiet and perfect. I would definitely go again and use the same hotel, and yes there is no roof garden (it is at the sister hotel) but again it's a 30 second walk, and you get a reasonable discount if you book through the atlante garden. Just accross the road in the square there is a little caffe, called Pizza Paradise, its very small with yellow tablecloths and the Italian flag painted either side of the door. The staff speak litlle English, but smile a lot, the coffee in georgous and only 1 Euro for an Espresso, the pizza is fresh and weighed out for you so you only pay for what you want. It's served up on a wooden board, and they do fresh local beer chilled and cheap! Watch out for the larger restaurants down the alleyways,one in the Bogo Pio, called Trattoria Capalone (number 92) charged us 15% service, charged for bread and would not take no for an answer. We ended up with cold uncooked meatballs and awful pasta, the bill came on a scrap piece of paper and included the service charge it came to 54 Euros, we had no change so gave them 60, and waited for the change.... and waited, eventually my husband asked the waiter for the change, he refused then prentended not to understand us and then he turned his back on us. Never mind, it only happens once and you learn from it. I will never go there again, but the tradgedy is that we would not go to the street again, so the other restaurants missed out. Overall Rome is fantastic, it's clean and freindly, I felt safe even when we got lost at night. All the public toilets are clean (even the one in front of the Colosseum). If the is one tip i would give anyone it would be ...USE THE PUBLIC WATER FOUNTANS, they are fresh drinking water, we spent so much on buying bottled water when there was no need. Well done Hotel Atlante Garden I cannot wait to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: bsitlelviee
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I recently spent five days in Rome at the Atlante Garden Hotel - it was perfect!!! The location was excellent, a few minutes walk to the Vatican and a quick bus ride to the Forum. The reception staff were brilliant they answered every question/query we had. The rooms were lovely and overall we could not have asked for anything more. We will be going back to Rome and Atlante Garden soon as it is beautiful! Thank you Atlante Garden for making our trip one to remember!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great to the Atlante Garden”
Reviews.Author: gorodish
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel mainly because of the location - near the Vatican - and the lure of the jacuzzi in our room. We actually booked the Atlante Star but, on arriving, found that we had been switched to the Garden. Not a problem BUT the room we had transferred to was tiny, and there was no jacuzzi, as promised. A polite word was had with reception who were fine about giving us a better room - with jacuzzi. The room was bigger but not huge - having stayed in Rome before, our conclusion is that there aren't many big hotel rooms in Rome. In fact, the staff were helpful and friendly throughout our stay. Probably the best thing about the hotel is the view from the breakfast room/restaurant on the top floor of the dome of St Peter's, which is very close by. Breakfasts average - the restaurant looked interesting but very pricey when there are a number of very decent trattoria nearby. Check out the Via Renzi di Cola ( I may not have that quite right) just north of the hotel - a wide boulevard in a very attractive area with loads of nice shops and cafes that is away from the tourist route and which feels very 'Roman'. And from there it's a shortish stroll to the lovely Piazza Di Popolo. So - great location, decent facilities (but nothing spectacular), great views, and a nice jacuzzi (when you can get one). Overall - a thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MaryIndianapolis
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days in April. Got a quad for 2 adults and 2 teenagers. Very happy with hotel. Had a great breakfast from 7-10 each morning with lots of food. Room very comfortable. Staff at front desk very helpful with mulitiple requests. Pickup at airport very convenient. Easy walking distance to multiple places but actually situated on a quiet Rome street (not many of those) so able to sleep etc. Rooftop garden at sister hotel closed for renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Calm and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Doghead
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel in a very convenient location no more than 5 minutes from St Peters and the Sistine, from which we managed to see about everything in the centre of Rome that a human could walk to in 4 days. The rooms are warm and comfortable (if perhaps a bit small and dark..?) and the en suite facilities were really good. Nothing like a good Jacuzzi after a whole day spent tramping the streets of Rome, I promise you! The staff were particularly friendly and helpful (even in the face of some pretty awful behaviour from other guests that I overheard) and whenever we needed something arranging they did so with the maximum efficiency and the minimum of fuss. The hotel is twinned with another Atlanta, the Star, just down the road and if you want to spoil yourself and have a bit of cash to spare, the rooftop restaurant there with a moonlit view of the duomo of St Peter is really something else, and the food was quite beautiful. Drawbacks: the hotel has no restaurant itself and therefore apart from the breakfast (which was substantial and fine for our needs), you will have to and find one of the many local restaurants to dine in - not that this is exactly a drawback! There could also be a bit more information provided about local places to go, nightspots, services provided by the hotel, but this seems a bit carping given the overall level of performance. The car service they provide to and from Fiumicino/Ciampino is quite a bit more expensive (50-60 Euros) than, say, the bus, but Ciampino in particular is such a hole why make your journey any worse...? We'd definitely go back and we'd really like to try one of the de luxe rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 4-star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jestersgems
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying at this hotel, as the hotel we originally booked (Atlante Star - their sister hotel), told us they had no rooms available on the day of our arrival, even though we had our reservations since July of 2006. The Atlante Garden has no restaurant or room service. As you walk down the steps inside the hotel from the street, you feel a lovely ambiance. It stops there. The rooms are dark (even with windows wide open), dirty and old (wallpaper is peeling, base boards are peeling, carpet is soiled, light bulbs are out, chair cushions are soiled). Having stayed in 4 and 5 star hotels, I can tell you that calling this hotel even a 3-star is a stretch. The hotel staff are courteous, although clueless as to the run-down nature of their establishment. They offer a buffet breakfast which is average, at best. The best part of this hotel is the restaurant Taverna Varrone, which is around the corner and not affiliated with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good for couples”
Reviews.Author: holidaymaker32
Reviews.Content: We wanted a nice hotel in a convenient location for a short holiday in Rome, and the Atlante Garden was perfect for us. We spent three nights in a gorgeous room on the fourth floor.
