The wallpaper and curtains were fabulous dark green striped brocade, and the double bed came complete with mirror above the headboard. The ensuite jacuzzi was a lovely touch, and made coming back after a long day sightseeing so much more relaxing. The ambience was a bit Austin Powers shag pad - you wouldn't want it in your home, but for a holiday it was great fun! The hotel seemed to be a great place for couples, not convinced it's hugely set up for families. Can't imagine what the other reviewers were complaining about: yes, there were slightly odd napkins in the bathroom, but there were also plenty of fluffy towels; the rooms are indeed dark if you keep the curtains and nets and shutters closed, but really aren't if you don't; Rome is just noisy, get used to it; and why on earth would having UK television be of any importance when Rome is on your doorstep? The rooms were clean, well-presented, and the staff polite and helpful. The hotel is hugely conveniently situated, and you can easily reach most places on foot. One useful tip is to buy a full-day bus pass (about four euros) and use it to get around. The 492 bus passes right by the hotel, and crosses the city, stopping in a variety of useful places for sightseeing. Do take advantage of the free pickup service as you arrive, as a taxi from the airport is about 50 euros. The one minor gripe I would have would be about the coffee at breakfast; in a city famed for wonderful caffe, the standard left a little to be desired. Otherwise, the hotel was an excellent part of a really lovely trip to a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: LondonTripper82
Reviews.Content: When I saw the hotel on the website I thought that it looked really lovely, especially as it stated that it had a jacuzzi in the bath. However I wished I had read the write ups before booking. A present to my boyfriend for his birthday, we then got there to find ladders and other tools visible in reception. The carpet was very dated as like the rest of the furnishings. In places the carpet was thread bare. The room itself was a fair size, however our window overlooked the road which was noisy whatever the time of day. The windows had covers that could be shut behind them. If these were completely closed, the room was pitch black. The televison had about 6 channels that were all in Italian. We realise we were not there to watch telly but it would have been nice while getting ready for a night out or to catch up on the news. There were also starched napkins in the bathroom. Not sure what that was all about??!!! The flush to the toilet was on the wall which nearly came off when pressed. The hotel is in no way a 4 star hotel. Overall the hotel was comfortable and the hotel staff friendly enough, however I feel they are misleading guests by advertising at this star rating. The hotel looks like it was brand new back in the 70's. Good location, very near the vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmmmmmmmm.............”
Reviews.Author: SimonHerts
Reviews.Content: The free ride from the airport is a nice touch, and the hotel looks great when you go though the front door and into the lobby. But then.... Firstly, we booked a double room - only to be given a twin room. When I complained I was told that "we don't have double beds in this hotel - they are all single and we put them together". Okay.... Secondly, nice a touch as the bubbly bath is, it leaks. REALLY leaks, like all over the floor. When I complained, I was told "all the baths leak - that's all I hear, every five mins". What? Does it not seem strange that all the baths would leak? I was starting to get the feeling that I was in some weird Fawlty Towers type of situation, where everything I would mention would be filled with one rubbish excuse after another. The breakfast is ok, nothing hot (no toast) but decent enough and the location is great (the traffic noise is, as others have said, pretty awful but what can you do?) for any sight seeing you might want. I would say that the hotel is not really a four star - a three at best, but a really well decorated three. Prob a bit overpriced for what it is but Rome is so fantastic and this hotel is right in the middle of where you would want to be, so you pays you money and takes your choice. So, no regrets but wouldn't stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Dark, Dull and not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: stpukkapie
Reviews.Content: Initially as I went in I was not disappointed, as the staff were friendly and the hotel looks nice, but for a 4 star hotel I was suprised. The room was small on the 1st floor and very noisy, the street noise was worst but then the running water from other room seemed to go straight past our head board. Not disheartened, as it was well decorated we put the tv on with sky box to see there were around 6 Italian only channels, fair enough not here to watch tv and we are in Italy, but expect from a higher class hotel something to get ready to, or some bbc news or something. The Jacuzzi bath also did not work, and the toilet flush and shower head were coming off the wall. We also booked at the hotel roof top garden for dinner one night, only to find it was actually two blocks away at the atlantic star hotel, which we got very wet walking too. To be fair staff are helpful, despite the cleaner leaving our room unlocked, but the bar was also not open on the tuesday eveining, when we had been out all day and simply wanted a cup of coffee before getting ready to go out. Location is good for vatican and it is a nice walk to the old town, but still, think for the money you should try elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: FrankCheshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Atlante Garden for two nights. The hotel staff including reception were extremely pleasant and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable, bed was very comfortable. Unfortunately our room was on the second floor overlooking the busy road and the traffic noise was bad, even with the window and shutters closed. We spoke to other guests who had rooms at the back of the hotel and they had no noise. The breakfast was very good - just about everything you can think of for a cold buffet breakfast, including very nice cake! The location for St Peter's and the Vatican was excellent - about ten minutes walk. Taxi from Termini to hotel should cost about 12 euros, we were charged 35 euros - so beware!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fab food at the Atlante Gardens”
Reviews.Author: HelenMidlands
Reviews.Content: I chose this Hotel because it offered family rooms for four and was a 4 Star Hotel. On arriving we were impressed with the cleanliness of the Hotel. Checking in was quick and the room ready with toiletries and plenty of towels. The room was large with plenty of room bearing in mind there were 2 adults, 13 and 11 year old together. we had a large bathroom with a shower and jetted bath. All the staff were friendly. Breakfast was great plenty of choice fresh fruit, cereal, yogurt, cakes,and breads ect. I would definetly return to this hotel it's location is ideal to see all of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: jillyfish-7
Reviews.Content: We have just returned froma Trip to Rome which was a Suprise 30th Birthday gift for my Husband, we styed at the Atlante Garden Hotel, which was right in the heart of things, we where just 3 mins walk away from the Vatican and all the other sites were within reasonale walking distance. The Hotel was lovley and the staff where very welcoming, and the directions I was given from via email from the hotel, were exact.

Reviews.Title: “Dark as a dungeon”
Reviews.Author: cj422
Reviews.Content: The rooms and halls were incredibly dark. When you woke, you had no sense of whether it was light or dark out, the weather, or what time of day it was. The windows are draped in dark, heavy curtains, and they only hide thick wooden shutters. In one corner of the room there was a water leak from above of some sort, which had rotted away a small portion of the carpet, and there were 3-4 bugs crawling around in the damp area. This was only discovered on the last day, after moving a chair, which had obviously been placed there to cover up the situation. The leak gave the room and the bed itself a damp feel. In short, whenever we were in the room, we wanted to get out as quickly as possible. Which was a good thing because we had things to see. The breakfast was good and the staff was very helpful. The phone charges are outrageous, as noted above. $13 for a less than 3 minute call to a shuttle service. There are hundreds of hotels in Rome, there is no reason at all to take a chance on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pensim
Reviews.Content: Hotel was lovely, very clean and perfectly situated. The staff were very helpful and exceptionally friendly. Would book this hotel again without a doubt - the jacuzzi bath was a perfect way to relax after a days walking! Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping woes”
Reviews.Author: calam1ty
Reviews.Content: I purposely booked this four star hotel for a treat on my first visit to Rome. Overall, it was OK. The location is pretty good, especialy if you plan to visit the Vatican and it was quiet but near a main street and lots of shoe stores. There were a few problems: 1. Housekeeping - the first night all went well. The second night one towel was not swapped for a clean one. As well toiletries were not replenished and instead of changing the dwindling toilet paper, two refill rolls were left by the bidet. The third night we came home to find the bed completely unmade and every dirty towel we had left for pick up still on the bathroom floor. The front desk didn't seem to care all that much, did arrive half an hour later with a few towels and seemed a little annoyed we wanted them to take the dirty ones away. 2. Internet - This was not wifi since they supply a network cable. When I decided I needed it (for business) they announced the line was down. Instead I could use the computer in the small lounge which cost about double and meant I had to use an Italian keyboard which wasted a ton of my precious and expensive time. . 3. Deluxe room - we had no view, very disappointing. It was as already reported an obstructed view of a courtyard with a door that was very hard to open. The large jacuzzi tub (I've posted a picture) looked inviting but all the knobs were either off or not working and when you could get it working was incredibly loud. (Incidentally, we could hear a LOT from another room.) The shower (hand held) was great though. I intend to write the management and let them know how disappointed we were but I somehow doubt they will compensate me in any way.

Reviews.Title: “tourist trap”
Reviews.Author: vze1w90x
Reviews.Content: First thing is that this hotel is not a 4 star hotel as stated in various places including their own website. The staff is very friendly and helpful, but the rooms are no more than what you would expect from a fleabag hotel would be. The rooms are dark with not enough lighting, there is nowhere to unpack your underclothing. There is just enough hangers in the closet for one person. The bathroom didn't have a makeup mirror for my traveling partner, the lighting in the bathroom was also poor. This hotel also charges for the following: When a person tries to make a call, the second you dial for an outside line you are being charged for the call whether you connect or not. I paid 90.00 Euros for a total of 4 calls that finally connected and I was using a calling card.. The TV in the room was a 13 inch tv that never worked, not that I wanted to watch tv but I did want to watch the news in the morning so I could get an idea of how the weather would be like. The bathroom stunk like the sewer. The housekeeper only changed the bed sheets when you left a tip. Their was no and I repeat NO ROOM SERVICE at all, so if you were extremely tired like we were, you were forced to go out for dinner. All of the above is after I asked for a room upgrade. I've stayed in european hotels before and none were as bad as this one, I know the rooms are a bit smaller but I felt as if I was a homeless person. This hotel should not even be given a star. The only good thing about this hotel was that I was 4 blocks away from the Vatican. Anyone who says this hotel is a great value must be insane.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but otherwise nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Lozza01
Reviews.Content: The Atlante Garden's 4 star rating is definitely over-stating the quality of this hotel. The location is good and it was clean but the rooms are very small and there are no frills. For example, the coffee served for breakfast appears to be instant, in Italy! That being said, it was ok and the staff are pleasant enough, just don't expect 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Liu-jo
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival in sunny Rome we were glad to find the Atlante Garden ideal for all our holiday needs starting with the free airport pick-up service, the tidy rooms, clean modern bathrooms & especially the central position. In less than five minutes we could reach St. Peter's and the Vatican museum. Just round the corner is a fantastic shopping boulevard along with lots of local shops, supermarkets, typical restaurants etc. The staff proved very helpful at all times and were always happy to assist us. We have recommended this hotel to a number of our friends as it is overall complete and very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!!”
Reviews.Author: Emma&Kieran
Reviews.Content: ...or be prepared for a huge disappointment.... I picked the hotel based on the website, how I wished I had read all the reviews first. The website totally misled our decision. The positive point was that we only stayed 3 nights and there is so much to see in Rome that we spent very little time in the hotel. When you arrive at the hotel, you go down a narrow stairs where the reception area, the breakfast room and the “bar” (not at all what you would expect from a 4 star hotel) are located; Far from inspiring! Our bedroom was on the 1st floor and was a deluxe room….. I would not like to know what an ordinary room was like! As we arrived on the 1st floor, we were greeted by laundry bags all over the place. Our room was so dark that at any time, we had all the lights on even at 8 in the morning. Our room was at the back of the hotel, and the window opened (with great difficulty) onto a yard surrounded by buildings (hence the darkness). We could not get to the yard though as there was locked iron gates in front of the window. The yard was extremely noisy due to workers doing some joinery work right outside our window!! This didn’t bother us much though as we couldn’t wait to get out of the hotel anyway. Our bathroom had a Jacuzzi that didn’t work and we had cold showers a good few times –which you don’t mind too much since it was 26C outside, still it would have been good to decide for ourselves and not to be at the mercy of the hotel water capacity! This hotel is not a four star, in Ireland, it would be a one star, 2 with a push. It is not a 4 stars in Italian standards either. Needless to say we will never come back to this hotel, and if this review can stop someone making the same mistake that we made, I would be very happy.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay”
Reviews.Author: Island_Gen
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and in a great location. But it was so expensive for what you got...small rooms and okay service. Our room had a balcony looking at an inner courtyard of laundry hanging and an old elevator. Typically this is not a view one is looking for on a vacation but I didn't mind it so much because I got to see a little bit of how people in Rome, Italy live. A continental type breakfast was served each moring and the view from here was breathtaking...St. Peters Bascilica.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: KazNZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in August 05 for a wedding and weren't expecting anything wonderful as we got such a good deal on the room (as cheap for two of us as staying in a hostel outside the city) but we were pleasantly surprised. The room was more than adequate. It was very clean, cool and when you came in in the afternoon after walking around in the heat all day the curtains and shutters made the room pitch black, perfect for having a nap before headng out for dinner. The location was excellent, extremely close to St Peters and the Vatican and all the other main attractions were well within walking distance (except for the collosseum though we walked there too) as long as you're used to strolling around cities (I'm not talking super fitness but an old aged pensioner might not manage it). The breakfast wasn't great it has to be said but there was plenty of it and if you like cheese and meat this is the place for you. Overall we had a great stay here and I would definately stay here again, it's definately great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: baldfatlimey
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful 5 days in Rome, made extra special by this hotel and its very friendly staff. The hotel is on a main road a few minutes walk from the Vatican and 10 minutes walk from the Castle St Angelo, 15 minutes from Piazza Navona, so in a great position for some of the best sites Rome has to offer. We arrived early at the hotel, after being picked up from the airport (free transfer) and they provided a welcoming coffee while our room was being made up, free of charge. They also presented us with a fine bottle of fizz to help us celebrate our wedding anniversary. A nice touch. The room was well appointed, good sized bed, enough storage space, jaccuzi bath and shower (and loo and foot washer) on the 4th floor. Not double glazed, but air conditioned. No great view from our window - but I guess the front rooms would be able to see Vatican city. All the staff, from Chamber maids, frontdesk and waiters were always charming and helpful. Breakfast was typical European, with plenty of meat, cheese, cereals and yogurts - plus of course, sweet cakes to go with the fresh bread. Both of us are looking forward to retuning to this hotel early 2007.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, located close to Vatican”
Reviews.Author: rusticus
Reviews.Content: We had booked Atlante Garden hotel via dertour travel agency. 5 nights were only charged for 4, the kid (under 12) was free. Free transfer from airport Fiumicino (is 45-50 Euro via Taxi). (but: transfer back to the airport has to be payed!) Friendly staff at reception and breakfast room. Room interior is stylish, old-fashioned, rooms are a little bit dark. Short footwalk away is the partner hotel Atlante Star - guests are free to have their breakfast there. The breakfast room at A. Star is in the 6 th floor and offers a fantastic view on St. Piedro and the vatican (s. photo 2). The breakfast is a little bit richer than at A. Garden. A. Star has a roof garden restaurant at 7th floor which offers a breathtaking view at night (unfortunately we have not been there). The hotel A. Garden is located between Vatican and St. Angelo. Bus line 492 stops just across the street; its about 500 meters to metro station Ottavio. Special tip: Pizzeria Angelia Borgo is only 200 meter away (Borgo Angelico 28-30, s. photo 1) has tastefull dishes and low price wines!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful short stay at the Atlante Garden”
Reviews.Author: FootPrintsintheSand
Reviews.Content: We had a day and a half pre-cruise visit in Rome. This hotel was clean, had friendly staff, and a very comfortable room. The hotel was less than a 5 minute walk to St. Peter's Square, perfect for picking up sightseeing buses and starting a memorable trip in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Bacaro
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the Atlante Garden via taxi was shocking to me! The hotel IS garden level for the main foyer and from the outside did not have the grand entrance that I expected. Being used to much larger hotels, the small elevator also was a concern ~ BUT when we got to our room, opened the shutters, I instantly felt the ambiance of Italy! The room had a kingsize bed which was wonderful but also a rarity for Europe -- the personnel from the manager down through all the staff were wonderful, helpful, courteous and made our stay one to remember!!! To top it all off - this hotel is not only close to the Vatican but also close to the best shopping district in Rome for great buys! Both are within 2 blocks. This hotel also offers free transfer from the airport -- I will definitely stay here again and would recommend it to any traveler who is searching for large room/bed accommodations with the flavor of Rome--in great location at a modest price! If you are looking for luxury & that is important to you -- this is not the hotel for you -- but you will definitely miss out on an incredible hidden treasure of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in the city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Atlante Garden for our first wedding anniversary between 21st to 27th June. The Hotel is currently being re-decorated. The staff were very pleasant. Note that you don't have a safe in the room (we didn't on the second floor), so had to use a locked box in reception. The city is right on the doorstep, Piazza Navona where we ate most nights about a ten minute walk or a 7 euro taxi ride. The room wasn't that quiet, especially with the Italians celebrating their World Cup wins but you get used to it. A nice feature is that you can walk to the sister hotel (the Star) and have breakfast there on level 6, Les Etoiles. This also is the rooftop restaurant (although it's enclosed it has a good view of St. Peter's to the right). We think that they are refurbishing the top floor of the Star but it was a shame that we couldn't access the very top. Back to the Garden Hotel - they don't use the orangery, so don't expect to sit outside in it..! Otherwise a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Overall”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel was good. It's walking distance from the Vatican. The service was very friendly. But, the hotel room was comfortable (althought the third bed was lumpy). The bathroom was a good size and seemed fairly new. The "shuttle" was aweful... I'd suggest having someone call right away when you get off the plane because they'll give you the runaround that they were there waiting for you. We waited at least 2 hours. This certainly was not luxurious, but was nice for a couple days.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel provided excellent service. I was there for only two nights. Its location in Rome could not be better. the employees were always courteous and helpful. Tthe room and bath were clean. Breakfast was all that one could want. All in all, I can not think of anything about which to be critical. I thank you for the service. Robert F. Zunzer

Reviews.Title: “A pleaant week in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a very pleasant week at Hotel Atlante Garden where I especially appreciated the never failing kindness of the receptionists and the impeccable daily cleaning of our room. Regards Jens Christoffersen

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Linda095
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband at the Atlante Garden at the beginning of May this year and was very disappointed. The Hotel photographs shown on the internet are in most parts taken at the sister hotel which is definitely not situated next door and much nicer! The roof garden was also closed for renovation and had been for the past six months. I questioned the staff on reception on why this was not on their website as this was very misleading, they shrugged and said the reservations office was responsible for the advertising and they were not based in the hotel so not their problem. No apologies! I also agree with previous coment on the general unfriendlyness of the staff, reception staff at times were very rude and unhelpful the only smile was from the chamber maid! The hotel is still being renovated with mis-matched worn carpets on the stair wells, bags contiaining bedding to be washed stored on the stairs and repairs including scraping off of old plaster and paint repair in progress. The bar is tiny and placed in the overflow breakfast room in the corner. The hotel is situated on a busy street so a quiet room is essential to getting any sleep. Our second room (we were moved once because of the noise) was small but reasonably furnished but some updating needed. The bath had broken controls and the TV only had access to a few channels mostly european. The room was cleaned daily and clean towels provided Breakfast was generally good although the staff became a little flustered if everyone came to breakfast at the same time and had to be reminded to refill hot water, fruit and rolls etc There were quite a number of guests moaning about the service and how they felt mislead by the hotels advertising when they booked. The hotel entrance outside is dimly lit and there are a number of steps down to reception when you enter which are fairly steep especially handling luggage or if you have walking difficulties. One plus is the location just a few minutes wailk from the Vatican and reasonably easy to access to the other sights by foot. We have stayed in a lot of four star hotels in the past and the Atlante Garden did not match this grade. I would have given it a 2 star so felt cheated!! - Plently of choice in Rome so this hotel is not value for money and I would not recomend it. . I would Recommend the city though!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Atlante Garden Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In this instance I won't be one for a lot of words. I only want to say that my wife and I really enjoyed staying at the Atlante Garden Hotel in Rome, Italy. The room was clean and most of all very comfortable. the hotel was in close proximity to most of the sights that we were interested in walking to. Public transportation was close at hand, the food was good, and the hotel staff were very kind and courteous. I loved this hotel so well that as a travel writer I will feature the hotel prominantly in my article on ROME. The magazine that I write for -- has a readership of about 15,000,000 persons world wide so you can expect an increase in business.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently I had the occasion of staying at the Atlante Garden Hotel and found it very conveniently situated in the very centre of Rome at practically walking distance to all of Rome's major landmarks, especially St. Peter's and confidently situated next to Cola di Rienzo shopping area which turned out to be one of Rome's top. The hotel offered all the comforts needed also recently the rooms had been renovated in a traditional British style and all was well taken care of plus the free airport pick up transfers proved very effective and essential. One of the best things was the buffet breakfast offered at a sister hotel minutes walk away and boasting a spectacular view of St. Peter's dome - a truly one of a kind experience. It made for a perfect stay in an already amazing city as Rome is.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even go there!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had planned a romantic city break in Rome in the faith that we were staying in a beautiful and popular inner city hotel, however we could not have been more wrong. Unfortunatley, our hotel appeared to bear little resemblance to that advertised on the internet. Our room, despite being on the 4th floor was noisy, even throughout the night, due to the hotels close proximity to one of the major shopping streets. The room was outdated in decor, and generally tatty as there were stains on the carpets and walls, and the window would not shut properly. The bathroom, although more contemporary in design was also in need of some renovation. The flush for the toilet fell off the wall numerous times and the shower curtain was not long enough for the bath, allowing water to spill out every time we had a shower. The rooms was, however cleaned every day and fresh towels added daily. Staff although helpful when asked specifically, were generally unfriendly, especially breakfast staff. From the pictures and comments we had expected a wide range of different foods available at breakfast, however were disappointed by the miserable variety available. We did however, enjoy a lovely meal at the sister hotel, The Atlante Star, overlooking St Peter's. Although it is not next door as described. If you are looking for a high standard 4 star hotel, then I would look elsewhere, this one is definately not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star”
Reviews.Author: Justjimbob
Reviews.Content: My girlfiend and I stayed in the the hotel at the beginning of April and were very dissapointed. Our room, although on the fourth floor, was noisy. The window would not close properly and we found ourselves waking up in the middle of the night due to the traffic. The hotel is positioned very close to one of the main shopping streets in Rome (Via Cola di Renzo) hence why it was so noisy. The carpet and walls were covered in stains of some kind and the carpet was coming away from the floor. The bathroom was tatty and in need of attention, paint was peeling off the ceiling and tiles were coming away from the wall. The shower curtain was positioned so high up that it only just reached the bath clearly causing the floor to get wet every time we washed. Having looked at the Hotel on the internet prior to visiting we were expecting something of a much higher standard. Many of the pictures on the Atlante Garden were of it's sister hotel, the Atlante Star (2 blocks away). We had dinner there and it was much nicer! Staff were helpful but only when asked and were quite unfriendly. Despite all this however, the hotel location was handy. It was very close to Saint Peter's and the Castello Saint Angelo, everything else was a bit of a walk. Also, the room was clean and the bed was made every day. If you have high standards and are expecting to stay in a four star hotel I would not recommend this one to you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Claire28
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Atlante Gardens for 3 nights at the end of March. We had a double room with en-suite. The receptionists spoke English and the concierge was very helpful; as soon as we stepped out the car he was there to take our bags. The hotel was very good at organising an airport transfer for us from Ciampino. I organised this through e-mail a week before we were due to arrive and the staff were quick to respond to my e-mails. The room was very clean and spacious and the jacuzzi bath a nice touch. The breakfast was lovely. We were situated on the second floor (facing another building so not much of a view) and we did experience some noise from the road that woke us up at night. The hotel is right by the Vatican and St Peters and easy walking distance from St Angelo Castle. It is very close to the metro too. I will say that there is not many places to eat during the evening around the hotel; we took a taxi to Navona which cost us about EUR 7 each way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in late September. We had problems finding getting our transfer from the airport, but once we got to the hotel, things were much better. The staff was courteous and very helpful. The rooms were nice, but the best feature of the hotel was the location. It's within walking distance of St. Peter's and Castle Sant'Angelo.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Atlante Garden”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Four American women traveling alone stayed 2 nights at the Atlante Garden in Rome. We were very pleased with the accomodations and service. It is a beautiful hotel and we found the rooms to be extremely neat and clean; comfortable beds and we loved the elevated bath. The staff was friendly and very helpful in providing directions and recommendations for restaurants and tours. We enjoyed the breakfast and having a glass of wine at the end of our day in the pretty little bar. Other guests were friendly. The location was perfect for the activities we were interested in. We felt safe at all times. We would recommend this hotel to anyone planning a stay in Roma!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it - great location, great breakfast, great staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Atlante Garden for our visit over Presidents Day holiday weekend. The location was great for walking to the Vatican & Sistine Chapel. We also walked easily to the Piazza Navonna and the Pantheon. We found the Metro easily and loved our visits to the Coloseum, Forum, Victor Emanuel, etc. We were very happy with the delicious breakfast every morning, which featured delicious Swiss cheese, granola/yogurt, lean ham, bananas, etc. It held us til dinner with a very light snack in between. The bar was open our last night there, and we enjoyed a Bailey's before retiring. The bathtub with jets was great...room nice and clean and comfortable. Everyone was friendly, seemed to appreciate our efforts to speak Italian, and spoke English to us. Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel was geniunely very clean. In a fantastic position in the city. Very friendly staff and great upkeep of hotel and room. The only downside during our stay was that one of the breakfast rooms was not avaliable, which was a bit of disaster at feeding time and the bar was closed. Other than that I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Vercanze Romane”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. a holiday always to remember. everything was first class! very sweet and nice staff, and the hotel has a lovely atmosphere. kind regards camilla :-)

Reviews.Title: “what a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we booked the hotel we were expecting a **** hotel. In reality we got nothing more than a ** hotel. For example; entrance via the basement, very simple rooms, the bathroom needed to be renovated 10 years ago and on sunday we got breakfast from the day before; the hotel couldn't find fresh bread on sunday! We were disappointed. The only good thing about the hotel was the location; right in the middle of the old city and near the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel. not the best location for a first trip to rome.”
Reviews.Author: shianlotta
Reviews.Content: OVERALL while our room was fairly comfortable and clean, there were issues with service. also, this is not the best location for a first time visitor to rome, as it is far from most sites and has less dining options then other areas. i would not stay at this hotel again, although it was decent. ROOM my family and i stayed in 336, a room for 4 that consisted of 3 twin beds and a pull out couch that wasn't very comfortable. the room was clean and had a nice view of a courtyard and a residential street. we were on the third floor and got a fair bit of street noise, but that's probably to be expected in rome. the bathroom was decent, clean, and had a bidet. BREAKFAST breakfast was fair, consisting of baked goods, plates of cold cuts, fruit, yogurt, and assorted condiments. the coffee was pretty bad, but it's preferable to go out to bars for cappucino & such anyway. SHUTTLE the shuttle from the airport to the hotel picked us up right on time. however, we weren't able to get a shuttle back to the airport when we were leaving because "all the shuttles were full." we ended up taking a taxi that cost 55 EUR. SERVICE service was somewhat rude. the front desk was mostly unhelpful, although this can mainly be attributed to one staff member. they wouldn't help us book reservations for dinner and didn't have many suggestions for restaurants in the area. when we requested a shuttle to the airport we were simply told, "no, we're full." after asking about alternate ways to get to the airport for a while the concierge finally said, "do you want us to book you a taxi?" um, yes, of course. LOCATION for a first time visitor to rome, this is not the ideal location unless you want to spend a lot of time at the vatican. the next time i go i will definitely stay in the city center. the location was far from most of what we wanted to see, a 20-40 minute walk to main sights like the pantheon, trevi fountain, roman forum, colosseum. we stayed outside walking all day, which was quite tiring. it would have been nice to be able to take a break at the hotel in the middle of the day or before dinner, since restaurants do not open for dinner until 7 - 7:30.

Reviews.Title: “Rome in November”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 day stay at the Atlante Garden Hotel in Rome. The hotel was situated in a very good area, literally a 2 minute walk from the Vatican, which is lovely to see lit up at night. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and very helpful. The room was very comfortable and clean and everything worked, including the jacuzzi bath!!! We didn't venture up to the roof-top restaurant as we thought it would be a little cold but read other reviews which said it was lovely and I imagine the view to be fantastic. I shall definitely be recommending this hotel to friends/family and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was very comfortable and nicely sized. The large bathroom/shower & tub were welcome after a long day of travel. The location was GREAT. Close to shopping, dining and the Vatican. When in Rome we plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, otherwise not a 4 star as promoted”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from one week at the Atlante Garden Hotel, promoted through Priceline and other travel sites as a four star. Even by European standards this was barely a 2 star hotel. No complaints regarding free airport pickup, as the driver was waiting for us as soon as we got our luggage. Room was small, but OK. Bathroom was horrible, "jacuzzi tub" did not work, and after speaking to several other quests, we found out this was also the case with other rooms. Shower hose would spray the whole bathroom if you did not hold onto it. Front desk staff was reasonable, although I did not spend much time complaining. Housekeeping was very efficient. Location great. Very small elevator fitting only 2 adults with no luggage. Last 2 days there was no hot water at all, with no explanations nor apologies. Atlante Star "roof top" was closed. Very small breakfast room, with limited hours.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a really relaxing time in this hotel, we stayed 5 nights, the room was very comfortable, clean and roomy enough for a bedroom. Breakfast was certainly adequate in all respects, though the coffee was not of the best. All the staff were extremely helpful, polite and welcoming. The Hotel is a 10 minute stroll from the Vatican and is ideally placed for exploring the city as a whole. If you choose to walk most of the key sites are within a 45 minute walk and the further ones are easily accessed using the very cheap but reliable Metro. Without doubt our highlight was Dinner in the sister hotel (Atlante Star) a 5 minute stroll away in "Les Etoiles" restaurant. The service was excellent as was the meal which we had from the "Special offer" menu. The view of St Peters Basilica was the crowning glory.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Atlante Garden for our wedding in august/september 2005. The rooms were large and comfortable, and the service was fantastic! They helped us with everything from finding lost bags at the airport to our wedding menu. I give Atlante Garden my warmest recommendations!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: laslo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in the hotel Room#238 the room was nice not big but just fine! Breakfest was good we went to the sister hotel Atlate Star how the view is beautiful! Room was clean Bathroom was nice and there was a balcony too.

Reviews.Title: “Totally average Atlante”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stunningly average in every way. The good - location 5 minutes from St Peter's Square and 7 minutes from the back of the queue into the Vatican Museum. - comfortable bed - better breakfast than we bargained for The bad - plumbing arrangements - spray the whole room with a single showerhead - don't even think of swinging a cat in the room The mysterious - the restaurant in the hotel 'next door' is in fact a block away - is very expensive but does look straight out onto St Peter's. The roof garden restaurant is closed for renovation however. Conclusion - you could do much better but I've stayed in worse.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It has been a great experience for my husband and I staying at this very nice hotel. Before arriving, I mailed them that this was a very special occasion for us, our wedding anniversary. After 15 years back to Rome and they made it a very special one. The driver picked us up from the airport. The room was spacious with jacuzzi and on our arrival we found a bottle of italian wine. Every comfort for spending a romantic weekend. Dinner at Les Etoiles, the roof garden restaurant was quite expensive but worthwhile! The view to St Peter's unbeatable, the food delicious. We definitely reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Omni”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Atlante Garden. We had a fantastic three days in July and found the facilities of this property excellent. The staff was very helpful and polite. My room was very spacious and quiet. The style of the Hotel is quite old, but is an excellent run hotel. The location is great and very safe. Good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Beetmaster
Reviews.Content: I booked for 3 nights from the 14th July 2005 for my wifes 40th birthday. We paid £256 through Thomas Cook Online and £300 flights through BA. Prior to arrival, you must telephone the hotel to take advantage of the 'free' transfer from the main airport. Our transfer was prompt and the hotel was about 40 minutes away. Upon arrival we were sent to another hotel as there was no hot water or rooms available. The staff were very vague as to when our room would be ready. Although not rude, they would just shrugg their shoulders. The transfer to the other hotel (not in there own chain) was not smooth. The taxi driver demanded payment as the hotel forgot to give him the money, and upon arrival at Hotel Jolly, they demanded I pay 174 Euros. This was eventually sorted. We returned to the Atlante Gardens the next morning as requested at 10am, however our room was not ready and had to wait another 2 hours. In effect we wasted a whole a day, this was down to the hotel. The room was clean, however lacked a towel rail and the water was alway warm. There never seemed to be any hot water. The breakfast was poor and you could believe you were at some dingy B and B in Blackpool ( no offence but it was not a £12 a night hotel!). Be warned, do not use the bar unless your minted 10 Euros for a JD and Coke - seems a bit excessive to me. I had ordered wine and flowers at extra cost, but due to no room these never turned up. The hotel offered a tranfer to the airport for 55 euros or if you book a taxi it is about 47 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from june 14-18. Good location, walking distance to the Vatican. Close to many restaurants, bars, and shopping. If you are not a walker and primarily want to see non-Vatican Rome attractions, you may want to stay on other side of river. For walkers, easy 20-25 minute walk to Spanish steps, Trevi fountain, Piazza Navona. Room was pretty spacious and clean. Eat at sister hotel's restaurant - Les Etoiles (Atlante Star hotel). View is excellent and food matches the view.

Reviews.Title: “Here's the real deal on the Atlante Garden”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip to Rome through Priceline, and it was only after our travel package was purchased that I did some research on our hotel, The Atlante Garden. I was really apprehensive and worried about the hotel after reading quite a few scathing reviews... but here's the good news! We stayed at the Atlante Garden Hotel from March 12th through March 19th, 2005, and it was JUST FINE! In fact, it was really very nice. Our room (room 238) was beautiful, very clean, with new striped beige and burgundy fabric on the walls. The bathroom was large and white marble. We had a balcony that looked out onto an interior courtyard - the room was very quiet. There was hot water every time we wanted it, the cleaning service did a great job, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We had a wonderful stay and I would like to tell everyone that it is a great hotel. Here are the drawbacks, which, as any travelers knows, are pretty minor: 1. It took an hour to wait for the free shuttle pickup at the airport - hey, it's free, we didn't mind. 2. The hotel said a taxi to the airport would cost about 44 euros - it actually cost us 55 euros, but that's our fault for not asking the taxi driver before we got in the cab. 3. No room service, but there is a mini bar/refrigerator in the room. See, like I said, pretty minor. I would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone. Make sure you surf the net for deals - we got our room for about $160 a night. Have a great stay and a great trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Insomniac heaven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from the Atlante Gardens Hotel. It claims to be a four star. Initially having booked a double room I was shown to a dark "cell sized" single room. The staff changed me to a double room., clearly the insomniac suite. Situated facing the main road from Rome to the Vatican, the room window had single glazing and the shutters would not close, hence it was like trying to sleep in the middle of a motorway. I was again moved...others in my party were not so lucky and had four sleepless nights. The decor is dark and uninviting and the paintwork chipped and breakfast plain. This hotel is not worth the money. It is good to be home!!!

Reviews.Title: “4*, think not”
Reviews.Author: indiecritic
Reviews.Content: I recently visited this hotel on 9th March and can only up-hold what has been said previously. The hotel decor was not to my taste and quite frankly wouldn't be too many.... the decor made the hotel dark and seem confined. If early mornings are your thing then this hotel's for you, either the hotel has an infestation of woodpecker's or the maids knock on doors at 6.50am. if they fail to make the grade, then the decorators ensured the drill was up and raring to go. I looked on the bright side and used the opportunity to beat the crowds to the major attractions. I didn't take advantage of the free transfer because i wasn't aware this this was available. So i transfered from the airport to the termini and caught a taxi from there, 40 euro's later, thought, 'there must be a better way'. There is, be brave, get on the metro, its 1 euro per ticket. Hotel staff were helpful and the maids efficiently sorted my messy room daily. There's no tea and coffee in the room, no iron either, but the hotel offers a next day laundry service at 3 euro's per garment. Location is every thing for this hotel, St Peters square is close by and for those energetic enough the furthest attraction the colleseum can be walked. 4* this hotel isn't, but its adequate....

Reviews.Title: “great walking location for Vatican”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a very favorable four-night stay here in February, 2005. What we liked best: very good location for ten minute walk to the Vatican, the Tiber River and the Castel San Angel; room was clean, well-stocked and comfortable (keep in mind a double bed is two singles put together); VERY generous breakfast buffet (cereal, many rolls, cold cuts/cheese, fruit, yogurts, etc....easily a $20 value given the costs in Europe these days) with a friendly staff. Desk staff was helpful (made a couple phone calls for me); free shuttle pick up at airport (took a little while to arrive but was friendly,safe and efficient...keep in mind the shuttle only works for arrival...but the desk can arrange a trip to airport for departures...it cost us 36 euros..which I guess is less than a taxi); just a 1/2 block walk to an ATM machine. What we didn't like quite as much (sort of noisy from outside but you ARE in a city), the room was a bit dark for our tastes and we missed any English tv channels (tv was in Italian and French). Overall: my wife and I decided the hotel was a very good choice for our needs and would stay there again and recommend to friends.

HotelInfo.Name: Atlante Garden Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Crescenzio 78, 00193 Rome, Italy
